Mr. Chan S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates different vegetables for a living. He faces a problem in that he does not have a water pump to irrigate his crops. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump. 

His wife, Mrs. In Sophy, 30 years old, works as seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary with which to support her family. 
This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old and not yet of school age.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water crops

loans.name: Sobeyda Yasmina

texts.es: Sobeyda tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y disfruta de su medio de vida ya que el tratar con clientes es lo que más le gusta. Sabe que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecer la gran variedad de productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, ropa en general, calzado entre otros.
texts.en: Sobeyda is 45 years old, and she sells general merchandise for a living.  She has had this business for more than 14 years, and this is not the first time she has used loans or credit to help her develop the business.  She has always defined herself as a responsible person, and she enjoys her way of life, as interacting with customers is what she likes most.  She knows that every days she has to get up early to be able to offer a wide variety of products.  She plans to use the funds from this loan to buy lip pencils, creams, perfumes, clothing, and shoes, among other things.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Milena De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Milena de los Ángeles G. E. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público “Los Velásquez” desempeñándose como Docente tiene  Veinte y cinco  años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente de la educación,  tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Milena de los Ángeles G. E. works as a teacher at Los Velásquez School.  She has worked as a teacher here for twenty-five years.  Milena has three school-age children.  She has had six loans from Ceprodel and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve her home.  The loans from Ceprodel have been a great help to her since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gravel, sand, cement and corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, who attend school. Florence has been operating a restaurant for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Florence also sells her products in a shop. Florence has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy a deep freezer. Florence's main business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and hopes for her business are to eventually buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Sobeyda Argentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Sobeyda tiene una librería en su casa de habitación desde hace 3 años donde vende artículos escolares y también sacan fotocopias 
Es el primer crédito que trabaja con ceprodel , este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cuadernos , lápices , y otros artículos ya que en esta época se inicia el año escolar en el municipio
Ella está casada y tiene a cargo a dos hijos su esposo le ayuda con remesas el cual está en un vecino país desde hace 5 años
texts.en:
Mrs. Sobeyda has a bookstore in her home where for 3 years she has sold school-related items and made photocopies.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel.  The loan will be used to buy notebooks, pencils, and other items, since this is the beginning of the school year in town.  

She is married and takes care of two children.  Her husband, who has lived in a neighboring country for five years, helps her by sending money.

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, writing tablets, pens, reams of paper, pencils

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional  important things for his general store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Justina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) junto con sus dos hijos,  ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y  su actividad económica principal es trabajar en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad del Cuso en el área de limpieza. Ya son varios años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Justina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para matricula de su hija Sharmely que está postulando a la Universidad de Nacional San Antonio Abad de la ciudad del Cusco a la carrera profesional de enfermería. 
 
Justina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Cusco Province and Department and is 35 years old.  Justina currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) with her two children.  She is a responsible mother who moves her family forward.  Her main economic activity is working as a Cleaning Lady at Cusco’s bus terminal.  She’s been in this line of work for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion Justina needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay her daughter Sharmely’s tuition at Cusco’s San Antonio Abad National University.  She’s studying Nursing.

Justina is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Estela M., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa. Negocio en el que le va muy bien y que gracias a los créditos lo ha ido mejorando poco a poco. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa y calzado el cual si Dios quiere será pronto.
M. solicito un crédito de autoestima el cual es otorgado a las clientas para su uso personal ella con el crédito se realizara un chequeo médico.
texts.en: Xiomara Estela M. is a hard working enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her clothing business.  The business is doing well, thanks to the loans she has gotten; she has been able to improve her business little by little.  She hopes to have a clothing and shoe store one day, God willing it will not be far off.  M. is asking for this loan so that she can pay for a medical exam.

loans.use: to have a medical exam

loans.name: El Algodonal Florece Group

texts.es:
Marina tiene un puesto D. venta en un mercado D. los Olivos, allí tiene su negocio  D. venta D. artículos D. belleza y ropa un negocio que ha prosperado mucho con el tiempo, cuando recién empezó solo vendía  productos D. belleza, ella es fundadora del grupo “EL ALGODONAL FLORECE” y esta agradecida porque integrar el grupo le sirvió para progresar y mejorar  su calidad D. vida además D. ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios  lo que mas desea es seguir haciéndolo hasta que se conviertan en profesionales,  durante todo este tiempo aprendió a invertir en su negocio es por ello que ahora ha logrado crecer  y tiene un negocio surtido, también cada semana viaja a provincia llevando sus productos como  chompas, casacas y pantalones. La Sra. Marina quiere seguir progresando y tener mas tiendas en esta ocasión invertirá su préstamo para la compra D. ropa D. invierno aprovechando que se avecina la temporada  D. frío, ella es la tesorera del grupo “EL ALGODONAL FLORECE”.
* Marina es la ultima D. la foto aparece con chompa blanca con coquitos.
texts.en: Marina has a sales position the market of los Olivos.  There she has her business of selling beauty supplies and clothing; a business that has prospered much with time.  When she started it not long ago, she only sold beauty products.  She is the founder of the group called "EL ALGODONAL FLORECE" ("THE COTTON PLANTATION FLOURISHES") and is thankful because assembling the group helped her to progress and to improve her quality of life as well as help her children in their studies.  What she most desires is to continue doing this until they become professionals.  During all this time she has learned to invest in her business.  It is because of this that she has now managed to grow and to have a well supplied business. In addition, each week she travels in the country carrying her products such as sweaters, coats and pants.  Señora Maria wants to continue progressing and to have more stores.  On this occasion she will invest her loan in the purchase of winter clothes, taking advantage of the fact that the season of cold approaches.  She is the treasurer of the group "EL ALGODONAL FLORECE" .  Maria is the last one on the right in the photo.  She appears with a white seater with diamonds on it.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Concepción Del Socorro

texts.es:
Uno de los sueños que ha tenido la señora Concepción es la de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y por este motivo es que ella se esfuerza a diario porque está consciente que su sueño pronto lo logrará. 

Para esto, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como arena, bloque, hierro, estribo. Ella está confiando que su crédito le sea otorgado para arrancar con la obra de reconstrucción para su vivienda que tanto lo necesita y así cumplir sus sueños. 

Es menester mencionar que el crédito le ayudará mucho porque ella tiene una gran capacidad para administrar y así dirigirá la obra hasta terminarla satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
One of Concepcion's dreams has been to improve her living conditions and that is why she works so hard every day.

Therefore, she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel (Kiva field partner) to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, concrete blocks, iron, and posts. She is confident that her loan will be offered in a way that will allow her to begin the necessary reconstruction effort in her home, which will allow her to achieve her dreams. 

It is appropriate to mention that the loan will help her very much because she is highly capable of administrating the work and directing the job until it is done to her satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Sani. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 14. In 2001, she established her vegetable-farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Coka Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her late 20s, is single. She has a small general store, which she has run for six months. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Irene's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day own a grocery where she can sell drinks and snacks. Irene will share this loan with her loan group "Coka Kiwalani," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He sells cattle.  As a rule, Ayyub purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

After being in this business for 6 years, he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them very well.  Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.  His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.  With the first loan from AqroInvest Ayyub were able to purchase more animals and increase his income.

Ayyub is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle.  For this purpose, he requests 1,500 AZN loan that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a hardworking and active 33-year-old business lady. She is single and has three children aged fifteen, eleven and five going to school. Previously, Naomi was a house wife, but for the past six years she has been operating a beauty salon.

Naomi is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids, weaves and oils. In five years she hopes to have a big salon as well as to sell beauty products. She feels that with the extra income from her business she will be able to realize her dream of opening up a beauty college.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, weaves and oils.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

José desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), cuenta con 30 ovejas en su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener su peso y talla ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga las  ganancias necesarias para solventar sus gastos personales. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para engordar a sus animales y mejorar su corral de sus ovejas, al venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes sus ingresos aumentarán para poder pagar su crédito y realizar algunos objetivos que se a trazado.  José es una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelnte con su propio esfuerzo y de paso ayudar económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and single.  He lives in his parents’ home, located in the rural district of Tambogrande, which is part of the Piura department.  The home does not have running water or electricity.  This zone is known for its farming, livestock, and arts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for several years and currently has 30 sheep in his corral, located a few minutes from his home.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural grasses so that they reach the ideal size and weight and he can sell them in the different markets within the zone.  In this way he earns the money necessary to pay his personal expenses.

He is asking for this loan of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa so he can buy balanced feed to fatten up his animals and sell them for better prices.  He also wants to make improvements to his corral.  This way, he can increase his income and be able to repay his loan and complete some other projects that he is behind on.  José is a hard working person with a desire to get ahead and help his parents financially through his own efforts.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch, 35, is self-reliant and hardworking. He is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. Since 2006, he has been running a retail shop to make ends meet for his family. He makes extra income from the salary he gets from working as a a security officer. 

He wants in the next five years to have accumulated enough income so as to educate his children. His dream is to acquire a piece of land and build rental houses. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and sodas. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the financial management training.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and sodas.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. 

For the past 10 years Muhabbat has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed was ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up, and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. 

Currently Muhabbat has requested a loan in the size of $1000 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. She truly appreciates your generosity.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and electrical supplies

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 38 years old, married and has three children.  For seven years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  Besides this, she grows coffee so as to generate more income for her family.  So far she has serviced three loans from Faulu Kenya which has helped her to improve her business.  

She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and married with four children. Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Nida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the recycled materials business for five years and also earns an income from candy making.

Nida aspires to save enough money to buy motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: To buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Juan, an overseas Filipino worker, and is the mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also does some direct selling. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 23-year-old married man with one child and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second hand clothes for six years. He started with UGX 3,000,000 and now has UGX 6,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is a lack of enough capital to meet the different tastes of his customers and his vision is a wholesale shop plus educating children. Richard intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is a 50-year-old divorced mother of seven. She raises baby chicks. Samiha is a vibrant women determined to earn her own way and help her children. She manages to increase her monthly income with her business activity.

Samiha needed this loan to purchase additional chicks and feed and renovate the hutch where she raises them.

In the future Samiha wants to further expand her business and branch out to sell her chickens to mini markets and additional venues. She lays great importance in putting aside savings for her children and her future.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicks and feed and renovate the hutch where she raises them.

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 24 years old and married to a commercial agent. Together with her husband, she brings up two children who are both under the age of seven.  Elmira’s mother helps her take care of the children. 

In order to earn money, Elmira works as an operator in a mobile company. A year ago she saved 10,000 KGS from her salary and purchased livestock. Since that time she has been breeding, fattening and selling livestock to earn additional income to meet the family's needs. With the money she receives from this loan, she wants to purchase more livestock to breed, fatten and sell. In the future Elmira plans to save enough money to purchase an apartment. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Star B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Star B Group in Western Kenya! Emily is the facilitator of the Star B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Emily takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access quality farm inputs and have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Emily had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest 3 1/2 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Emily will build a house and ensure food security.

Emily is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Michael Mariano

texts.es:
Michael Mariano tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre con la pareja, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9 y 10 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Michael se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 15 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para tener capital para invertir en la agricultura y poder comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá contar con capital. El sueño es poder tener una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.

Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR HA MEJORADO EL ESTILO DE VIDA DE LA FAMILIA, Los ingresos han aumentado para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Michael Mariano, 32, lives with his common-law wife and their children, 9 and 10, in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.
The VRC Jerusalen communal bank is in the El Caimito area, Puerto Pechico parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  This branch works with farmers who plant  short term cycle crops of corn, rice, beans, and pigeon peas.

Michael has been a corn farmer for the last 15 years.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.  He is requesting a loan to have working capital for the farming and to be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure.
The loan will help him with the capital.  His dream is to have his own house if no problems appear.  
In his free time he takes part in sports.

With the help of the previous loan he has improved the standard of living for his family.  His income has increased and that has benefited his family.

loans.use: to have working capital to invest in his farming to be able to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza, 32, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

For the past five years Anna Liza has planted, harvested, and sold bananas to earn a living. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from doing so. Anna Liza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

In the future, Anna Liza wants to make improvements on her house and put her children through school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor  Fernando  es un señor trabajador   se dedica a la venta de  artículos domésticos  desde hace cuatro años.
Esta felizmente  casado con la señora Demetria  quien también se dedica a la venta de  artículos domésticos como  es :  escoba,trapeador,rastrillos ,cubetas ,detergentes.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas artículos para el hogar.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir con su negocio y engrandecer  su negocio.
texts.en:
Fernando is a hardworking man.  He has worked for four years selling household items.  He is happily married to Demetria, who also works selling household items such as brooms, mops, rakes, buckets, and detergent.

He requested the loan to buy more household articles.

He thanks the foundation for the support it has given him to continue with and enlarge his business.

loans.use: to buy household articles to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 36 años es un responsable padre de familia. Vive en compañía de su esposa Dora, con quien vive desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Sherly y Maricielo; a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Trancapampa. El trabajo al que se dedica en las mañanas, consiste en el mantenimiento de carreteras; pues las lluvias deterioran el paso de los autos, con lodo. Gracias a este trabajo adquiere un dinero extra, ya que recibe un sueldo mensual de parte del gobierno de su localidad. Pero su principal actividad económica es la ganadería. Cuenta con 7 vacas, de buena calidad; las que le brindan leche; que utiliza para la elaboración de quesos pequeños o llamados “bolillos”. Además, los comerciantes de leche fresca, compran por litros; la leche que producen sus ganados; ya que es muy buena. Por otra parte, su esposa le ayuda en el cuidado de sus sembríos de papa, que también cultiva, para su consumo propio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen maría” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca; para incrementar su ganado.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 36, is a responsible family man. He lives with his wife of 17 years, Dora, and their two children, Sherly and Maricielo, in their own home. They live in the hamlet of Trancapampa. In the mornings, he works on road maintenance; the rains and traffic wear on the roads, and mud builds up. Thanks to this work, he makes extra money; he receives a monthly salary from the local government. However, his main income comes from livestock. He has seven good-quality dairy cows. He uses their milk for making small cheeses called "bolillos". His milk is also bought by the litre by milk merchants because it is very good. 
His wife helps him by caring for their potato crops, which they cultivate for personal consumption. Carlos belongs to the "Virgen Maria" communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to have this financial support, because it will ensure that he can continue with his business. He promises to repay his quotas. He is very happy to be part of his communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and united. Upon receiving your support, Carlos will invest this money in the purchase of a cow to increase his holdings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, tiene 25 años, es dueño de un taller donde elaboran artesanías y telares, tiene un hijo, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, lo que mas le gusta de Finca es que puede ahorrar y esta muy bien en su negocio, ahora lo que él desea es poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender al público, porque ahora solo vende al por mayor, todo lo que aprendió en Finca lo puso en práctica y esa es la razón de su éxito, las capacitaciones le hacen reflexionar y lo aplico en su vida personal, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de lana e insumos para el teñido de los telares.
texts.en: Wilber is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Margaritas (Daisies Communal Bank), he is 25 years old, and he owns a workshop where he creates handicrafts and weavings. He has a son and he has been a member of Finca Peru for 3 years. What he likes the most about Finca is the fact that he is able to save and his activity is going very well. He now dreams of owing a shop where to sell his products to the general public, as he currently sells in bulks only. He has put into practice everything he has learned in Finca, and this is the reason of his success. The training seminars help him making considerations he then also applies to his personal life. He will invest this loan in the purchase of wool and supplies to dye his weavings.

loans.use: To buy wool and supplies to dye his weavings.

loans.name: Tua

texts.en: Tua is a 19-year-old woman who is married with no children. She has a small business, doing Ava Samoa liquid store. She has 2 years with this business. Tua needs a loan to buy more ava samoa, plastic bags, labels and etc. She will use her profits to expand the business. Tua joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: plastic bags, labels, gloves,..

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 5 years and 16 years. She sells cereals, i.e  maize, and beans to earn an income. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are the locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport costs.

Sabina will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of maize and cow peas for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy maize and cow to sell

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a 26-year-old widow. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for her two children.

For the past three years, she has operated a small shop business, selling consumable goods from home to local neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a big shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alba Dolores

texts.es: Doña Alba de 42 años de edad, se dedica a la Venta de Ropa Usada a personas de las Comunidades cercanas en el Municipio del Rama, cuenta con buena clientela.  Siendo una persona de escasos recursos económicos sin una profesión y ante la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida inició esta actividad comercial al ver que la venta de gallinas gordas no era tan rentable y los encargos no son frecuente, ella piensa que diversificando sus actividades superará las necesidades básicas del hogar, poco a poco ha venido consolidando en el mercado, aunque a veces se le presentan dificultades en su rutina sobre todo en tiempos lluviosos los ríos se llenan y no logra vender lo planificado en los dos días de la semana que tiene destinado hacer esta labor; con la Ayuda de Dios y empeño propio su Negocio ha crecido mucho en poco tiempo y tiene más demanda piensa ampliar su capital de trabaja con este préstamo comprando tres pacas de ropa Usada Americana y así poder satisfacer la demanda con el fin de tener inversión que le permita operar en el mercado para el bien de su familia sin descuidar la atención a su Granja que por ahora esta solo mantenida aprovecha los tiempos libres de sus hijos quienes han aprendido mucho de estos trabajos y esta segura poder superar esta situación económica obteniendo el financiamiento mediante Kiva.

loans.use: Comprar tres pacas de ropa americana usada para vender y tener soporte económico que le permite el desarrollo familiar.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation  as her major challenge. Purity dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail is 31 years old with an entrepreneurial spirit.  Everyone in his village of Cabaiesti, and most rural areas throughout Moldova grew up around farm animals.  Most families in rural Moldova will have a small garden behind their house, chickens, possibly a few cows or a pig and maybe a horse for a carriage to help with daily activities and transportation (Most of these houses do not have running water, gas or plumbing and rely on an outhouse as a toilette). Mihail’s family has always had a small farm, but he has not been involved in more commercial production. He would like to start now, having seen others in the area become successful entrepreneurs in raising animals. His brother owns a large barn formerly used in a collective farm, which, is already outfitted with most of the necessary equipment he needs and is an ideal location for Mihail’s planned business. The operation would encompass 30 sheep, which would be used for milk production, cheese making called Brinza, as well as for wool, and 10 calves, which would be raised in part for reproduction and in part for meat. Mihail already has land on which he grows wheat and hay, which will serve as good feed for all the animals. He has thought through the market prices for the various products he will have and is aware of the risk involved should they change, but believes he will be able to make a decent profit. He needs a loan to purchase the animals and begin his new farm!

loans.use: To buy 30 sheep and 10 calves

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana’s family consists of her husband and two grown sons. Nearly 10 years ago she decided to open a little wall-paper kiosk, a business she says was her calling. She was able to purchase a kiosk in the very center of the market that is easily accessible to many shoppers. Today, Tatyana’s business yields $450 a month in profit with an investment of $2,000 in inventory. Tatyana sees a great opportunity for business grown as spring approaches. Wall-papering is a very popular way to decorate in Ukraine and many people are ready to begin remodeling work after the cold and wet winter months are past. Tatyana’s expertise in quality wall-paper is greatly appreciated by her customers. Her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. On a personal level, Tatyana desires to invest her earned profits into her son’s college education. Tatyana has requested a loan for $1,000 to broaden the assortment of wall-paper she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Tatyana as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих синів. Майже 10 років тому вона вирішила відкрити власний бізнес з продажу шпалер, відчувала, що це – її покликання. Вона викупила кіоск в центрі ринку, завдяки зручному розташуванню з’явилося багато покупців. Зараз Тетяна отримує приблизно 450 доларів прибутку щомісяця, в товар в неї вкладено 2000 доларів. Тетяна розуміє, що навесні торгівля буде збільшуватися. Навесні, після холодного зимового періоду, багато людей роблять ремонт у власних оселях, використовуючи для цього різноманітні шпалери. Тетяна знається на своєму товарі, це дуже цінують її покупці. Бажання допомогти кожному клієнту та талант підприємця сприяють успіху її бізнесу. Тетяна піклується про потреби родини, а, отже, планує вкласти частину отриманого від торгівлі прибутку у навчання сина в університеті. Тетяна просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент шпалер та підготуватися до весняного сезону. Вона – дуже надійний клієнт, давно працює з „Надією України”. Ця позика допоможе Тетяні досягти своєї мети та розширити власний бізнес.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Mrs. Fidelia U. is 25 years old, and is married with six (6) children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells plastic coolers and wrappers to the people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $650 for business expansion.

loans.use:
To buy more plastic coolers &
 wrappers to sell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun S. is 51 years old, mother of five children, and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is employed in a garment factory, while her husband is a farmer planting rice and various kinds of vegetables. Together, they earn approximately $6 each day. Mrs. Sun S. has currently requested a loan to purchase a motorcycle, so that it can be used to reduce expenses for her family's transportation. This is a picture of two of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to facilitate her family's transportation

loans.name: Mayra Iracema

texts.es:
Mayra is married and has three children and her husband is an artisan. It's hard for him to earn enough money to cover all the family's expenses, so 5 years ago, Mayra started helping a neighbor with selling shoes. At that time her husband became unemployed, and they were unable to make enough money for the family. Little by little, Mayra improved her business skills and opened her own shop.

Mayra is asking for a loan of $275 USD to buy shoes and to be able to continue supporting her family financially any way she can through her business. She will pay back the loan in a term of six months. She and her family thank you a lot for your support that allows them to keep going and to improve their quality of life.

Note: This picture shows Mayra holding the catalog she uses to sell shoes for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva volunteer.

Mayra es una persona casada con tres hijos su esposo es obrero y por lo tanto es muy difícil solventar él solo los gastos de su familia, hace 5 años ella empezó ayudando a una vecina en la venta de calzado ya que en ese tiempo su esposo estaba desempleado y no tenían solvencia económica para poder mantener a su familia y poco a poco fue agarrándole el gusto al negocio de venta de calzado después se independizo y comenzó su negocio propio de venta de calzado.

Mayra esta solicitando un préstamo de USD $ 275 para compra de calzado y poder seguir aportando a su familia económicamente y de alguna manera seguir adelante con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses, ella y su familia agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder seguir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of New Motorcycle, type BAJAJ-BOXER- CC100 Indian make.

loans.name: Margarita's Group

texts.es:
Margarita, Sara, and Maria Elena have been partners in the communal bank “Paloma” for two, three, and eight years respectively. Margarita and Maria Elena are single, while Sara lives with her partner and has three children. At first, Margarita ran a bar, but after observing that her neighbors requested other products, she decided to turn her business into a grocery store. On the other hand, Sara sells all-natural Omnilife products and also has a hardware store in the city of Lima, which is run by her husband. Maria Elena sells fruit, an activity that she has performed for ten years in the Nery García Zarate market in Ayacucho. Their loans are for 400 soles, 2000 soles, and 400 soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, eggs, milk, plantains, mangos, grapes, apples, and Omnilife products. They will use their savings to purchase display cases, tools, and to handle any family emergency that may arise. Margarita, Sara, and Maria Elena say that in the communal bank, they practice values such as team spirit and punctuality, and the colleagues are very united and support each other whenever one has a problem. Margarita’s, Sara’s, and Maria Elena’s dreams are to have a mini-market, a hardware store, a restaurant in the countryside, and a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita, Sara y Maria Elena son socias del Banco Comunal Paloma desde hace 2, 3 y 8 años respectivamente. Margarita y Maria Elena son solteras, mientras que Sara es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. En un inicio, Margarita tenía un bar, pero al observar que sus vecinos pedían otros productos decidió implementar su negocio en una bodega. Por otro lado Sara vende productos Omnilife, que son productos naturales y además tiene una ferretería en la ciudad de Lima, el cual es administrado por su esposo. Mientras que el negocio de Maria Elena es la venta de frutas, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años en el mercado Nery García Zarate en Ayacucho. Sus préstamos son de 400 soles, 2000 soles y 400 soles respectivamente, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevo, leche, plátano, mango, uva, manzana y productos Omnilife. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para comprar vitrinas, artefactos y para alguna emergencia que se pueda presentar en la familia. Margarita, Sara y Maria Elena dicen que en su Banco Comunal se práctica los valores como la solidaridad, la puntualidad y las socias son muy unidas y se apoyan cuando alguien tiene algún problema. Los sueños de Margarita, Sara y Maria Elena son tener un minimarket, una ferretería, un restaurante campestre y un local propio.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstock, fruits, and Omnilife products for their respective stores

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, a nurse by profession, owns a store for the sale of drugs. She is 38 years old, married with 2 children, and she is the leader of her Union and resides in Benin City. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more drugs to sell in her pharmacy. This, she hopes, will increase the quanity and quality of sales. She has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals to sell

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Zuhra A. lives in the city of Somgar. She is 31 and has 3 children. She has been raising cattle for the past 10 years. She currently owns 6 cows 2 of which are milk cows. Zuhra milks the cows twice a day and obtains 5 liters of milk in the morning and 5 in the evening from each cow. In this way she obtains 20 liters of milk per day. She uses the milk to make kifir and sower cream, that she sells in the market. She wishes to use the loan to purchase 2 additional cows.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

Зухра Абдушукурова проживает в Сомгаре , возрост 31 год имеет 3 детей .Уже 10 лет как занимается уходом и откормом скота.На данный момент имеет 6 коров из которых 2 буренки дающщие молоко.Зухра в день 2 раза доит корову с которой получает 5 литров утором с одной и 5 литров вечером.В общем имеет в день 20 шлитров молока.Из молока она заготавливает домашний кифир и сметану,которые продает оптом на базаре.Получив займ хочет купить еще 2 коровы.

loans.use: Cattle raising

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria.

Stella sells provisions and foodstuffs in her store. She has been in business for 12 years. Stella needs a loan in the amount of $525 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío has belonged to the Community Bank November 28th for two years. Rocío lives in the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Rocío is married, 31 years old and has three children. Together with her spouse, Rocío manufactures handicraft tiles, which she sells through distributors. Rocío also has a small grocery store in her house. In addition, Rocío travels to markets where she sells fruits and buys grains that are sold afterwards in the market of Nery García.

Rocío needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to purchase firewood, coal, grains and to pay laborers.

The dreams of Rocío are that her children finish their studies, she has a house in the city of Ayacucho and that her businesses grow.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío pertenece al Banco Comunal 28 de noviembre hace 2 años, Rocío vive en el Distrito de Acosvinchos que esta a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Rocío es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Rocío junto a su esposo fabrican tejas artesanales, sus ventas lo realizan a intermediarios. También Rocío tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Rocío viaja a las ferias donde vende frutas y en las feria compra cereales que son vendidos posteriormente en el mercado Nery García.

Rocío necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, carbón, cereales y para el pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Rocío son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus negocios crezcan.

loans.use: Rocío needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to buy firewood, coal, grains and to pay laborers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria and her husband work daily to repair all kinds of metal objects and to construct doors and windows. They work with the single objective of starting a store that sells hardware items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Victoria y su esposo trabajan diariamente reparando todo tipo de construcciones metálicas y construyendo puertas y ventanas. Laboran con el único objetivo de instalar pronto una tienda de venta de artículos ferreteros.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity of tools

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a loving and hard-working wife and mother. Every day she goes out with her beloved husband to care for their crops with the end goal of selling excellent products at the market. Her desire to improve their lives has led her to expand the crop fields. In order to do this she needs a loan to buy natural fertilizers so that her crops are of high quality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

RAQUEL, es una madre y esposa cariñosa y trabajadora, a diario se desplaza con su amado esposo hacia sus terrenos D. cultivo con el propósito D. cuidarlas a fin D. obtener excelentes productos D. acuerdo a la exigencia D. sus clientes en el mercado.Sus deseos D. mejora la han llevado a ampliar sus campos D. labor diaria y debido a esto es su petición D. un préstamo ya que le urge adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales que garantizarán la calidad D. sus frutos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita S. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in businesses like grocery shops, utensil shops, etc. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a laborer in house construction work. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter and son took SLC (school-leaving certificates) recently, and her younger daughter is in grade 9.
Mrs. S. opened her grocery shop five years ago. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, noodles, biscuits and others. Nowadays they are facing financial problems because competition is very high, so in order to stay in their business they need to add different varieties of goods for their shop. But due to lack of funds she cannot buy goods for her shop. So Mrs. S. is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15,000 US$225) to buy different varieties of grocery goods for their shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ochiloy

texts.en:
Ochiloy I. is 37 years old. She is divorced and the mother of three children. After the divorce from her husband, Ochiloy had to find ways to provide for herself and her three children. For ten years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread “lepeshka”. It has now become a family business as the children of Ochiloy are grown-up and they are helping their mother.

Ochiloy is a cheerful, hard worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid two loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. Today Ochiloy is requesting a loan of 1000 USD with a term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour and coal required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more so she can provide her children with a good education. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing flour and coal required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị  có 5 người con trong đó 2 người con đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định. Năm 2003 chị Tham gia vào Quỹ để vay vốn đầu tư thêm vào kinh doanh. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là kinh doanh các mặt hàng làm từ tre, nứa. Do có nhiều kinh nghiệm trong việc nắm bắt nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân điạ phương nên của  hàng của gia đình chị ngày càng đa dạng về hàng hoá và phục vụ được ngày càng nhiều khách hàng. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình ngoài kinh doanh chị Hải còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Với mức thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi và kinh doanh cuộc sống của gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện, các con của chị cũng được đầu tư tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Hai, 45 years old, has 5 children. 2 of them are grown-up and have stable jobs. In 2003, Mrs. Hai joined the TYM Fund to expand her inventory for business. Currently, her main source of income is from selling products made from bamboo. With her experiences and ability to foresee the demand of the villagers, she has made and sold more and more products. To increase her family's income, she also raises livestock. As such, her family's standard of living has been improving and her children are better taken care of. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1150USD) to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make and sell bamboo products

loans.name: Barnogul

texts.ru: Усманова Барногул жительница района Дж.Руми.Возраст 38 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка на рынке района  Дж.Руми имеет торговую точку.Барногул торгует детской одеждой.Она закупает у оптовиков товар и реализует в розницу.Так как на свой товар ставит небольшую наценку  постоянных клиентов у нее много.В данный момент Барногул хочет расширить свой бизнес,пополнив ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Barnogul U. lives in the J. Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old and is married with two children. Barnogul is a high-school graduate who makes a living selling children's clothes at the local market. She buys clothes wholesale and sells them retail. Since her prices are reasonable, she has many regular customers. At present Barnogul would like to expand her business. She is applying for a loan that she plans to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the offer

loans.name: Naza

texts.en: Naza was born in 1965. She currently lives in Gračanica, but she is a war refugee from Srebrenica. She is a widow, with two children. Her adult son works as a driver, and her younger daughter attends secondary school.  To support her family, Naza has a vegetable garden and raises chickens seasonally. Naza requests a 1,500KM ($975 USD) loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy chickens and chicken feed. The additional income will be used to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 64 años D. edad y es madre D. 4 hijos, es casada. Asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización  durante 3 meses. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro una vaca para engorD., dedicándose hoy en día a la crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y con parte D. sus ahorros comprara un ganado vacuno (toro) que pagara en 5 cuotas .

Ella desea continuara con su negocio y al mismo tiempo trabajar en  labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is one of the founding members of the communal bank „Espiritu Santo” in Centro Poblado D. Chimbo in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old, married and has four children. She has attended the Literacy Program for three months. With the first loan of 200 soles she increased her capital and bought a cow, today she deals with raising cows. With the loan of 1500 soles that she is requesting now and with part of her savings Gregoria will buy a bull. She will pay this amount back in five installments. She would like to continue raising cows and at the same time do agricultural work.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives with her husband, one son and one daughter in Kritipur, Kathmandu. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M., is a microbus driver. Her son is studying in grade 3 and her daughter is only 6 month’s old. Mrs. Laxmi M. opened her small restaurant 2 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She makes Newari foods in her restaurant because Newari food is very popular and tasty to eat. Now she is requesting a Rs 20000 loan to buyingredients for her work.

She wants to use her income to provide good education for her children because in Nepal the cost of education is very high.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly L. was born in 1978 and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She currently sells pasted-fish, meatballs, and dried-fish at the market. She started this business a long time ago. She looks after of two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. To help meet the family's living expenses, her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He also assists his wife with selling fish. To reduce the cost of transportation in the business, L. is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle. The motorcycle will be used to transport fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 28 años es casada, vive con su hermano y su hijo, por motivos de trabajo su pareja no está con ella. Tiene una microempresa familiar que presta servicios de fumigación, el cual viene funcionando hace 10 meses en  su casa, pues instaló una oficina para atender a sus clientes quienes estan muy contentos por los servicios que prestan Elizabeth y su hermano. Pero el escaso capital de inversión limita que puedan atender a sus clientes ya que no cuentan con los insumos necesarios para las fumigaciones. Sin embargo, sigue adelante tratando de brindar los mejores servicios con los escasos  productos que cuenta, pues gracias a su negocio puede estar junto a su familia, sobre todo con su pequeño hijo, sin descuidar  su actividad como  empresaria, pues ha podido mantener esta micro empresa rentable, y está segura que con el tiempo se consolidará como una empresa de servicios más prospera y rentable. Elizabeth viene trabajando con MFP hace tres años y está muy contenta con el respaldo económico que tiene en esta institución. Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado invertir en la compra de grandes cantidades de extintores que elevarían sus ganancias, sobre todo en la compra de maquinaria que la ayude a prestar servicios a locales más grandes y hacer el mantenimiento adecuado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28, married, and lives with her brother and son. Because of his work, her husband does not live with her right now. She has a small family business that offers fumigation services. She has been running the business out of her home for the past 10 months, in an office that she put in to attend to her customers. Everyone is very content with the service Elizabeth and her brother have been offering. But the lack of investment capital limits the customers they can serve because they don’t have the necessary supplies for fumigation. However, they keep moving forward by offering the best service possible with the resources that they have. Thanks to this business she is able to be with her family, especially her young son, without having to give up her job as a businesswoman. She has been able to make this a profitable business and she is sure that in the future it will be an even more prosperous company. Elizabeth has worked with MFP for 3 years and is very happy with the financial support this institution offers. With the money from this loan she will invest in large quantities of sprayers that will increase her earnings. Buying the machines will help her serve more locations and perform routine maintenance. help her serve more locations and perform routine maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fumigation sprayers

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Chhet M., 49, is a widow who lives with three of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a housewife who stays at home doing housework. She is aided by two children who work at a hotel: one as a cleaner and the other as a waiter. These two children can make USD $6 per day. Mrs. Chhet M. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. This will eliminate their main daily expense--the cost of public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: Aquiles tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su hijo en casa de su madre. Desde niño demostró inclinación por la agricultura, siempre ha tratado de ser muy responsable, y todas sus siembra actuales son de 25 a 30 sacos de papa en chacras temporales, y en zonas de regadío cultiva alverjas y maíz. Aquiles está muy contento con las labores agrícolas, cuando termina a tiempo de trabajar sus cultivos, en su afán de retribuir el esfuerzo de su padre, acude a apoyarlo en sus cultivos. De todo el proceso agrícola lo que más le gusta es la comercialización, porque siempre lleva la esperanza de encontrar un buen precio para sus productos. Pero una vez en el mercado, dice volverse un poco torpe, algunas veces pierde la contabilidad, por ello siempre trata de apoyarse con sus apuntes. Aquiles es el presidente de su banco comunal, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable, tanto en sus funciones como en sus pagos. El crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para comprar fertilizantes para el abonado de sus diversas siembras.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in his mother’s home. From a young age he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. He has always tried to be very responsible and today he has a crop of 25-30 sacks of potatoes that he grows in transitional fields. He also grows beans and corn in irrigated fields. Aquiles is very content with his farmwork. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Aquiles always tries to help him out with some pointers. Aquiles is the president of his community bank and this is his 8th loan with MFP. In all of this time he has proven to be very responsible, both in his duties and in his payments. The loan he is asking for is to purchase fertilizer for his varied crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi D. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicines and provisions to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora Q., a 58-year-old housewife with 4 children is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occ. Her husband is a farmer, and she decided to venture into business to augment the family's income.  Her loyal cutomers are her neighbors and friends. In the future she hopes that her growing business can send her children to college.

loans.use: Additional stocks for her mini store

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thủy Bích Lý was born in 1962 and has two children. She sells fruit in the market, and she breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthL. income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to buy more fruit to sell and to buy food for her pigs. 

Thủy Bích Lý is a group leader. There are five other Fund participants in her group: 

Hoan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1966. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to buy food for pigs and poultry.

Chiến Thị Ngô was born in 1978. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

Doanh Thị Lưu was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to breed chickens.
 
Xuân Thị Trịnh was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to raise pigs.

Duyên Thị Tạ was born in 1959. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell and buy food for pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is a married mother of six children, three sons and three daughters, who are all currently in junior high and primary school. She is forty years old and lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. Cecilia is a baker. She bakes bread in her community, supplying retailers and beverage sellers, and she also hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients in Kumasi. Cecilia has been in business for three years and requests a loan to buy ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Jovia Kyomugabi Group

texts.en:
Jovia is the leader of a five-member group. She is a 40 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 20 years. Both of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is living with four people. She also takes care of one additional family member. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Jovia resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells in Wandegeya Mulago Triangle, one of Kampala’s suburbs. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she buys from her place of work and does her shopping once a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both home and business premises.

Jovia sells mainly on retail. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. Besides the beer business, she owns a telephone booth.

Jovia has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer. Jovia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a native of Cardona, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is 29 and has two boys. She is married to Noel, a fisherman, who is also 29. Vanessa wants to help her husband in earning income for their family.
In 2008, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She used her previous loans for her fishing business. Since Cardona is a coastal municipality and the main source of income for the people is fishing, she wants to continue her fishing business and continue putting additional investment into it. Now on her third loan, she requests a loan of 14,000 pesos as additional capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 10 bundles of fish nets, rope, threads for fishing gear and also for the maintenance of her boat.
She is looking forward for a sustainable and profitable business. She also dreams of having her own house, and to be able to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: To pay for 10 bundles of fish nets, rope, threads for fishing gears and also for the maintenance of her boat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda started her general store after she married Martin. The couple is blessed with six children – five of them are in school. Their eldest is already working in Manila as a factory worker. Erlinda and her family live in the village of San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. Their main dialect is Ybanag, the local language in their place.

Erlinda wants to borrow 10,000 PHP as additional business capital for her store. She plans to use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store to meet the demands of her customers. Although her business is not that big, it contributes a lot to sending her children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for a general store

loans.name: Teth

texts.en: Teth S., 41, has five children, most of whom work at a water company. Her husband is a domestic fisherman and a casual worker. Teth has many different jobs. She raises female ducks to sell the eggs, and raises pigs for slaughter. In addition, she always cultivates a rice crop during the farming season. Teth operates her businesses very well. Recently, her stock of animal food has become exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, HKL, to purchase more food to continue feeding her animals.

loans.use: To purchase more food to continue feeding her animals

loans.name: Davaadolgor

texts.en:
D. Davaadolgor is 39 years old and lives with her husband in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She currently operates a clothing retail business with her husband at a shop in her town. For her business, Davaadolgor must travel to the Chinese border city of Erlian to purchase her goods and transport them back to her shop.

Davaadolgor started her clothing business in 1996 by selling her products at the local market. She quickly found success and expanded her business. Davaadolgor and her husband are very hardworking people and have used their business to greatly improve their quality of life. Her business has developed a positive reputation throughout the community and has achieved stable operations. Today, Davaadolgor's working capital exceeds 4,500,000 tugrugs (~3180 USD).

For the future, Davaadolgor hopes to expand her business further by purchasing a wider variety of clothing items to sell. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat d'igname et de maïs

loans.name: Luis Santiago

texts.es: Luis Santiago tiene 34 años es un hombre muy trabajador y le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 18 años que con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su propio negocio, y además aportar ciertas ganancias para su familia, Luis tiene 3 hijos y necesitaban estudios, ropa y alimentación como un padre responsable tenía que buscar los ingresos necesarios con mucho empeño y dedicación logro mantener este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de electrodomésticos, calzado, ropa interior y pantalones. El deseo de Luis es brindarle a su familia los servicios necesarios.
texts.en:
Luis Santiago is a 34-year-old, hard-working, man who enjoys his work very much. He has sold general merchandise for the last 18 years and through his efforts has managed to own his own business and provide certain earning for his family. Luis has 3 children who needed clothing, food, and education. As a responsible parent he knew he needed to earn the necessary income to provide for them and his dedication and effort allowed for him to have this business. The funding he is requesting will be working capital with which he will buy electrical appliances, footwear, underwear and pants. He hopes to provide his family with the necessary services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 37 years old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Sophia works to support her husband to provide for the family. Sophia is a trader. She is in the palm-oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. Sophia also sells at the local market and treks as well. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Gotitas del Roció II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Casada, tiene 25 años y próximamente mamá de 01 bebe.

Lleva 01 año, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Rosa Patricia, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, siendo muy joven le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Rosa Patricia belongs to the community bank “Gotitas del Roció II,” located in the Bagua District, Utcubamba Province, in the Amazonas Department. She is married, is 25 years old, and will soon be a mom. She has operated a rickshaw service for a year now. Her husband does the driving around town and she has saved to buy replacement parts and provide better service to the community. With the loan of PEN 1,000 she will buy parts, such as spark plugs and a steering column, will replace the oil, and buy lubricants, so that she can provide better service to her customers. Today, Rosa is an independent woman, and she and her husband make all the business decisions and manage the business operations. Rosa Patricia tells us that belonging to a group of women being so young, has helped her to learn about her rights, and that as a bloc, the women ensure those rights are respected. She thanks Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her in her beginnings as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying auto parts

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel R. se dedica a la actividad de transporte selectivo por medio de su taxi que a diario maneja en el departamento de León siendo esta actividad la que le permite adquirir el capital para invertirlo en el bienestar de su familia.
A diario lleva a cabo el trabajo en el taxi llevando a las personas de un lugar a otro y hoy en día ha luchado más por mejorar su actividad y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito porque necesita invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus tres hijos que tiene y para ello requiere reconstruir la vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en malas condiciones y con únicamente la ayuda de la ganancia del trabajo en el taxi no es lo suficiente para mejorar su vivienda.
Es por esto que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera dar lugar a la reconstrucción de la vivienda y continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel R. drives a taxi. He works every day in the area of Leon, earning as much as he can to support his family. Each day he transports people around the city, but lately he has had to fight harder to find work.
