He has joined with Ceprodel to request a loan to help improve the living conditions for his 3 children. Their home has been in bad condition for a long time, and the income he earns from driving the taxi is not sufficient to make the repairs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to continue to improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs on his home and improve the quality of life for his children

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: G. Thérèse est née en 1947. Thérèse vit depuis 7 ans environs à Djissoukpa, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve, ayant à sa charge deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Thérèse vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Thérèse n’a pas été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Thérèse vend du maïs et aussi de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs). Thérèse mène cette activité à son domicile, et aussi par le système de distribution. C’est à Adja au Mono (Bénin) que Thérèse s’approvisionne. C’est la première fois que Thérèse sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
G. Thérèse was born in 1947.  She has been living for about seven years in Djissoukpa, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is a widow with two children to support.  Both are in school.  She lives alone with her children and is the sole provider of the family.  Thérèse did not attend school.  To meet her needs and those of her children, she sells corn and also akassa (a local food made with cornstarch).  She operates this business in her home and also through the distribution system.  Adja, in Mono (Benin), is where she stocks up.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business, so as to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Debora (Debora's Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town economically-reliant on tourism. In Puerto Plata, running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, where she lives as a single mother with her three children.

Marta is excited to be seeking her second loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business: she operates a "fantasia," which is a variety store with merchandise geared towards women. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase women's underwear as well as deodorants and personal hygiene products. She plans to use the profits generated from the loan proceeds to continue investing in her business. Ultimately, she would like to have her own location for her store (as opposed to renting space) and to finish constructing her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional merchandise (e.g., underwear, deodorants, and personal hygiene products)

loans.name: Reynelda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Reynelda tiene 45 años de edad, casada, con tres hermosos hijos que cursan sus estudios, junto a su esposo trabajan un cafetín escolar,  y una pequeña venta en su casa en donde vende variedad de alimentos, el cual lleva veintiocho años trabajando para poder apoyar a su familia, cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital, pero luego con los ahorro de la ganancia y los financiamiento ha logrado invertir mas en su venta que tiene en su casa pues sus hijos cuando llegan de clase son los que administran la venta para a si trabajar en conjunto y poder apoyarse unos a otros. Ya que ella junto con su esposo están el cafetín el cual el préstamo lo quiere para comprar: golosinas, gaseosas, repostería, comprar arroz, carne, pollo, frutas y verduras para hacer comida y fresco que también vende a los maestros y hace, tacos, vigoron, enchiladas, entre otros, ella es una mujer dedicada a trabajar ya que a un los fines de semana hace nacatamales para poder ganar mas dinero ya que tiene uno de su hijo ya en la universidad y se gasta mucho y lo que mas desea es poder apoyarlo ya que yo no  tuve esa oportunidad por que mis padres eran de poco recursos económicos. Contenta por el financiamiento ya que podrá ofrecer a sus alumnos una variedad de producto con este nuevo año escolar que solo faltan unos días para empezar.
texts.en:
Reynalda, 45, is married and has three beautiful children, all of whom are in school. Together with her husband, she runs a small school cafeteria as well as a small eatery in their home where she sells a variety of dishes. She has worked for 28 years to support her family. When she began, it was with little capital. However, with time, she used savings from her profits and financing to invest more in her meals sales at home. It's her children who run the operation when they get home from school; this way they all help each other out and work together since she and her husband are at the school cafeteria. She is requesting financing to buy sweets, soft-drinks, pastry, rice, meat, chicken, fruits and vegetables in order to prepare the meals as well as the items she prepare for the teachers' breaks. She makes tacos, vigoron (chopped cabbage; chimichurri: tomatoes, onions, garlic and cilantro pickled in lime juice; boiled yucca and chicharrones-fried pork skins and/or fried pork meat), enchiladas, among others. She is a woman who is dedicated to work; even on weekends she makes nacatamales (typical Nicaraguan tamales) to earn still more income since one of her sons is in university and spends a lot and she wants to support him since she did not have the opportunity to study because her parents were very poor. She is happy for the financing because she will be able to offer her students a greater variety of products this new school year that is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft-drinks, pastry, rice, meat, chicken, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio M. vive en vivienda propia, en la zona German Busch, de la ciudad de El Alto. Es casado y tiene dos hijos, 
El señor Antonio trabaja como portero en un edificio de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende cosméticos en un puesto ambulante,  ingresos  con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en su vivienda, que no cuenta con el espacio suficiente para sus hijos.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio M. lives in his own home in the German Busch District of the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children. Antonio works as a doorman at a building in the city of La Paz and his wife sells cosmetics as a street merchant. Both of their incomes help to support their family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to add two bedrooms to his home because there is not enough space for his children. This is the second time Antonio has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating and is able to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build two bedrooms for his children

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda M. tiene 32 años ella es una mujer sola tiene cuatro hijos se dedica a la producción de leche vive en la zona de la Maica Norte q es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Hilda tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos porque el esposo la abandono cuando ella hace un año estaba muy enferma y  estuvo internada en el hospital como seis meses en ese transcurso de tiempo el esposo la abandono y dejo solos a sus hijos razón por la cual la madre de Hilda estuvo todo el tiempo con los niños y su hija de quince años se puso a trabajar dejando el colegio para poder ayudar a su mama se recupere y salga del hospital y ayudar en los gastos de la casa que eran muchos porque no tenían otro ingreso más que el de la entrega de leche que realizaba la madre de Hilda junto a sus nietos, la Señora Hilda salió del hospital y se sentía muy culpable de que su hija haya dejado el colegio para ayudarla a ella y el rechazo que los niños sienten por el padre es muy fuerte como también Hilda que ninguno quiere saber de él y dicen que jamás vuelva porque para ellos el está muerto.
La Señora Hilda requiere el crédito para la compra de dos cabezas de ganado y de esa manera podrá incrementar  sus litros de entrega de leche y realizar más quesillo para la venta en el mercado pues ella se siente con mucho mas valor y fuerza para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y que ellos terminen el colegio ya que su hija volvió a estudiar pero al mismo tiempo colaboran con la producción de leche y de quesillo todas las tardes realizan un trabajo en conjunto, sus ingresos mejoraran y tendrán un nivel de vida mejor ya no tendrán que pasar tantas necesidades como hace un año atrás.
La madre de Hilda se encuentra muy orgullosa de su hija y de su nieta al saber luchar y no dejarse vencer con todo lo malo que les paso ellas saben salir adelante lo que yo le enseñe a mi hija lo mismo realiza mi nieta dice doña Carmen.
Hilda se encuentra en proceso de recuperación pero ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con la actividad de la producción de leche que lo hace a partir de la cuatro de la mañana y después a lista  a sus hijos para el colegio ella lucha para que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro que ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda M. is 32 years old and a single woman with four children. She operates a dairy and lives in an area of Maica Norte, which is a canton of the city of Cochabamba. Hilda has to raise her children alone because her husband abandoned them a year ago after she became severely ill and had to be hospitalized for six months. Hilda’s mother stayed with the children while she was in the hospital. Her fifteen year old daughter quit high school and began working so that she could help her mother recover and pay for the household expenses. Their bills were numerous since there was no other income besides the milk being sold by Hilda’s mother and children. After she was discharged from the hospital, Hilda felt guilty that her daughter had to quit school to help her and her children experienced a strong rejection by their father. Hilda advised them not to mention him again, as if he were dead.

Hilda is requesting a loan to buy two more dairy cows so that she can increase milk production for delivery and to make cheeses to sell at the market. She feels she has more courage and strength to move her children forward so that they can complete their education. Her daughter returned to school, but she still helps with gathering the milk and helping her mother in the afternoons make cheeses. Hilda hopes to improve her income and experience a better standard of living now that they she hasn't accumulated as many expenses as she had a year ago.

Hilda’s mother is very proud of her daughter and granddaughter for persevering and not giving in to everything bad that had happened to them. Doña Carmen (Hilda’s mother) says, “I know my granddaughter will experience success because my daughter will be the one to show her.”

Hilda is still in the process of recovery, but she continues to work hard and manage her dairy responsibly. She begins work at 4am and then prepares her children for school so that they can become professionals and have a better future than her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a hard working and friendly woman. Evelyn is married with 6 children. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. She sells foodstuffs such as rice, beans, onions, peppers, melons, groundnut oil, and salts. She has been in this business for a long time. Evelyn is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 28 years old and married. He has been selling milk for three years in Nairobi. He also farms to increase his earnings. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has really grown because he can access loans. He hopes to open outlets and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of kes 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a cooker to boil milk.

loans.use: To buy a cooker to boil milk

loans.name: Ebenezer 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Fauna plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling clothing by purchasing pants, sheets and children's clothing. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her five children.

Fauna is excited to be taking her second loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing a fan as well as saving towards growing her business. Fauna is the coordinator of her group, "Ebenezer". She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, sheets and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy E. is 42 years old from the Igbo tribe. She is married to a clergyman and they have four children. Joy has owned a poultry and fish farm for 12 years. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living with part of her profits from the business. Joy needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more young chickens and fish for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more young chickens and fish to breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials to build a workshop

loans.name: Maria Selene

texts.es: Maria Selene tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura hace mas de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar la condición de su familia, ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona luchadora  Maria Selene elabora: sacos de vestir, vestidos de novia, trajes, pantalones. Pero actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio. el deseo es de ella es mantener este negocio activo.
texts.en:
Maria Selene is 45 years old and cares for her 2 children. She makes a living by providing tailoring services. She has been in this business for more than 13 years She has always been concerned with improving her family’s status. Characterized as a fighter, Maria Selene manufactures: jackets, wedding dresses, suits, and trousers. She is currently seeking financing for the purchase of raw materials necessary for her business. Her desire is to maintain this active business.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Gustavo Rubén

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo A. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Monica Lorena Martinez, tienen 2 hijos pequeños y viven en el Barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Encarnacion.

El señor Gustavo es sastre, tiene su taller de costura desde hace tiempo en su domicilio y tiene mucha clientela de la zona que concurre junto a el ya que realiza trabajos de buena calidad.
 Su esposa es docente, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo y gracias a esto ella también puede aportar ingresos a la unidad familiar.
 El señor Gustavo tiene proyectos de crecer con su microempresa y gracias a eso mejorar cada vez mas su nivel de vida.

El hoy dia esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas telas e insumos para su trabajo ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere abastecer a todos por igual.
texts.en:
Sr. Gustavo A., 37, has been married to Sra. Monica Lorena Martinez for several years. They have 2 young children and live in the San Roque neighborhood of the city of Encarnacion. Sr. Gustavo is a tailor. He has had a workshop in his house for several years and he has many customers in the area who know his work and are happy with the quality of the service he provides. His wife is a long-time teacher, work that allows her to contribute to the family income. Sr. Gustavo plans to grow his micro-business and use the extra income it generates to improve his way of living. He is now applying for a loan so that he can buy cloth and other supplies for his business. He has a lot of orders and wants to stock everything he needs to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Vicenta Aquilina

texts.es:
Vicenta de 48 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). Es madre soltera con dos hijos, tiene un pequeño restaurante que le ha ayudado a mantener a sus hijos. 

Antes de tener su restaurante ella le vendía tres almuerzos diarios a sus amigos, poco a poco incremento mas sus ventas ya que la comida era muy buena. Ahora ha podido estar estable económicamente y tiene una tienda surtida, vende arroz, legumbres, enlatados. Trabaja con su hija menor desde las 09h00am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas y mesas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere remodelar su restaurante para que sus clientes estén mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and lives in Paraíso in Guayaquil (a mountainous periurban area with dirt roads). She is a single mother with two children. Vicenta has a small restaurant that helps her support her children.

Prior to having her restaurant, Vicenta sold three lunches per day to her friends. She gradually increased her sales since her food is known to be very good. Vicenta is now able to maintain financial stability and keep a stocked pantry with rice, legumes, and canned goods. She works with her youngest daughter starting at 9am.

Vicenta will use her loan to buy chairs and tables for her business. In the future, she wants to remodel her restaurant so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & tables

loans.name: Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Sabra is the wife of M. H. and lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. 

A very talented lady, Sabra owns & operates a clothes-sewing business. She does this work for the purpose of meeting financial expenses. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She charges them reasonably for her work, which enables them to come again to her for sewing their clothes. 

Her husband operates a grocery shop in the community. He has been operating it for 3 years. He has good recognition among the people. He tries to fulfill their needs on timely basis, but now he has little stock to enable him to meet any needs of his customers. This affects his ability to further sell and meet his customers' needs. Therefore, Sabra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the necessary groceries, which helps him to maintain his customers by fulfilling their needs. 

Sabra has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons. She has enrolled all of them in a school so they get the education to make their futures bright. 

She is a second-year member of Asasah. In her first year she managed good credit behavior and attended the meetings regularly.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: If God Gree Group

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo are members of a solidarity lending group named “If God Gree”. They are small-scale-business people from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses.

The leader of the group is Hawa K., pictured on the left. 27-year-old Hawa is married and has four children: two in primary school and two not of school-going age.

Hawa sells laundry soaps and jewelry. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business by buying more soaps and jewelry to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more laundry soaps and jewelry in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Narman

texts.en:
Narman A. is a 40-year-old trader who has sold products for the home and electrical goods for the last three years. He is married and has two children. 

He started his business with some savings and a year ago, he was able to build his own shop. His monthly income is about 250-350 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) and he is going to increase it to 500-600 AZN. Narman applied for a 900 AZN loan to increase the number of items he sells. He believes this loan will help him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothing for selling.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 40 years old. She is married with seven children who are between the ages of 4 and 22. All the children attend school except one.  Alice is a farmer from Kitale in western Kenya. He has been farming for over two years and employs one farmhand. Her main product is eggs, which she sells locally. She also runs a small kiosk where she sells food and cereals to supplement her income.

She recently repaid her previous loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested another loan of 85,000 KES to upgrade her poultry farm. She says that the proceeds from her poultry business will go towards the education of her children in high school and college. She would like to expand her farm in the future and practice both dairy and poultry farming.

She appreciates that Juhudi Kilimo is doing well by partnering with the low income farmers to help them in their activities.

loans.use: To upgrade her poultry farm.

loans.name: Santo Milagro

texts.es:
la señora Santo Milagro A. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea el Sope del municipio de Amapala. la Sra. Santo se dedica a la pezca.
el credito lo utilizara  para la compra de un trasmayo para pescar. 
Santo se dedica la venta de mariscos dentro y fuera de esta ciudad.
necesita comprar esa red porque la que tiene ya esta en mal estado y no esta sacando muchos mariscos del mar y esto le ocacione perdidas en tiempo y dinero.
texts.en: Señora Santo Milagro A. is 42 years old.   She is married and lives in the El Sope community in the town of Amapala.  Señora Santo fishes for a living.  She will use the loan to buy a trammel net for fishing.  Santo sells seafood in the city and the surrounding areas.  She needs to buy this net because hers is in bad shape and it is not catching many fish or shellfish.  This is causing her to lose time and money.

loans.use: To purchase a trammel net to catch fish and shellfish

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Celia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Celia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergent, biscuits and snack foods, in the local community. Celia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Celia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Celia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 26 años, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, vive en casa de unos parientes. Juan es mecánico, que por su buen trabajo es muy reconocido por la zona donde vive. Es especialista en reparar el motor de los carros petroleros, que junto a un amigo trabajan en un taller. Durante estos años de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, han logrado ganarse el reconocimientos de los chóferes, que ahora lo buscan y le esperan a pesar de lo muy  ocupado que esta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que  tiene  clientes que le prefieren y reconocen su trabajo, por lo que se siente motivado para continuar trabajando. Con el tiempo desea tener su propio taller, para trabajar de manera independiente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, se comprará una comprensora de aire para pintar y un aspersor de sistema de planchados, para que su trabajos sea más eficiente.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old.  He is a very hard-working and responsible young man.  He lives in a house with some relatives.  Juan is a mechanic and, because of the good work he does, he is well known in his district.  He is a specialist in fixing car engines.  He works in a workshop together with a friend.  Through years of hard work and dedication, he has managed to earn the recognition of drivers who now come to him and wait for his services no matter how busy he is.  What he most likes about his work is that he has customers who prefer his service and acknowledge his work.  This makes him feel motivated to keep working.  Over time, he would like to have his own workshop so that he can work independently.

This is Juan's first loan with MFP and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to him in increasing his working capital.  For this reason, he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.  He will use his loan to buy an air compressor for painting and a sprayer so that his work is more efficient.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor and sprayer

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Urbana; ella tiene 29 años de edad, soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante ella vende todos los días lo que es almuerzo, cena y extras. La socia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y comprar una refrigeradora para su restaurante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Urbana is a member of the 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity) community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Urbana is 29 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business where she serves lunches, dinners and extras every day.  She is an enterprising woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan to improve her business and buy a refrigerator for her restaurant.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To improve her business and buy a refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es: Stephanie tiene 20 años, vive solo con sus padres y sus abuelos en la propiedad que poseen. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de ropa, mercadería que lleva vender a sus amigas que estudian con ella en estudios superiores. Asegura, que es más fácil realizar sus ventas en su salón porque le permite hacer un seguimiento de sus cuentas, ya que cobra cada día a sus compañeras. De esta manera logra tener las ganancias, además siempre esta al tanto de las nuevas tendencias de la moda, por lo que compra y se abastece de prendas con los nuevos diseños, esto le favorece ya que rápidamente su mercadería es vendida. Por las ventas exitosas que ha tenido ha decidido crecer su capital para poder solventarse mejor sus gastos. Es el crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Stephanie, 20, lives with her parents and grandparents in the property they own.  For the last year she has been selling clothes, merchandise she takes to sell to her friends who are going to college with her.  She assures us that it’s easier to sell in the classroom because she can follow up on her accounts since she collects daily from her friends.  This way she’s able to earn more profits plus she’s always up to date on the latest fashion trends so she stocks up on the newest designs of clothes.  This is favorable for her because she sells her merchandise quickly.

Because of the successful sales she’s had she wants to increase capital in order to pay her expenses better.  This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people she knows.  She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to invest in more items of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Hundik

texts.en:
Hundik S. is 44 years old.  He lives with his wife and five children in a ger – a traditional nomadic tent, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.  Two of his children are university students and three are attending a local high school. 

Hundek operates an iron work business in the town. He started his business in 2000 in the Tirlik market of town. He makes iron cookers, smoke holes,  and iron supplies for construction. He is a hardworking man.  In the future, he plans to expand his business by producing more variety of iron products and to sell during the upcoming big holidays. 

He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Dorlita

texts.en:
Dorlita is from the village of Bobongan Labason Zamboanga Del norte. She is 57 years old. Dorlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dorlita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Dorlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dorlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dorlita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dorlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Zoila Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jesús Del Gran Poder se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zoila, ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y sabanas,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y para esto se desplaza a los campos a ofrecer sus productos. Trabaja todos los días menos el sábado, deja a crédito a sus clientes  pero solo en dos partes una cuando entrega y la otra después de quince días o al mes. Su mercadería  la compra en  Chone. Nos cuenta que lleva algunos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, blusas, camisetas, interiores y sabanas. Lleva 38 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y  se desempeña como la fiscal de pagos del Banco y le gusta porque  a través de los créditos ella puede financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Jesus del Gran Poder" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, also known by the name of "Calceta la sin par", meaning Calceta without compare. For the population of the city there is no place more beautiful in the world.

Here we meet Zoila. She is 36 years old, married, and she has two children, 16 and 8 years old.  They are in high school and primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She sells all types of clothing and bed sheets. She sells door to door and she travels to the rural regions to sell her products. She works every day except Saturdays. She completes her sales on credit but they must pay in full in two payments, either every two weeks or per month.   She buys her merchandise in Chone. She has a few years in the business and it has been very successful. 

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, undergarments and bed sheets. She has been through 38 loan cycles with her communal bank and she is the treasurer of the group.  She enjoys partaking because through these loans she is able to finance her business.  Her dream is to have a store of her own.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, ropa interior, blusas, camisetas y sabanas.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed woman with seven children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a paraffin-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Christine faces a major challenge of competition from other paraffin sellers in the area. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase paraffin for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin for sale.

loans.name: Conaky Traders Group

texts.en:
These people run small businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek their second loan in order to enable them to expand their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profits. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feed and clothe them. 

Fatmata S. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni 29 years ago. She is married and has four children. Fatmata sells milk, sugar, and cocoa. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by purchasing these products in bulk.  

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer, Zainab Bangura, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, and cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a fifty-two-year-old married man with seven children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling  animal drugs for four years starting with 900,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardship is price fluctuations and his vision is to become a veterinary doctor. Josephat needs the loan to buy drugs and spraying equipment to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs and  spraying equipment for resale.

loans.name: Saúl Humberto

texts.es: Saúl Humberto G. G. de cincuenta y siete años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida en Atiquizaya del departamento de Ahuachapan . El se dedica a la agricultura y posee un vivero, hoy en dia tiene muchos clientes a la hora de comercializar su producción de plantas. Saúl es un hombre con mucho  entusiasmo de trabajar, es muy alegre y siempre le transmite buena voluntad a su clientela. Últimamente ha tenido más demanda al ofrecer su producción es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para agricultura como semillas, abono, instrumentos para su producción entre otros. Saúl tiene fe que su fuente de ingresos le ayudara a salir adelante y lograra dar a su familia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Saúl Humberto G. G. is 57 years old and lives with his partner in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapan.  He is active in agriculture and has his own greenhouse.  He has many customers who buy his plants.

Saúl is very enthusiastic about his job.  He is a happy person and always transmits his good will to the customers.  Lately he has been receiving more orders and so decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL.  He plans to use it to buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies for production.

Saúl is confident his business will help him get ahead so he can give his family a better future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Meyling Group

texts.es:
El grupo Meyling lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Juana P. quien desde muy joven se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, actividad que aprendió de su madre.

Ella con el crédito comprar frutas de temporada en especial los jocotes y sandillas.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Damaris A. y Luis Alberto F. ambos igual que la coordinadora se dedican al comercio de las frutas y verduras e invierten su crédito en la compra de cosechas.
texts.en:
The Meyling group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of these is Juana P.  who has had a fruit and vegetable business since she was very young-she learned the business from her mother.

With the loan she will buy seasonal fruit, especially jocotes (a local fruit) and watermelons.  The other group members are Damaris A. and Luis Alberto F. who, along with the coordinator, sell fruit and vegetables and will use their loan to buy fresh produce.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruit such as jocotes (a local fruit) and watermelons.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Darío de 36 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Marcelina junto a su esposo Darío en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de cacao, café y barbasco, las cuales vende en la ciudad de San Francisco. Marcelina en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros y de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en las extracciones de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos,  lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que atacan sus frutos. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y sin causar problemas a su banco comunal. Es por ello que con el crédito solicitado comprará insecticidas para combatir la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 38, is from the city of Palmapampa.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 36 year old husband, Darío, and their four beloved children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

The arduous work on her farm that Marcelina does together with her husband, Dario, has made their crops very well cared for.  On sale days their crops are rapidly purchased.  Her main source of income is the sale of cacao, coffee, and mullein.  She sells these crops in the city of San Francisco.  

At harvest time Marcelina hires field workers to speed up the gathering of her crops.  She has been engaged in this business activity for 17 years.  She feels that the most difficult part is taking care of the crops so that they are not subject to insect infestations.

In time, she wants to get new land to expand her crops.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her payments, and she has not caused problems in her communal bank.  

She will use the requested loan to buy insecticide to combat insect infestation.

loans.use: to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito  y  departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  La señora estudio educación secundaria.
Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos ciclos,  su  primer préstamo solicitado  fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta al por menor de animales caseros como: gallinas, patos, conejos y pavos.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de cuatro cajas de de gallinas de diferentes tamaños.  Ella trabaja sola en su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja de albañil.
Su sueño es viajar a la selva con el negocio para mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 26 years old, has a live-in spouse and three children.  She finished secondary school.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used in her business selling small domestic animals like chickens, ducks, rabbits and turkeys at retail.

Now she will request a new, 600 new sol, loan to buy four crates of chickens of varying sizes.  She works alone in her business since her husband’s a Bricklayer.

Her dream is to take her business to the jungle where profits are higher.

What she likes about the communal bank is its punctuality and the responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to buy four crates of chickens of varying sizes.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 62 years old and married with five adult-aged children. Alejandro is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 20,000 per harvest. 

Alejandro is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other products used in farming. Alejandro has been growing rice for 30 years.

In the future, Alejandro hopes that his farming business will be more progressive and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other products used in farming

loans.name: Ruphelle

texts.en: Ruphelle, a 39-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City where she operates a grocery store and earns approximately Php 6,000 each month. A member of PMPC for one year, she is requesting a loan to  purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 44 years old and married with four children: three sons and a daughter. Her first two sons are involved in a sewing business. Her youngest son is studying in 7th standard while her daughter is studying in 8th standard. 

Shahnaz is also a very talented lady. She knows the skill of sewing but only does it to support her sons in their business. Her husband works as a security guard and studied till 10th standard.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy an over-lock machine to further improve his business. 

He has been operating his business for the past 11 years and Shahnaz hopes that her sons’ business will be established further and increases their profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine.

loans.name: Kifaia

texts.en: Kifaia is a 45-year-old young woman who is married with five children three boys and two girls. She wants a loan of $1189.04 to buy new and additional home furniture, as number of her family members is getting bigger and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who has a decent salary that doesn't help him buying furniture in cash. So, when Kifaia gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis amount, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and live in better conditions with the family. Kifaia is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's branch office.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 5 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même association d’artisan. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Danton Pierre, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Danton Pierre est âgé de 38 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Pierrette. Le couple a huit enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont les leurs. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Danton Pierre n'a jamais été à l'école, mais a appris le métier de couture. Il y a près de treize ans que Danton Pierre exerce cette activité, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté au besoin de sa famille. Danton Pierre désire mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’achat d’une nouvelle machine à coudre. Pour ce faire, Danton Pierre sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 5, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
WANGNINAGBE 5 is a group formed of three persons who belong to the same artisan association. The group’s representative is Danton Pierre. He is the one in the photo with his hand raised. This is the second time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Danton Pierre is 38 years old and married to a retailer by the name of Pierrette. They have eight children to support. The children are all in school; four of them are their own. And they live together with their children and jointly provide for the various needs of the family. Danton Pierre has never attended school, but he learned the tailoring trade. He has been in this business for thirteen years. It enables him to meet family needs without much trouble.

He would like to equip his workshop better by buying a new sewing machine. To do so, he, along with the others in the group WANGNINAGBE 5, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosabilita

texts.en:
Rosabilita is from Clarin, Misamis Ocidental, Philippines. She is 48 years old, married and has three grown children. Rosabilita grows corn to make a living and commenced this activity three years ago. She normally earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

Rosabilita is one of the recently registered members of GDMPC. She has applied a loan of PHP 10,000 from the organization to purchase corn fertilizers for fast growth and producing high-quality corn products. The expected revenue is intended for agricultural expansion to gain more than the regular income received.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizers for fast growth and producing high-quality corn products.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 33 years old and supports her children who  ages ten and seven years old.  She owns a boutique that has been in operation for eight years earning a monthly income of KES. 8,100.

Florah has borrowed KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD. She hopes to use the money to purchase more business stock like clothes,shoes,bags etc for her business.The anticipated profit will be used to improve and expand the business.

In the future, Florah hopes to purchase a vehicle which will be used for public transport, to develop her plot of land and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase business stock such as clothing, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, у него трое взрослых детей. Виктор родом из Каменки. Он одно время работал на севере, откуда приехал 14 лет назад. Сейчас Виктор занимается животноводством, торгует мясом и к тому же выращивает овощи. В Каменке этим заниматься выгодней всего.  Виктору больше нравится заниматься животными, а жена активно помогает ему с работой в теплицах, где они выращивают помидоры. Виктор занимается фермерством уже 11 лет. У Виктора большое хозяйство, 2 га земли. 

Виктору необходим кредит в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить комбикорма и вырастить свиней до зимы. Он надеется подогнать вес и через 3 месяца сдать партию свиней. Виктор – трудолюбивый фермер, ему нравится заниматься этим делом, а желание развиваться помогает ему двигаться дальше и вкладывать еще больше сил и средств в свое дело. В этому году Виктор расширяет животноводство и строит дополнительный маточник на 50 поросят.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Victor is married and has three adult children. He was born in Kamenka. For a while he used to work in the North, from where he returned 14 years ago. Now Victor raises farm animals and sells meat and also grows vegetables. This is the most profitable business in Kamenka. Victor especially likes taking care of the animals, and his wife actively helps him working in the green houses where they grow tomatoes. Victor has been working as a farmer in 11 years. He has a large farm, with two ha [about 5 acres] of land.

Victor needs a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to buy compound animal feed and raise pigs before the onset of winter. He is hoping to fatten a herd of pigs and sell them   three months later. Victor is a hard-working farmer. He likes his work, and the desire to develop his business motivates him to keep going and invest even more effort and resources in his farm. This year Victor is expanding  by building an additional farrowing pen for 50 piglets.


Note: the loan description is in Russian

loans.use: to buy compound animal feed and fatten up pigs before winter

loans.name: Blanca Omaira

texts.es:
A sus 39 años de edad, Blanca es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, una tienda donde vente todos los productos de la canasta familiar. Anteriormente Blanca trabajaba como empleada del servicio doméstico en una casa de familia, pero la señora de la casa y dueña de la tienda se fue del país dejándole a Blanca el negocio, hace 6 años es dueña de esa tienda y trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ilusión de salir adelante. 

Blanca es una luchadora incansable que espera tener más clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtido y con gran variedad. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición ya que ella dispone de su tiempo y puede estar pendiente de su familia.

Actualmente Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas. Blanca sueña con llegar a tener una casa propia y por tal motivo trabaja con esmero para poder lograrlo algún día.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old and devoted to her grocery business selling all kinds of basic family supplies. In the past she worked as a servant, but the lady of the house and owner of the business left the country, leaving Blanca the business. So for the last six years she has been owner of the store. She works from Monday to Saturday and is excited about what the future holds.

Blanca is a indefatigable hardworking woman who hopes to have more customers and more economic opportunities so that she can stock her store with a wide variety of items. This entrepreneur believes that work is a blessing allowing her to use her time wisely and be the mainstay of her family.

Now Blanca needs a loan to buy merchandise and in this way expand her business and improve sales. Her dream is to have a house of her own so she takes great care with her work so she can fulfill her dream one day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and a single mother of one.  She sells auto spare parts so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for eight years.  She has employed one person to assist her in the business. 

 Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business.  Her dream is to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 90,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To add to her stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: The Third Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old widow.  She has five children, four of whom have left home.  She is now left with one dependent, aged 15, who is going to school and Jane is the one who has the sole responsibility for the school fees and the upkeep of the child.

Jane is a cross-border retailer who specializes in buying blankets, shoes, and clothing, and she wants to boost her business. She wants to use some of the funds to pay for high import duty fees which were recently imposed.  The loan will enable her to improve their standard of living and to have more disposable income.  In the future, she is intending to have her own shop and take on some staff.

loans.use: to buy blankets, shoes, and clothing

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia es una mujer D. 60 años D. edad, es una mujer casada y madre D. 2 hijos, aunque actualmente vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en su empleo. DesD. hace 15 años, María Cecilia aprendió el oficio D. la confección, pero solo hace 2 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, un taller D. confección donD. realiza sus propios diseños y también confecciona a terceras personas, mediante este empleo le facilita trabajo a 2 personas más. 

Actualmente María Cecilia solicitó un préstamo para comprar una maquina fileteadora, que le esta haciendo falta en su taller para poder cumplir con mas contratos y aumentar la capacidad D. producción, teniendo como efecto, más clientes, mayores ingresos y un aumento proporcional D. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Cecilia is a 60 year old woman. She is married and has 2 children. She currently lives with her husband who supports her in her work. Maria Cecilia leaned dressmaking 15 years ago but it was only 2 years ago that she decided to start her own business, a dressmaking workshop where she 
produces her own designs and also sews for third parties. Through this business she provides employment for 2 other people. 

Currently Maria Cecilia is asking for a loan to buy a skiver machine which she needs in the workshop to meet more orders and increase production capacity, which in effect will increase client numbers, mean bigger returns and a proportional increase in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a skiver machine to increase production capacity.

loans.name: Muriel

texts.en:
Muriel is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 6. She runs a boutique in Aberdeen in the western part of Freetown, Sierra Leone.

She’s been in this business for 15 years, selling items such as baby clothes, baby powder, bags, cosmetics, shoes and clothes in her store. Muriel also earns income from running an internet cafe and photocopying machine. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high tax rates in Sierra Leone.

Muriel requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy items for her boutique. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and improve her business. In the future, Muriel would like to operate an international business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as baby clothes, baby powder, bags and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kibeu Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kibeu SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Pamela is the facilitator of the Kibeu SHG group. She takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting thirteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
Pamela is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta, de 20 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con deseos de superación, es conviviente con Raúl que es empleado en una empresa privada, vive en compañía de su pareja y su hijo de 1 año de edad a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su casa propia. La actividad que realizará Julieta será la venta de artículos de vestir femeninos como zapatos, zapatillas, carteras, relojes, medias, prendas intimas. Este negocio se inicio por recomendación de su madre, es así que ofrece a familiares, amistades y amigas, de manera personal y entregando a pedido. Lo que le gusta de esa actividad es que podrá contar con tiempo para dedicarlo a su hijo menor, además de contar con ingreso adicional para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, así como el sentirse ocupada y productiva. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros que son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá  en su nuevo negocio en la compra de productos de femeninos como zapatos y carteras.
texts.en:
Julieta, age 20, is a hardworking and earnest woman who has the desire to succeed. She is in a common-law relationship with Raúl, who is employed at a private company. Julieta and her partner have a one-year-old son who they love dearly. They live in their own home.

Julieta sells women’s accessories such as shoes, slippers, purses, watches, hosiery, and lingerie. She started this business because of her mother’s suggestion and now she offers products to relatives, loved ones, and friends. Julieta visits her customers in person and takes their orders. What she likes about this business is that it gives her time to spend with her young son. In addition, she is able to earn additional income to help her partner with the household expenses. The work also keeps her busy and productive.

This will be her first loan with MFP organization. Julieta hopes that this assistance will enable her to complete her plans. In addition, she feels good about her Communal Bank because she knows most of the members since they are neighbors who she considers to be responsible people. The amount of 1000 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of women’s accessories such as shoes and purses.

loans.use: to buy shoes and purses for women.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 10 children. Merlyn has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Calca en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas al noroeste de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 67 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de maíz y alfalfa. Ya son 40 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Martha en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas para sembrar. El Sueño de Martha comprar varios terrenos para cultivar mas maíz y alfalfa. 

Martha es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Martha was born in the city of Calca in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, which lies to the northeast of the city of Cusco.  She is 67 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her activities in the home with her business buying and selling corn and alfalfa.  She has been doing this work for 40 years already, and it is going very well.  At this time, Martha needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds to plant.  Martha's dream is to buy some plots of land so that she can cultivate more corn and alfalfa.

Martha is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Asunta de Calca,” which is made up of 15 members who live in the city of Calca, in Calca province in the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Maclovia Cecilia

texts.es:
Maclovia de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio (papelería) hace ya cinco años atrás. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su familia poco a poco fue teniendo clientela hasta ahora que ya tiene clientes fijos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar las ventas. Comienza su horario de trabajo desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo laminas, jugos, papelería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
51-year-old Maclovia is a hard-working woman who has a stationery store business which she has run for five years.  She started her business with the help of her family.  She gradually gained customers and now has regular customers.  

Maclovia has many aspirations for her business and so she would like to improve her sales.  She starts work at 7.00am and works until 9.00pm.

Maclovia has many aspirations for her business and so she would like to use her loan to buy paper, juice and stationery products.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of paper, juice and stationery products

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is widowed with two children. Anecita is 48 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba.

To earn a living, Anecita has a bakery business. She has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 15,000. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase 20 sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread-making. Anecita has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread-making.

loans.name: Budiriro Msvingo Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fana from Masvingo. He is married with five children, all attending school.  Fana runs a retail business selling clothes, plates and shoes for resale. The business has been in operation for four years. He says the main challenges faced are price increases from wholesalers. 

Fana has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes, plates and shoes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to feed his family well. In the future, Fana plans will be able to buy food for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, plates and shoes for resale

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur runs a car washing service in Yerevan town. He lives with his parents. Khachatur works hard to provide high quality service to his clients so they enjoy coming back again and using the service. 

The requested loan will help Khachatur to purchase car washing equipment to continue providing car washing service to local people in Yerevan town.

loans.use: to pay for car washing equipment needed for providing car washing service

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a divorcee with two sons . She runs a retail shop selling women cloths in a busy area of Ilala district  in Dar es Salaam. She has employed one  person in her business.She is planning to add the size of the stock of the clothes.She buys these clothes from wholesellers and resale them in retail.The plan need some USD 400 funding. In addition, the loan will help her increase her working capital and prevent stockouts.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Fonglo

texts.en:
Married with six children, Mrs. Fonglo has thirty years of experience in the business of selling fruit, but has never had access to more than fifty dollars worth of capital. She sells mango, orange, and pineapple, depending on the season.

According to her experience and her needs in the fruit market, we think that increasing her sales by 100% will be a good business move for the beginning. With the money Mrs. Fonglo receives, she will be able to host a good fruit market once a week, and supply a portion of needs in the fruit market for the nearly 1000 people in her area.

With the loan of $100, she can count on buying bananas, pears, and oranges, purchasing at least $25 worth of each type of fruit.

loans.use: Increase base capital

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Mrs. Franca U., a 32-year-old dynamic client of LAPO. She has proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She is maintaining her repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. She needs this money ($400) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more baby wears for sale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina S. lives in the Las Mercedes neighborhood in the city of Luque. She is 63 years old, and has been a widow for 9 years. She has 5 children: a 33 years old daughter, and four sons of respectively 43, 40, 30, and 27 years old. Of them, only the youngest lives with her. The rest are already married and have families of their own.

Mrs. Cristina has had a flower stand in front of the East Cemetery since 1973. She sell all kinds of natural flowers, like roses, daisies, lilacs, etc., but also candelabras, crosses made of fabric, and candles.

Cristina has her own nursery at home, where she grows different flowering plants which is principally run by her oldest son. She wants to grow larger quantities of flowers, and for this she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds of different types of flowers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Cristina S. reside en el Barrio las Mercedes de la ciudad de Luque, la misma tiene 63 años es viuda hace 9 años, tiene 5 hijos, una de mujer de 33 años y cuatro varones de 43, 40, 30 y 27 años respectivamente. De los cuales solamente el menor vive con ella ya que los demás están casados y tienen sus familias ya formadas.

La Sra. Cristina tiene un puesto de ventas de flores frente al Cementerio del Este desde el año 1973 , donde vende toda clases de flores naturales como rosas, margaritas, lilas, etc.; así como también candelabros , cruces de tela y velas.

Cristina posee su propia huerta en su casa, donde planta distintas variedades de flores que es atendido principalmente por su hijo mayor. Ella desea seguir produciendo estas flores en mayor cantidad, por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de semillas de flores de distintas variedades.

loans.use: purchase of varied flower seeds

loans.name: Flaminio

texts.es:
Flaminio B., 34, and Griselda Candia, 27, have been married for seven years. They have a son that is barely three years old and the other is on its way. His wife is 8-months pregnant and very anxious for the arrival of the new member to the family.

At a young age, Flaminio had to leave his house and emigrate to Argentine (the border country of Paraguay) in search of better job opportunities. He began working as a carpenter with a relative, and at the same time with the income that he earned, he paid for a training course to become a motorcycle mechanist in order to become a successful professional in this area now.

After working for many years in Argentina and far away from his family, he was able to put enough money together to return to his motherland, where he constructed a house to provide for his new family. After some time, he began his own auto shop in his own community. Flaminio is known as the only and best mechanic in the area. He has a well-formed group of clients since the other shops are far away in the downtown area of the city.

The loan will be used to buy a compressor.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Flaminio B., tiene 34 años está casado con la señora Griselda Candia de 27 años, ellos llevan 7 años de casados, tienen un hijo de apenas tres añitos y otro que está en camino, su esposa ya tiene 8 meses de embarazo y están esperando ansiosos la llegada del nuevo integrante de la familia.

Flaminio desde muy joven tuvo que abandonar su hogar y emigrar a Argentina (país que limita con Paraguay) en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales. Empezó trabajando como carpintero con un familiar, al mismo tiempo con sus ingresos pago un curso de capacitación para ser mecánico de motocicletas, y así logró ser un profesional es ésta área.

Después de trabajar muchos años por allí y de estar lejos de sus familiares pudo juntar la plata necesaria para volver a su tierra natal y así construir una casita para poder brindarle el bienestar necesario a su nueva familia. Luego de un tiempo montó su propio taller en su misma comunidad en donde ahora, Flaminio, es reconocido como el único y mejor mecánico de la zona, tiene clientela formada puesto que los otros talleres están alejados de la compañía pacheco en el centro de la ciudad que está a una distancia considerable de allí.

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de una compresora.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Soknao

texts.en: Miss. Soknao S. is currently living with her elderly parents in Koh Dach village. Soknao S. has been weaving silk since 2000 when her mother taught her to weave. Her father works spinning silk thread for villagers, as well as earning some extra money through farming. Soknao S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. She has requested this loan of $350 in order to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and an additional loom so that she and her mother can weave simultaneously and therefore increase production.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and an additional loom

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en:
Lilieni is married with no children. She just left school and didn’t have a job, and she decided to start her ice-cake business.

She applied for this loan in order to buy ingredients for her ice-cake (popsicles in a bag) business. She sells them in the village daily, but mostly at the village school first. She is very interested in her business and wishes to continue it in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate owns a hair salon. She is married with 4 children and is 37 years old. She is a LAPO member and from the Bini tribe from Edo State. She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy weavon (for hair styling), hair accessories and drinks for sale. She started the business in 1991.

loans.use: To buy weavon for hair styling and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ghem

texts.en: Mrs. Ghem S., 22, is married with little children and works as a cleaner in HCC Company, earning around $1.50 a day. To supplement a good condition of living her husband Mr. Hy Moha, 29, works as a police officer watching a temple in Siem Reap province which in average gives him around $1 a day. With the loan he wants to renovate their house as now the construction has not been completed. This couple not only wants to use this loan to renovate their house, but they want to own a business by purchasing grocery items and reselling them for a profit. Finally, this couple would like to honestly thank all lenders who support them.

loans.use: Ghem would like to complete fixing her house and start a grocery business.

loans.name: Praxeda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year old Praxeda M.. She is married with one child, age four.

In 2004, Praxeda established a general store business. Working six days a week for nine to twelve hours a day and assisted by her husband, she earns about $520.00 a month from this business. She now requires a loan to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, juice, milk, and oil in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $150.00. In the future, Praxeda also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, juice, milk, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela belongs to the Ricardo Palma communal bank, located at 420 Ricardo Palma St., in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 71 years old and the widowed mother of 6 children. With the first loan of ~$110 that Micaela received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business sewing sheets and bedspreads.

Currently, she still sews and now has more customers. Due to the fine finishing touches she puts on her products, her earnings have increased. Her children support her in everything she does and are very proud of her.

With this $375 loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy different colored fabrics, threads, silk lace, elastics, etc.

Micaela feels great because she is working hard and she feels very active.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Micaela pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma 420, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 71 años es madre D. 6 hijos, es viuda. Micaela con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la costura D. sabanas y cubrecamas. En la actualidad sigue cociendo, ahora cuenta con mas cliente, por el buen acabo D. sus confecciones sus ganancias han aumentado, sus hijos siempre la apoyan en todo, y están muy orgullosos D. ella. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará telas D. diferentes colores, hilos, blondas, elástico, etc. Micaela se siente muy bien por que esta trabajando y se siente muy activa y eso la hace sentir bien.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz has always been conscientious and hard-working through the many years that she's earned a living selling all kinds of clothing. A year ago, she decided to set up a stall in the market and offer her services as a seamstress. She sells clothes at the stand during the week and the Sunday fair on weekends. She's asking for a loan to buy clothes that she can resell for a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Liz siempre ha sido constante y perseverante con su actividad por lo que durante muchos años se ha venido dedicando a la venta de todo tipo de prendas de vestir y hace un año tomó la decisión de tener un puesto en el mercado para ofrecer sus servicios de compostura, ahí trabaja todo el día y todos los días útiles para ofertar sus prendas de vestir los fines de semana en la feria dominical. Solicita un crédito para adquirir las prendas de vestir que oferta al por mayor.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Putu Widiya

texts.id:
Putu Widiya has to wake up around 03:00 AM every morning, and goes to the morning market in his city to buy items for his business. He has been in this vegetable business for a long time. After all items are bought, Putu Widiya travels with his motor cycle to offer his items. Items on offer are assortments of green vegetables to be cooked, meat, fish, assortments of cakes, assortments of cooked vegetable prepared meals wrapped in plastic. Usually he starts to sales travel around 5:00 - 9.00 AM to see his customers. His customers are ladies in remote village areas far away from the market.
