Every morning Putu Widiya from the market completing his sales items, then right away travels to offer his items by motor cycle. From his brother's information, finally Putu Widiya applies to obtain a loan from Dinari Foundation. With this loan, Putu Widiya to buy items for his travelling vegetables sales. In one day Putu Widiya bought Rp100,000-Rp200,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00); with a nett profit of Rp30,000-40,000/day. With this profit Putu Widiya could fulfill his family needs with one child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Putu Widiya setiap pagi harus bangun pagi sekitar pukul 03.00 wita dan harus bergegas ke pasar pagi di kotanya untuk berbelanja keperluan dagangannya.Usaha dagang sayur memang sudah ditekuni sejak lama. Setelah keperluan lengkap, Putu Widiya berkeliling dengan sepeda motornya untuk menjajakan barang dagangannya. Barang barang yang di jual yaitu aneka macam sayuran hijau untuk keperluan masak, daging, ikan, aneka macam kue, aneka macam sayur siap saji yang sudah terbungkus dengan plastik. Biasanya mulai berkeliling mulai pukul 05.00 s/d 09.00 wita menemui pelanggannya. Pelanggannya adalah ibu-ibu yang ada di daerah pedesaan yang jauh dari pasar. Setiap pagi Putu Widiya setelah dari pasar melengkapi dagangan kemudian langsung berkeliling menjajakan barang dagangan dengan sepeda motornya. Melalui informasi oleh saudaranya akhirnya Putu Widiya mengajukan permohonan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dengan dana itulah Putu Widiya mempergunakan untuk memenuhi keperluan usaha dagang sayur keliling. Dalam sehari Putu Widiya membelanjakan dana Rp.100.000 s/d Rp.200.000.-. Dengan keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 30.000 s/d 40.000.- per hari. Dengan keuntungan inilah Putu Widiya dapat mencukupi keperluan keluargnya bersama seorang anaknya.

loans.use: To add business capital to buy sales items (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina started the business from economic need, to help her three children get ahead who were at that time 13,12 and 11 years. She started the business upon not having the income to pay for food and studies for her three children. When she was left a widow she saw the need to go to work, since she was also presented with health problems and one of her daughters is deaf-mute. Since they did not have medical coverage, the expenses increased and her husband did not leave her any pension or anything. She began 10 years ago going to work with her sister-in-law, investing some savings that she had in the making of piñatas. Little by little she began selling more and more, until she had significant sales that have permitted her family to advance.

She needs a loan of $500 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to increase her inventory and thus to have better sales. With your aid Avelina will continue growing her business

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Avelina inició el negocio por necesidad económica, para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que en ese entonces tenían 13,12 y 11 años. Inició el negocio al no tener un ingreso para la alimentación y estudios a sus tres hijos, al quedar viuda se vio en la necesidad de ponerse a trabajar, ya que también se presentaban problemas de salud y una de sus hijas es sordo-muda y como no tienen servicio medico los gastos se incrementaban y su esposo no le dejo pensión alguna ni nada parecido. Comenzó hace 10 años viendo trabajar a su cuñada, invirtió unos ahorros que tenía; en la elaboración de piñatas y poco a poco fue vendiendo más y más, hasta tener ventas importantes, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para tener más inventario y así tener mejores ventas. Con tu ayuda Avelina seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Agdam region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is married, with 3 children. This man settled in a student hostel of Baku State University which is in Baku city, Yasamal region. 15 years ago he started selling "Doner". Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy meat to cook into tasty "Doner" so he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.en:
Matlyuba R. is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother 4 children. She worked for 2 years in a gift shop, and thanks to the savings of her husband, 9 years ago she was able to start her own business. She now sells clothing for children. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon.

Thanks to her hard work, her customers increased and she had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She is now requesting a loan of 4100 Somoni (1200 USD) which she will use to buy school uniforms for children due to the season. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 10 months. Matlyuba is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: Purchasing school uniforms for children to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Coumba Woury

texts.fr: Coumba Woury D., 39 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Demba  Alette à Bourcounda depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, du thé, des biscuits et autres pour renforcer son petit commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Coumba Woury D. is 39 years old, married, and has 9 children in her care. She has been a member of the Saré Demba Alette village bank in Bourcounda for a year and a half. She wants to buy rice, sugar, oil, tea, cookies and other items to strengthen her small business. Her revenues allow her to improve her living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in a single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small business selling rice, sugar, oil, tea, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Debaia Group

texts.en:
This is the Debaia group: Fatmata M., Sonny S., and Bangali M.. They have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT that were of great help to these entrepreneurs. The last loan was for Le 800,000 each. They repaid it successfully and are now requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000 each.

Fatmata (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She was born in Fadugu, about twenty-five miles from Kabala. She is forty and married with five children. Four of her children are in secondary schools and one is in primary school. She pays for their education with proceeds from the market foods she sells in the market. Her husband is now too old to fend for the family so it is incumbent on her to take care of their children. 

Fatmata has been in business for over ten years. She sells market food at the Tender Hill market. With this loan, she will invest in market foods like onions, margi (used in sauce), peppers, salts, oil, sugar, and more. She buys most of these items in Kabala town. When they are scarce in Kabala, she will send to Freetown (about 570 round-trip) where prices for the goods are relatively cheaper. With higher profits, Fatmata will be able to assist her children in their education, feeding, and clothing and provide them with medical care when anyone falls sick.

loans.use: To purchasing food for resale in the marketplace.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mr. Seam K. is 44 years old and lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Kuth Lai, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. They do not earn enough income to provide for their family. Thus, Mr. Seam K. decided to request a loan to buy a boat for fishing. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other attends the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $749 (2007 est.) and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Née le 04 Janvier 1957 à Abidjan en Côte d'Ivoire à l'Ouest de l'Afrique, Dame S. Cécile est mariée à COMLAN Elie. Douée dans la distribution des plastiques et la vents de divers articles,dame Cécile S.  dispose d'une boutique à Ekpè au marché Houéssi où elle vend ses articles. Pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la démande de sa clientèle en cette période de fête, elle procède à la démande ce crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs Cecline S. was born on January 4th, 1957 at Abidjan, in the Ivory Coast, west Africa. She is married to Elie Comlan. Skilled in the distribution and sales of plastic ware and assorted articles, Celine maintains a boutique at the Houessi market in Ekpe where she sells her products. She is requesting this loan, to strengthen her business in order to meet her customers needs, during this holiday period.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cartons of sugar, 2 cartons of milk and 1 carton of mayonaise

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San R., 43, lives with her husband and child in Kampong Cham, where she grows and sells rice, making around $3.50 a day, while her husband has businesses grinding rice crops and making rice wine from home. On average, he makes $3 a day.

San is requesting a loan to purchase rice for resale, confident that this will be an effective means by which to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es soltero,  tiene 34 años.
Marco es técnico en mecánica automotriz, reparaba autos en un taller, por un tiempo ejerció su carrera  pero decidió cambiar de trabajo, se encarga de cobrar los alquileres a los  departamentos de unos familiares.   
Hace cuatro años atrás empezó haciendo movilidad escolar con un  woswagwen  una vecina le pidió que llevara a su niña al colegio  por una semana, en el colegio se pasaron la voz las señoras que estaba haciendo movilidad, y le pidieron  para que llevara a otras niñas. Ahora  se ha comprado un carro  grande, por día  lleva a veinticuatro niñas cada día.
Necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para su carro es gasolinera y quiere convertirlo a gas.
El sueño de Marcos es, ahorra hasta llegar a comprar una combi.
texts.en:
Marco is 34 years old and single. He is an automotive mechanic who used to repair cars in a shop. He decided to change his job and now he manages the rents of some apartments his family owns. Four years ago he also started working in school transportation with his Volkswagen. A neighbor asked him to take her daughter to school for a week—at the school other people heard he was driving kids to school and they asked him to start driving more students. Now he has bought a big car and every day he drives 24 girls to school. He is asking for a loan of 2,400 soles because his car uses gasoline and he wants to convert it to use propane. Marco’s dream is to save enough to be able to buy a bus.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: convert his car to use propane gas

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been selling fruits and vegetable since 1996. He sells fruits and vegetable from his van, which means he is a mobile salesman. He has requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase vegetables for his business.

This is Ali's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors, and small markets. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in sales. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 42 años convive con su pareja de 52 años, quien se dedica al transporte y con sus 3 hijos; Katherine de 21, Miguel Angel de 19 y Joswan de 7, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, dándole más comodidad ya que al mismo tiempo puede dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, especialmente al pequeño Joswan que aún necesita de sus cuidados. Su hija mayor, la cual tiene un bebé y quien aparece en la fotografía (su madre había salido a traer mercadería) también la ayuda en la atención de la tienda cuando ella sale por alguna urgencia, gracias a su ayuda ha podido abastecerse para la atención a la clientela. A María le gusta mucho la atención al público, que requiere de mucha paciencia, la cual ella posee en cantidades. Su negocio siempre es muy concurrido y los productos que vende se agotan rápidamente, es por eso que necesita salir a comprar más mercadería, dejando a su hija en la atención. Katherine es muy feliz apoyando a su mamá, ya que el negocio los beneficia a todos, y en el futuro espera seguir trabajando para que el negocio de su mamá crezca mucho más. También nos cuenta que su madre quiere abrir unas cabinas de Internet, comprar televisores y video juegos para alquilarlos a los jóvenes del barrio y tener con ellos otro mercado que explotar. María se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, prometiendo ser muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunos muebles y computadoras de 2do uso para sus cabinas de internet.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives in a house she owns with her 52-year-old partner who is in transportation as well as with her three children: Katherine, 21; Miguel Angel, 19; and Joswan, 7. She has a store located in her home which makes it easier for her to care for her children at the same time as the business, particularly little Joswan who still needs to be watched over. Her eldest daughter, who has a baby of her own and who is pictured (her mother had gone out to buy merchandise) also helps María taking care of the business when she needs to go out; thanks to her help she has been able to stock up in order to take care of the customers. María enjoys serving her clients very much as it requires a great deal of patience, a quality she has plenty of. Her store is always busy and the goods she offers sell out quickly. Because of this she needs to go out to buy more merchandise, during which times she leaves her daughter in charge of the business. Katherine is very happy to help her mother because the business benefits the entire family and in the future she hopes to continue workings so that her mother's business grows a lot more. She also tells us that her mother wants to open internet booths, to buy televisions and video games to rent to the youth of the neighbourhood and in this way take advantage of a new opportunity. This is María's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she promises to be very responsible and punctual in her repayments. She will use the loan to buy some furniture and second-hand computers for her internet booths.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and computers in order to provide internet services

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres  du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Bamanan kin de Kirango Markala   (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont sollicité Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les trois  prêts précédents. 
Elles comptent  utiliser ce prêt pour acheter : 3 sacs d’haricot, 25 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 draps, 16 chargements de bois de chauffe et des ingrédients pour fabrication des boissons locales (25kg de gingembre, 20kg d’oseilles de Guinée, des essences et 4sacs de sucre).
Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax et draps à Ségou, en bois de chauffe à Djibougou, en haricot et en produits de jus au marché de Diamarabougou. . Les produits sont revendus à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers, dans les marchés de Diamarabougou, de kirango et dans les foires de Sansanding et de Siribala  à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 39.500FCFA par mois utilisé généralement pour rembourser le prêt et constituer petit à petit le trousseau de mariage.
NB : Korotoumou B. était malade raison pour laquelle il y’a 6 femmes su la photo au lieu de 7.
texts.en:
The seven members of this Badenya group have an average age of 34 and 3 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They met through bonds of neighborhood, marriage, and kinship. With the intention of increasing their working capital, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan after having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans.

They intend to use this loan to buy 3 sacks of dried beans, 25 lengths of high quality "pagne" (brightly colored African print cloth), 20 bedsheets, 16 loads of firewood, and ingredients for making local soft drinks (25 kg of ginger, 20 kg of hibiscus flowers, flavorings, and 4 sacks of sugar).

They stock up on "pagnes" and bedsheets in Ségou, on firewood in Djibougou, in beans and ingredients for juice in the market of Diamarabougou. The products are sold at home, walking around the residential neighborhoods, in the markets of Diamarabougou and Kirango, and in the weekly markets of Sansanding and Siribala to a clientele composed of men, women, and children. They expect to make an average profit of 39,500 F CFA per month, which will be used in general to reimburse the loan and put together wedding trousseaus little by little.

NB: Korotoumou B. was ill; that is the reason why there are 6 women in the photo instead of 7.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals, ingredients for making juice, "pagnes" and firewood

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Karina junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos y accesorios de vehículos, actividad que realizan hace dos años y poco a poco esta mejorando sus ventas.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faja y filtros.
Los sueños de Karina son tener casa propia y otra tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Golondrinas (The Swallows) Communal Bank. She is 29 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has two children. Karina and her spouse have a store in some rented space where they sell spare parts and accessories for motor vehicles. They have been doing this for two years and little by little they are increasing their sales. Karina needs a loan of 3,000 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of fan belts and filters. Karina dreams of having her own house and another parts store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fan belts and filters

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Mariéme N. gère un atelier de couture  mais aussi  elle vend des parfums. Son atelier est installé dans sa maison au quartier Grand Mbour situé au bord de la mer à Mbour. Mariéme vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le domicile conjugal.les  revenus qu’elle tire de son activité lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne  au même titre que son marie. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicite elle veut acheter des tissus des parfums pour élargir son activité pour affirmer plus son indépendance économique. Elle a cinquante deux  (52) ans et s’occupe de sa famille avec beaucoup de plaisir
texts.en:
Mariéme N. manages a sewing workshop, but she also sells perfumes. Her shop is set up inside her house in the Grand Mbour district located on the seashore in Mbour. She lives with her husband and children in the marital home. The revenues she derives from her work enable her to help cover day-to-day expenses just like her husband does. With this loan she’s requesting, she wants to buy some cloth and perfumes to expand her business in order to affirm further her economic independence. She is 52 years old, and she very happily takes care of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is from the town of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to support the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa G. is 23 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Her husband is a police officer while she is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). Yaa hawks to sell. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Yaa buys bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years. Yaa aspires to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Nasiba has been selling kid’s clothing in the central market of Shahrituz. Nasiba is married and the mother of seven children. She is determined to make a better living for the entire family. Nasiba is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Nasiba has both a strong customer base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3400 Somoni to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Nasiba plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a mother with the determination to give a decent life to her children. She is 41 years old and married to Donato. She is the mother to two boys. She lives in Jala-jala, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

Life was not easy for Sofia, just depending on the insufficient salary of her husband. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to have an opportunity to open a business. Her previous loan was wisely invested in her sari-sari store (general store) business. The store sells smoothly and well but the income from the store is not sufficient to sustain the needs of her family. She needs to think of another business in which to invest her next loan.

Now Sofia requests a loan of 15,000 as starting capital for her primary business selling rice. The amount will be used to pay for thirty-eight sacks of rice and payment for transportation expenses. From the field, after harvesting rice, farmers will sell rice to her and, for her profit, she will resell it to another businessmen with a much higher price than she paid.

Sofia dreams of having a grocery store someday and space in the market for a retail business.

loans.use: To pay for 38 sacks of rice and transportation expenses

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza C. started with a variety store business when her sister gave her small amount of money for a capital after the death of her husband in 2004. She had two children that goes to school then. One in college and the other is in high school. Profit she had at that time wasn't enough for all expenses required by the education of her children and their personal needs thus, business was sporadic because capital was misused most of the times.

When one of her children is graduating from college, the financial need for her education is increasing affecting the stability of her business. Then, she realized she needs loan to sustain the financial need of her business and for making it grow to profit bigger. After paying her previous loans in ASHI, now she wants to loan larger amount for her business. Her two children are helping her in managing her store. One had graduated from college and the other one is highschool undergraduate.  With her family working in the business she put up and with the loans she can avail, someday she envisioned that her business can generate employment in their community. From a variety store she aims to make it a grocery store or a mini-mart in their community.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her growing variety store that offers covenience and accessebility of buying the basic commodities.

loans.name: Siloma

texts.en:
"Siloma I. (0) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai.  She is married and has 8 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Siloma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Siloma has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Siloma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Siloma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Siloma is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Siloma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Afi Dawui

texts.fr: Afi est une femme qui s’est lancée dans le commerce du bois de chauffe depuis 2002. Elle habite le quartier d’Agoe-Logopé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins universitaires de sa petite sœur. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, plus précisément à Kpalimé, localité située à des dizaines de kilomètre de Lomé. Elle est bien connue dans son quartier comme étant spécialisée dans la vente de bois de chauffe de meilleure qualité. Actuellement elle approvisionne certains petits restaurants et les maquis de la capitale. Elle a besoin de lancer en ce moment une nouvelle commande ; c’est pourquoi elle compte beaucoup sur un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter un taxi bagage de bois de chauffage. Le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers l’intérieur du pays. Cette femme n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
Afi is a woman who started a business involving firewood in 2002. She lives in the Agoe-Logopé district in Lomé. This business enables her to support herself and to provide for her younger sister attending university. Afi stocks up in the country’s interior, in Kpalimé to be exact; it’s a town located dozens of kilometers from Lomé. She is also well-known in her area, since she is specialized in selling better-quality firewood. Currently, she supplies certain small restaurants and eateries of the capital. At present, she needs to start a new supply order; this is why she is counting a lot on a WAGES loan in order to buy a luggage-taxi of firewood. The rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to the country’s interior. This woman is not married and has no children at all to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en: N. Felista is a friendly lady who works so hard for a better life and that of others. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children and the eldest being 15 years and in secondary school. Felista is a Head teacher in Nabuti where she owns a private school and she is happy that she has managed to run it for 4 years successfully. She hopes to continue improving the academic standard of the school so that her pupils could be good citizens. She also hopes to secure enough land so that she could expand more as well as have a good house for her family. Felista needs a loan to help buy more food stuffs for her children like maize flour, sugar and beans for efficiency, since most parents pay school fees in small installments yet work has to go on at the school.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs like maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Fandaw

texts.fr:
Madame Fandaw H. est une vendeuse de petit déjeuner et des poissons.  Elle travail à Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar proche de la mer.  Le petit déjeuner typiquement Sénégalais est constitué de pain avec du chocolat, thon ou Niebe (haricots préparés) avec un café Touba au lait.  Madame Fandaw a plus de 20 ans de expérience dans son activité.  Ce crédit présente son premier prêt. Madame H. est mariée avec cinq enfants.  

Madame H. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fandaw H. sells breakfast meals and fish. She works in Camberene, a seaside suburb of Dakar. The typical Senegalese breakfast consists of bread with chocolate, tuna or Niebe (prepared beans) and a Touba coffee with milk. Mrs. H. has over 20 years experience in this business, but this is her first loan. She is married with five children.
Mrs. H. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Child and Family Development Program (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially aims to protect children born into poor families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these children can receive loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her little breakfast stand

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Claver S. is 51 years old. He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 16. He lives in the Nyamagabe District of the Gikongoro Province of Rwanda where he has operated his business of grinding tools since 2006.  He employs two people from his community as helpers. His business is open each day from 6 AM to 6 PM.

Claver is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to buy a new and better quality grinder. He hopes this will allow him to serve more customers, which will help him to earn more profits. With the profits he hopes to earn, he plans to continue to reinvest into his business so that it will expand. Also, he plans to set aside money that will allow him to pay his children's school fees and, one day, to buy his family a house.

loans.use: To buy a new grinding machine

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Soltera, tiene 55 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su propio negocio de Venta de Comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mercedes participates in the Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazon de Jesus II” in the Bagua District of the Province of Utcubamba , Dept. of the Amazonas. She is single and a 55-year old mother of one son who depends on her. With the security of having better cooking conditions, she is able to prepare different types of cuisines. Of her own doing, with the first loan of S/. 300.00, she undertook a business of selling meals she would typically make in her own home. In actuality, despite it being time consuming she continues this same business for her loyal clients who come to her daily. She attends to her clients in charismatic fashion. With a loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy ingredients used for daily food preparations, such as a sack of rice, sugar, cooking packages, chicken halves and also some utensils for cooking work. She wants to give her clients her best efforts. She prepares everything and still feels strong enough to run the business and continues forward. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their contributions towards her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchases ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Bonifacio tiene 57 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene dos hijos que dependen aún de él, la familia vive en una vivienda propia. Con la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad, con 31 años de experiencia juntamente con su esposa. Su competencia es media, porque Bonifacio es responsable con sus clientes. El destino del crédito es para la Compra de mercadería al por mayor “papa, chuño y tunta”. Este es su tercer crédito, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con otras Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Bonifacio, 57, is married and has two dependent children; the family lives in their own house. He, together with his wife, has sold potatoes, chuño (freeze-dried potato, for making vegetable soup), and tunta (white chuño) in the local markets for the last 31 years. His competition is moderate because Bonifacio is responsible with his customers. The financing will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale. This is his third loan. He managed his previous loans optimally and he has no financial obligations with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients at wholesale.  Potatoes, chuño (freeze-dried potato, for making vegetable soup), tunta (white chuño)

loans.name: Julia Veronica

texts.es: La Señora Julia es un cliente nuevo que llega a la empresa por la promocion hecha por la zona de achumani, ella es madre soltera de dos pequeños, vive en anticretico y sostiene a su familia con una tienda de barrio que tambien la utiliza como snack por las noches, donde vende salchipapas y silpanchos, ya que a esas horas es el unico lugar donde se puede encontrar comida por las zona, la señora  tambien es propietaria de un minibus del cual recibe renta diaria. La señora julia al ver que su local no tiene el suficiente espacio ni la capacidad para atender la cantidad de clientes que  visitan el lugar decidio alquilar un cuarto que esta al frente de su actual negocio y equiparlo para poder atender mejor y a mas clientes poe eso solicito el prestamo para la compra de muebles y mercaderia.
texts.en:
Julia is a new client who comes to us thanks to the recuriting efforts made in the Achumani area. She is a single mother of two children. She lives under the "anticretico" (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) modality and supports her family with a neighborhoold grocery store that at night she turns into a snack bar where she sells such typical dishes as "salchipapas" (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces) and "silpanchos" (a schnitzel-style beef that is served with tomatoes, onions and a base layer of rice. It is often served with fried eggs on top.) At that time of night, this is the only place in the area where such dishes can be found. She also owns a minibus which provides her with a daily rental income. Julia, upon noting that her eatery lacked enough space to accommodate all the customers that came, decided to rent a room which is across the way from her current place of business and furnish it to better serve more customers. This is the reason behind the loan request to buy furniture and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and furniture.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 27 años, y cuya familia esta constituida por su esposo e hijos y juntos viven en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 9 años que se dedica al cultivo de papa, actividad que labora en las tierra de su padre, y de la producción que obtiene lo lleva a vender en las principales ferias de su localidad, ofreciéndolo de manera ambulante. Sus ingresos aumentan cuando vende los fines de semana, ya que el resto de días se dedica a su pequeño hijo, por lo que sus padres y hermanas la ayudan en tal labor. Hasta el momento su trabajo le ha sido rentable, por lo que esta planeando en el futuro producir más cantidad de papas para vender al por mayor. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y esta  muy entusiasmada de continuar adelante con su  trabajo, además que esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su siguiente cultivo.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 27, lives with her husband and children in a leased home. For the last 9 years she has farmed potatoes, an activity she does on her father's land. She travels to sell her crops in the main markets in her area. Her income increases when she sells on the weekend because the rest of the week she takes care of her small son; he parents and sisters help her with her work. To date, her work has been profitable so she is planning to increase potato production in the future so as to sell at wholesale. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is enthusiastic about continuing with her work. Besides, she is very happy to be a member of her communal bank. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next crops.

loans.name: Miriam De La Paz

texts.es: La señora Miriam tiene 34 años de edad es una madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, todos estudiantes, su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, vigoron y sopas los fines de semana, tiene dos años en las ventas el cual le ha ido bien. También vende cosmético pues ante vendía mucho pero ahora solo por encargo y trabaja con productos de la Avon, ya que se dedica mas a la venta de comida. Para ella ha sido de mucho beneficio estos financiamiento ya que ha logrado poder hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa, como persona de poco recurso le es difícil construir de una sola vez es por eso con este préstamo comprara: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para levantar las paredes del baño y el inodoro ya que no lo ha construido por falta de dinero el cual es de mucha importancia para una buena higiene y privacidad en su familia. Sus planes es poder aumentar su inventario para poder vender más y poder cubrir las necesidades diarias de su casa ya que los gastos básico de agua y luz han incrementado.
texts.en:
Miriam is 34 years old. She is the mother of a family of three beautiful children, all students. Her business is selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales), vigoron (pork salad) and soups on weekends. She has been selling them for two years, and it has gone well for her. She also sells cosmetics; at least, she used to sell a lot, but now she only sells cosmetics by pre-order and she works with Avon products, focusing more on food sales. These loans have been very helpful for her, for she has been able to make improvements to her small house. As she is a person with few resources, it is difficult for her to build everything at once. That is why she will use this loan to buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build the walls of the bathroom, which she has not built yet for lack of money. This is very important for her family's good hygiene and privacy. Her plans are to be able to increase her inventory so she can sell more and be able to cover her household's daily needs now that the basic expenses of water and light have increased.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to build walls and a division between the bath and toilet

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica E. de 27 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña pero si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años que estudian en escuelas particulares.

Angélica empezó con un puesto pequeño de comida afuera de su casa vendiendo platos como arroz con menestra y pollo asado al pasar de los años tuvo muy buenos ingresos.

Ahora Angélica vende platos como pescados al vapor, arroz con pollo, parrilladas de carnes etc. Comienza a vender la comida desde las 18h00 hasta las 22h00 su promedio de clientes es de 30. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, carnes, legumbres para poder hacer más platos de comida. En el futuro quiere un restaurante con empleados.
texts.en:
Angélica is 27 years old and lives in the urban part of Suburbio de Guayaquil. She lives in a thatch house, but she has all of the basic services. She is a single mother and has two children, ages 3 and 5, who study in a private school. Angélica started with a small food stall outside her home, selling dishes such as rice with vegetables and grilled chicken. Over the years she has had a good income. Now Angélica also sells other dishes, such as steamed fish, chicken with rice, and grilled meats. She begins selling her food at 6:00 pm and continues until 10:00 pm. She serves an average of 30 customers. One of her complications is the rain. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy ice, meats, and beans in order to be able to make more food dishes. In the future she would like to open a restaurant with her own employees.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, rice, meats and other ingredients

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La señora Maricruz L. vive en el municipio de El Sauce y ha tomado la firme decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ella es una dama muy trabajadora y se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia que depende de ella.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para llevar a cabo la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo dicha obra y una vez finalizada poder beneficiar a su amada familia ofreciéndoles un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Maricruz L. lives in El Sauce and she has taken the firm decision to invest in home improvements because she is a very hard-working woman who is concerned with her family's wellbeing; they depend on her. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to undertake this project so that, once it is finished, it will benefit her beloved family by providing a proper home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, beans in bulk.

loans.name: Manku

texts.en:
Mrs. Manku N. is the resident of Dolchoki Village. Dolchoki is located in Ialitpur district. Dolchoki is one of the underdeveloped villages of lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture. Mrs. N. lives with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 3 and the younger son is studying in grade 2.

Both Mrs. N. and Mr. N. are farmers in the village of Dolchoki. They grows seasonal vegetable in their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. Now Mrs. N. is requesting for a loan to buys seeds and fertilizer for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de mèches, de tissages, des postiches, des perruques et renouveler ses outils de travail

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu B., 32, lives with her husband and one child in the  Wellington area of Freetown. Her husband is a businessman. Kadiatu sells baby clothes, bags, flasks, and rubber bowls at the Wellington market. She has been a client of LAPO, SL, for two years and has taken out three loans since joining. With her previous loans she purchased more goods thereby expanding her business. This time Kadiatu is seeking a loan of two million Leones to purchase a larger quantity of baby clothes, bags, flasks and rubber bowls. She believes that this will allow her to expand her business and increase profits, giving her the opportunity to support her family.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for her clothing business

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Cleofe E. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Cleofe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cleofe raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cleofe has been engaged in her business for over 12 years. Cleofe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Cleofe from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Beatriz Carmen

texts.es:
Beatriz Carmen P. P. tiene 22 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres y 2 hijos, Moreo (9 años) y Juan David (4 años).  Ellos viven en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Beatriz es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que estan estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Beatriz cultiva habas, papas y cebadas. Compras los productos que necesita en Guaranda cada semana y hace las ventas de sus productos en Guaranda cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar económicamente sus cultivos, comprar semillas y para ganadería.  Piensa que este crédito le ayudará a mejorar sus productos y cambiará su vida de familia. Su sueño es salir adelante con sus estudios y su trabajo. Quisiera tener un micro empresa.

Le gusta la costumbre del carnaval donde se come cuy, chancho, gallina, se toma y se baila durante 5 días.
texts.en:
Beatriz Carmen P. P. is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and her two children, Moreo (age 9) and Juan David (age 4). They live in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Beatriz grows beans, potatoes, and barley. She buys the merchandise she needs in Guaranda each week and then sells her products in Guaranda every six months.

She is requesting a loan so that she can improve her crops. Beatriz plans to buy seeds and use part of the money for raising cattle. She believes this loan will help improve her products and transform the life of her family. Her dream is to succeed in her studies and in her work. She hopes to have her own micro-enterprise.

Beatriz enjoys the Carnival tradition that involves eating (guinea pigs, pork, and chicken), drinking, and dancing for five days.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & invest part of the money in raising cattle

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 46 años de edad, vive en su domicilio con su  esposa quien es ama de casa. 
Tienen cinco hijos, todos varones, de 8, 10, 17, 20 y 22 años respectivamente de los cuales los tres más pequeños se encuentran estudiando mientras que los otros dos  se encuentran trabajando en Brasil trabajando en la costura.
El Sr. Carlos trabajaba anteriormente en una fábrica llamada Simple Costura pero como ya tenía varios años de empleo decidió salir y trabajar por cuenta propia por la experiencia que obtuvo y así formar su propia clientela. 
Inició sus actividades como costurero en el año 2.000 en su domicilio en donde sus hijos mayores que se encuentran en el extranjero le ayudaban con la confección de prendas de todo tipo.
En un principio confeccionaba prendas para otra persona tanto  para la venta como así también para  llevar al exterior ya que viajaba mucho y de esa manera podía llevar sus productos tales como: remeras, pantalones y  lencerías.
Su mayor sueño es de agrandar su mini-empresa junto con el apoyo de sus hijos.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de telas y una nueva máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46 years old and lives with his wife, who takes care of their house. They have five children, all sons, ages 8, 10, 17, 20 and 22. The three youngest ones are in school while the eldest two have sewing jobs in Brazil. Carlos previously worked in a factory called Simple Costura (Simply Sewing) but after working there for a number of years he left to work on his own thanks to his experience and formed his own clientèle. He started his tailor business in the year 2000, working out of his home while his eldest sons who are now abroad helped him making all kinds of garments. At first he made clothing as much to take abroad as to sell since he traveled a lot and he could take the products, such as T-shirts, pants and lingerie, with him. His biggest dream is to expand his small business with the support of his sons. He is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics and a new sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Marites is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: David Nterere

texts.en:
David Nterere K. is 30 years old, married to Nayioloang Enole K. and supports four members of his family by working as a farmer. He owns a plot of land and has worked on it for more than three years. 

He learned about KADET from a friend who is a member. He is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy pesticides to spray on his wheat crop, buy seeds and take other steps to improve his farm's output. 

He hopes to use the revenue made possible by this loan to expand his farm and begin moving into large-scale commercial farming. His long-term goals are to attain financial independence and improve his family's living standards.

David is a hardworking young man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide, and take other steps to improve his farm's output

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio, de 58 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Los años le han enseñado a Artemio, que tiene que trabajar muy duro si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus sembríos de papa, arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y para él siempre le fue difícil tener que cuidar sus campos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar todas sus tierras, ya que así podrá mejorar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Artemio is 58 years old. He is someone who has always worked hard to advance in life. He lives alone in his own home and his greatest wish is to have a peaceful old age. Time has taught Artemio that one has to work very hard if the harvest is going to be the best in the village so it is with a great deal of effort that he has cared for his potato, sweet pea, spinach, and carrot plantations. His products are very sought out in the markets of the city of Tarma. What he most enjoys about the work is the harvest. For the past 45 years he has worked in the business and it has always been very difficult to ward his fields from insects and pests. In time he hopes to cultivate all of his land to improve his yield. This is the eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has always been on time with his payments and he plans on keeping his record. In his community bank he is a very engaged member. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he requests he will purchase pea seeds, this being the harvest that sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pea seeds.

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en: Enhbold S. is 47 years old married woman with two adult -age children. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, with her family in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her youngest son attends university. Her husband is a horse cart driver who transports loads to supplement his family's income. Enhbold operates a dairy trading business in her town. She purchases a large amount of dairy products from herders at wholesale prices and sells them back in a local market at retail prices. Enhbold has been engaged this business for 6 years and has built a stable operation. Over the years of operation, she has managed to expand her business and increase her product line which sells 10 types of dairy products. For the future, she hopes to grow her business by including other kinds of dairy products. Enhbold is a very modest and hardworking person. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies from herders in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Gema Liceth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

Para la señora Gema este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es socia fundadora y además es la tesorera del Banco, responsabilidad que cumple muy a gusto ya que sabe que esto es por el bien del grupo. Tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un precioso niño de un año, está estudiando el tercer semestre de enfermería en la Universidad.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado en el mercado de la ciudad Portoviejo, ellos venden al por mayor a los comerciantes que venden al menudeo (por libra) aunque a veces también venden por piezas a los clientes. El Trabaja todos los días desde las 2am ya que tiene que trasladarse a Manta a comprar el pescado, luego lo trae a Portoviejo donde ella lo ayuda en la  entrega. Sus labores terminan  a las 15h00,  de allí ella se va a su casa a prepararse para ir a sus estudios.

 Este crédito es justamente para invertirlo en comprar pescado.
 
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y ejercerla.
texts.en:
In the area of Andrés De Vera, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which is known as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” (a stadium where football matches are held), every fifteen days the members of the Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank meet.

This would be Mrs. Gema’s second loan in the Communal Bank, she is a founding member and is the treasurer for the Bank which is a responsibility that she enjoys very much since she knows it’s good for her group. Gema is 20 years old and lives in a common law marriage where she has a beautiful one year old little boy. Gema is her third semester in nursing school at the University.

Gema and her husband sell fish in the market of the city of Portoviejo. They sell their fish wholesale to merchants that sell retail (per pound) although sometimes they also sell fish to customers. Her husband works everyday from 2 a.m. since he has to go to Manta to buy the fish, then he brings it to Portoviejo where Gema helps him deliver it. Their work ends at 3 p.m. and Gema goes home to get ready to go to school.

This loan is to buy fish.

Gema’s dream is to finish her degree and practice her profession.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Marichill

texts.en:
Marichill B. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergent, and snack food to members of the local community. Marichill has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marichill joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichill has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Marichill is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marichill from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for a small general store, and as working capital

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita A. is a widow who lives on Luke Wright St. in Barangay Tinago, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a piggery and a food vending business. Julita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past sixteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $507, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more feed for her piggery and to buy an additional hog to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Julita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of Piggery

loans.name: María Susana

texts.es:
María Susana tiene 61 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores, resiD. junto a su esposo en el caserío Huambocancha del distrito D. Cajamarca, una zona situada en la sierra norte del país, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y el comercio, se encuentra situada aproximadamente a seis horas D. camino D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la venta D. comida en un puesto ubicado dentro del mercado San Sebastián (uno D. los mercados más conocidos D. la zona), ella cuenta con una clientela fidelizada y con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad suele ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas insumos con los cuales pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño
texts.en:
María Susana is 61 years old, married and has four grown children.  She lives with her husband in the village of Huambocancha in Cajamarca district, an area in the northern highlands of the country.  Its main activities are agriculture and traD., and it is located about six hours' walk from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been working for ten years selling food from a market stand located within the San Sebastian (one of the most popular markets in the area).  She has a loyal clientele, and with her earnings from this activity she is often able to help her husband in supporting their family.

María wants to grow her business by acquiring more supplies with which she can expand her sales and earn higher income, so has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a very responsible and hardworking woman. People who know her think of her with much esteem and affection.

loans.use: Buying supplies to grow her business (selling food in the marketplace).

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 34-year-old single man living in Saida. Simon is a taxi driver since 18 years of age, and it’s his only way of making a living. Simon is well known in his area and he has a very good reputation. Simon is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to pay for what’s left on the cost of the car he bought to improve his business. His first loan was for improving his business, and it did. Simon hopes to open a private taxi company in the future.

loans.use: To pay for car bought to improve business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Estela B. is from the barangay (village) of Calabayan in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and blessed with one school-aged child. To make a living, she operates a internet café. She’s been engaged in this business for 2 years and earns at least Php 6,000.00 per month from computer service rentals. 

In April 2008, Estela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program has successfully repaid a loan of Php 20,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 30,000.00. This 2nd loan will be used to maintain and repair her computers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, child’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Repair and maintain their computers

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S., 47, owns a health enterprise producing traditional medicines. She lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. To earn a daily income, Sen S. tries to find many kinds of tree roots from the nearby woods, then processes and combines them as sets of medicines which she sells to patients who are her neighbors. She has a partner in her husband, Yosas, 29, a garment worker. The couple is blessed with a young child who attends school and depends on their incomes. Lately, Sen S.' motorbike has been breaking down while being driven. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en:
Davaatseren A. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest two sons are attending a local primary school. His wife currently stays at home to take care of their younger daughter.  Previously, between 2006 and 2008, she operated a consumer goods trading business.

Davaatseren supports his entire family by operating three separate businesses:  a vegetable growing and trading business, a taxi service, and a mobile dairy retail business. He grows a variety of vegetables to sell to local traders after harvesting them. He started this business in 2003 and has made quick progress. 

After years of successful operations, Davaatseren managed to buy a car.  This enabled him to start his other two businesses in 2009:  a taxi service and a mobile dairy products trading business.  He has gained significant experience and skills in his businesses over the years. He a is skilled businessman and an open-minded person. 

Davaatseren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products to resell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia nació y vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. Sonia trabaja en un hotel “Royal Qosqo” como recepcionista y requiere el préstamo para uso personal y no especifico para que exactamente.  

Sonia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Sonia was born and lives in the historic city of Cusco in the department of Cusco, Peru.  In the city of Cusco, the people have a variety of businesses providing goods and services that are strongly related to tourism.  Sonia works in the hotel "Royal Qosqo" as a receptionist, and needs a loan for personal use; she is not specific about how the loan will be used.

Sonia belongs to the communal bank "Hijas de Maria" of the Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco, Peru.  This communal bank is in their 3rd year, and it is going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: for personal use

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a vegetable plantation/farming.  Her husband Ivan, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have no children. Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for house improvements and prepare for her future.  L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María L. P. de 50 años de edad, reside en el cantón primavera, ubicado en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana. Su grupo familiar está conformado únicamente por su compañero de vida. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos, la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias, debido a que es una de las tiendas más fuertes del sector y también gracias a su excelente ubicación la cual es estar ubicada sobre calle principal, a la vista de todas las personas que transitan por ese lugar. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para surtir la tienda, así mismo desea comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor para poder vender otro tipo de productos en su tienda y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, las cuales serán de gran beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa Maria L. Pleitez is 50 years old and lives in the Primavera neighbourhood, located in Santa Ana, the province capital. Her family unit is made up of herself and her life partner. She owns a store where she sells perishable goods. It provides her with good profits, as it's one of the best shops of its kind and also thanks to its excellent location, right on the main street, within view of everyone passing through there. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock her store. She would also like to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to widen the type of products sold in her store and thus increase her profits, which will be very beneficial for her family unit.

loans.use: Buy perishable goods.

location.town: cantón primavera, departamento de Santa Ana

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Femme de 47ans d’âge, mariée, mère de 6 enfants avec un niveau secondaire, elle se lance dans la vente d’habits pour femmes et enfants.

Depuis 1993, elle vend dans le marché et son activité marche bien. Elle a des ventes s de 20.000F à 35.000F par jour.
Le prêt qu’elle aura va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock de sa marchandise en achetant :
Les grands boubous pour dames, pantalons, blouses, robes pour filles, ensemble pour petits garçons, slips mixtes, serres têtes, barrettes, foulards.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans un marché de la place.

Ses projets sont :
 -Faire agrandir son activité
