 - Augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour devenir fournisseur.
- Faire venir des boubou , pagnes et articles pour enfants de l’Afrique de l’ouest.

Être dépendante financièrement est son soucis afin de subvenir aux besoins quotidien de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady is 47 years old and a married mother of six with a secondary education; she sells women's and children's clothing for a living. She has sold her wares from the market since 1993, and generates daily sales between 20,000 F and 35,000 F. 
She will use her loan to purchase more stock, such as: large boubous (loose robes) for women, trousers, jackets, girls' dresses, children's suits, mixed pants, bras, hairpins and headscarves. She sources her goods from a market in the town square. 

Her plans are: to drive her business further, and to generate higher sales so that she may one day become a wholesaler herself, and import boubous, pagnes (wax cloths) and children's clothing from West Africa. 

Her main concern is that she remains financially independent so that she can meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase the following from a wholesaler: large boubous (loose robes), trousers, girls' dresses, suits, hairclips and headscarves.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 26 years old and the youngest is 19. Rosemarie's husband works as a farmer.
Rosemarie grows pigs to earn a living. She maintains a small piggery where she fattens the pigs that she will sell to the market. Rosemarie makes sure her pigs grow healthy because they will then be easier to sell. She has requested a loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. Rosemarie's wish is for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 28 años es un joven trabajador. Hace 6 años convive con Nidia su esposa a la que quiere mucho pues le dio 2 hermosos hijos: Edinson y Angela, a los que cuida y educa en una casa que alquila en el caserío de Huanchan. Desde niño comenzó a producir la tierra; sus padres le enseñaron las técnicas de cultivos con los que comenzó a producir sus propios sembríos de papa, arveja, maíz y flor gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus cultivos con rapidez, “todo depende del buen cuidado”, menciona. Además de ser bueno en la comercialización de sus cosechas que vende a los intermediarios que visitan constantemente sus terrenos agrícolas. También con esa misma dedicación cuida de 3 reses entre toros y vacas, con los que realiza el arado de tierra como también queso, obteniendo así un dinero extra; con lo que está pensando comprar su casa propia, y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión huanchan”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde trabaja con mucho esmero por el desarrollo de su asociación. Edwin, comenzará a sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”, por ello con el dinero que solicita está pensando comprar varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos para que puedan crecer y dar un buen fruto.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young 28-year-old worker, who has lived with his wife, Nidia, for six years.  They have two beautiful children, Edinson and Angela, whom they care for and educate in a rented house in the Huanchan rural area.  

From the time he was a child his parents taught him how to farm the land using their cultivation techniques; and he began growing potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolus flowers three years ago.  What he likes best about his work is watching the crops grow quickly.  He says, "It all depends on how well you care for them.".  He is also very adept at selling the crops to the intermediaries who visit his land constantly.

With that same dedication he cares for his three head of cattle which he uses to plough the earth and to make cheese for extra income.  He's thinking about buying his own home so he can provide his family with a better lifestlye.

He belongs to the "Unión Huanchan" communal bank and this is his fifth loan through MFP, where he works hard to help develop the association.  Edwin will begin planting the "Yungay" and "Única" potato varieties and wants to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to help them grow.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer

loans.name: Las Hormigas De Tolcayuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Hormigas de Tolcayuca" porque para las integrantes del grupo las “hormigas” simbolizan trabajo. Las integrantes se consideran ser muejeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y responsables entre ellas y con sus familias. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. Esta conformado por nueve integrantes cada una siendo mujeres emprendedoras con un negocio ya establecido. La señora Agustina Viviana R. es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa, especificamente de lencería por catalogo, de marcas reconocidas. Lleva aproximadamente dos años con dicha actividad y por tal razón es conocida por sus clientes como una persona responsable y atenta con los demás. Decidió elegir está actividad por la facilidad de ventas con sus clientes y porque le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender las actividades del hogar y además el obtener ingresos extras que le permitan apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y darles una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Agustina tiene tres hijos; uno de 9 años, otro de 8 años y otro tan solo 8 meses respectivamente quienes dos de ellos actualmente estudian. El crédito que solicito la señora Agustina lo utilizará para la compra de mercancía y catalogos de la temprada Primavera-Verano.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Hormigas de Tolcayuca" (The Ants of Tolcayuca) because, for the members of this group, ants symbolize work.  The group's members consider themselves to be enterprising, hard-working and responsible women both amongst themselves and with their families.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo, in Mexico.  It has nine members, each of whom is an enterprising woman with an already established business.

Agustina Viviana R. is the group's treasurer.  She is 27 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  She sells brand-name clothes, specifically lingerie, through a catalog.  She has been in this business for approximately two years and is therefore well known by her customers as a responsible person who is attentive to other people.  She decided to start this business as it is easy to sell to her customers and because it allows her to have time free to attend to her household duties and also make extra income which allows her to support her children in their studies and provide them with a better quality of life.  Agustina has three children aged 9, 8 and 8 months.  Two of her children are currently in school.

Agustina will use her loan to buy merchandise and catalogs for the Spring-Summer season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, catalogs and clothes (lingerie)

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y es padre de 2 niños, él tiene 50 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 6 años de experiencia como jefe de registro civil de la ciudad de Urubamba  y los podemos encontrar cumpliendo su deberes en la municipalidad de Urubamba desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 de lunes a viernes, Mario también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.

Mario solicita un préstamo a Asociación Arariwa de 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar más animales como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, patos y cerdos para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de sus 2 hijos.

Mario cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en: Mario is a native of the city of Urubama and is a father of two children. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. This area is known for being a tourist zone rich with livestock and agriculture, and the skillful and hard-working people identify with the local saying: "Peru's Archaeological Province." Mario has more than six years of experience as Urubamba's chief registrar and can be found fulfilling his duties from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. Monday through Friday. He also makes a living raising small animals and is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa that he plans to use to purchase more animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and pigs, so he can increase his capital. This will allow him to expand his business and earn more profits he can put toward the well-being of his two children. Mario has a good reputation with Asociación Arariwa since in the past he has repaid his various loans punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
For some, work is only a means to meet a higher need in life. This is the case of Rochelle, 32. Rochelle graduated from high school, but was not able to continue to college. At present, she is a single mom to one child, whom she loves and cares for dearly. They live in Pasay City with Rochelle’s other family members. Rochelle is also active in her role as a community partner in CCT. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Rochelle has a store where she cooks meals for customers and sells varieties of daily essentials, from toiletries to instant food. The store is located adjacent to their house for efficient management on her side as she serves her fellow community members. Rochelle has stayed long in the business, and her family helps her in managing the store. She earns around 15, 000 PHP in terms of monthly net income.

To help her sustain her business, which is the primary source of her income, Rochelle applies for a 13,000 PHP loan. Purchasing necessary goods for her store is the main use of this loan. She plans to buy meat, fish, and vegetables to come up with delicious, healthy meals which her customers would surely love. She will also purchase stocks of seasonings, dairy products, and toiletries to meet the needs of her customers. Rochelle says that the loan helps her meet the daily needs of her family, as well as the finances needed for the education of her child.

Rochelle confesses that competition is her toughest challenge at present. There are a lot of stores having the same products that she has, and so she finds it hard to elicit loyalty among her customers. Sometimes the meals she cooked were not all sold, and she was forced to lower the price just to call it a day. But Rochelle never entertains the thought of defeat because her life—and the life of her family—hinges on the success of her business. This is where she will draw money for the medication of her child, the payment of the house bills, and much more. That is why her prayer is for her business to grow profitably and for her family to stay strong and united.



*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for the expansion of her product inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE" porque ellas consideran que tienen que ir creciendo hacia delante, tanto personal como en su trabajo, este grupo esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. Esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Valeria es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudió hasta la secundaria y es madre soltera de 2 hijos varones de 8 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace ya 5 años, ella requiere dicho prestamo para expandir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades del cliente ofreciendoles mayor variedad de mercancia, asi mismo poder mejorar sus ingreso y con ello elevar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y alimentar su espiritu emprendedor. Con el prestamo ella va a comprar zapatos y ropa de diferentes colores, tallas y modelos para que todos los gustos de sus clientes, ya que le hacen pedidos distintos y de diferentes marcas.
texts.en: This group is called Mujeres Siempre Adelante (Women Always Moving Forward) because they feel that they must be moving forward, both personally and professionally. This group is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. It is formed of nine members. Valeria is the group's treasurer. She is 26 years old, studied through high school, and is a single mother of two sons who are eight and three years old. She has been selling clothes and shoes for five years. She needs this loan to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs by offering a better variety of merchandise. This is how she will be able to improve her revenue and improve her sons' quality of life, as well as boost her entrepreneurial spirit. With this loan she will purchase shoes and clothes in different colors, sizes, and styles to please all her customers, since they put in distinct orders for different brands.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 30 years old and has made a living by running a retail shop in Njabini town for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and is now applying for his third loan.  He paid both of his previous loans fully and on time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy more goods for sell in his store. In the future, Bernard hopes to expand his retail shop to a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 2.

Jelyn and her husband are both farmers. She helps till their land and grow crops, such as rice and corn.  Jelyn works hard to support her family.  She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.  Jelyn hopes this loan will help improve their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Las Chispitas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama Flor de mayo, y se ubica en la localidad de Julián Grajales, se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada uno tiene  diferente actividad.
La señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Carmela, ella es casada, con el señor  Agustín  y con quien procreo cinco hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Jorge Rodolfo  de  veintidós  años de edad, Armando  de veintiun años de edad, Rafael de dieciocho años de  edad, Dionisia de de diecisiete años de edad y el mas pequeño es Alejandro de ocho años de edad.
Ella se dedica a  la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres en donde  lleva  seis meses  trabajando con ello y comenta que le va bien ya que está  teniendo un buen ingreso y a mejorado su calidad de vida ya que su esposo la apoya con la produccion de algunas verduras y  pero aun así solicito el préstamo para comprar otras que le hacen falta en su negocio.
Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por su propia creatividad ya que en su rancho su esposo siembra chayotes, chipilín, rábanos, entre otros y decidió venderlos para así apoyarse con un poco mas de dinero  y dárselo a su hijos que estudian en otro estado de la Republica Mexicana (Veracruz).
Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y  su actividad pueda  trabajar más para poder ahorrar y  así seguirá apoyando a sus hijos a que terminen una carrera.
La señora que integra el grupo son las siguientes: Mirna quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de material para la elaboración de block, la señora Esperanza invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, Aurora  en la compra de de refrescos.
texts.en:
The group is called Flor de Mayo and is located in Julian Grajales. It is made up of 4 women who each do different activities. The woman who was interviewed is Carmela. She is married to Agustin and they have 5 children who are still dependent on them: Jorge Rodolfo, 22; Armando, 21; Rafael, 18, Dionisia, 17; and the youngest is Alejandro, 8. 

Carmela buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this for 6 months and says that it's going well and is bringing good income and has improved her quality of life. Her husband supports her by growing some vegetables, but even so she needs a loan to buy others that she lacks.

Her inspiration for this business began as a result of her own creativity. Her husband plants chayote, chipilin, radishes and other things and she decided to sell them so that she could support herself with a little more money and give it to her sons who study in another state in Mexico (Veracruz). 

What she wants most is that with this loan and her business she will be able to work more and be able to save money so that she can continue supporting her sons until they finish school.

The other members of the group are: Mirna, who will buy materials to make cinder-block; Esperanza, who will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store; and Aura, who will buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a thirty-nine-year-old single mother of four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Since she separated from her husband she has been taking care of the family by herself, and her dream is to see them graduate. 

She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for five years, getting the capital from farming. Her major challenge is the rainy season that disrupts her business, and her vision is to own a boutique plus educating her children. Allen needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia se dedica a la venta de periódicos en la zona central. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de periódicos y revistas que es lo que más le piden sus clientes. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Antonio en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que Sonia obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en: Sonia sells periodicals downtown.  She needs the loan to buy newspapers and magazines which are what her customers request the most.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s San Antonio zone.  She’s single and has a son.  This is the first time Sonia’s obtained a loan in IMPRO and also in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of newspapers and magazines.

loans.name: Ana Jessenia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal PriM. de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  10 y 8 años  de edad, ambos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar en los gastos que generan el hogar y la educación de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana sobre todo por las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en la escuela, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien nos cuenta que  lo que más vende son los perfumes.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y accesorios para damas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The PriM. de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. 
Here we met Ana, a 26-year-old woman. She and her husband have two children, 10 and 8 years of age, who are both in school. Her husband works as a driver.
Ana is a housewife who sells Avon beauty products in order to have her own resources and be able to help with the family's household and educational expenses. She sells door to door three or four days a week, especially in the mornings when her children are in school. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. She's been selling these products for eight years and it's going very well. She tells us that her bestselling products are the perfumes.
Ana will use this credit to buy women's perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and accessories. She's been a member of the village bank for two years, where she is the treasurer. She likes the group because it's helped her get ahead in life.
Her dream is to keep expanding her business and growing as a person.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and accessories for women.

loans.name: Carlos Hipolito

texts.es:
Carlos Hipolito tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Carlos Hipolito se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Carlos Hipolito is 54 years old.  He is single, doesn't have any children, and lives alone in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.

The 'El Placer' community bank is located in Chillanes canton, in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from our office.  The bank has 24 members who grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soy and oranges.  They also raise farmyard animals.

Carlos Hipolito grows rice, corn, oranges, soy and bananas.  He makes his purchases in San José del Tambo and makes his sales in the Sunday street market in Chillanes.

Carlos Hipolito is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.  This loan will help to support him so that he can improve his harvest.  He does not face any serious challenges in his business.  His dream is to enjoy good health so that he can continue working.

In his free time, he enjoys going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jecel Group

texts.en: Jecel has a sari-sari (general store) business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She is 27 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. Jecel has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, cigarettes, sacks of rice, etc. Jecel has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business. Jecel is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her business.

loans.name: We Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “We Hope To God” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL each (2,000,000 SLL total). With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. A native of Kenema, Mariama is married and has 3 children – 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells pepper, fried cakes, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy pepper, fried cakes, gari, salt, etc. in wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: A sus 43 años, Emilio tiene 5 hijos a los que todavía mantiene. Son casi 24 años los que convive con su pareja, con quien educa y cría a sus hijos en el calor de un hogar humilde pero propio. Emilio aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura de sus padres. En su comunidad la mayoría se dedica a eso, él no se queda atrás y siembra papa, arvejas, habas y cebada. Además posee 50 ovejas, 2 vacas y 2 caballos, en cuanto a animales menores: cuyes y gallinas. Mediante la compra y venta de animales también genera otros ingresos. En cuanto a los problemas en sus sembríos comenta que las heladas destruyeron gran parte en el mes de agosto, “es ganar o arriesgar, así es el trabajo”, agrega. Pero por la constancia que lo caracteriza, él seguirá con los cultivos, a los que quiere como una parte de él. En el futuro, y con las ganancias que genere, adquirirá más toros pequeños, los hará crecer y venderá; además de ampliar sus sembríos, con el fin de brindarles a sus hijos una educación en mejores colegios de la ciudad. Ya son 8 veces, que Emilio obtiene créditos con MFP, le gusta el trabajo con su banco comunal, por ser unidos y por que muchos de ellos son familiares suyos. Con el dinero piensa comprar sacos de abono, guano de ave de corral, el pago del flete que llevará su cosecha hacia la ciudad y el pago de sus peones.
texts.en: At 43 years of age, Emilio has 5 children whom he still supports. He has been with his partner for almost 24 years, and together they educate and raise their children in the warmth of their humble home. Emilio learned farming from his parents. Most of the people in his community are in agriculture, and he does not fall behind. He grows potatoes, peas, beans, and barley. Additionally, he has 50 sheep, 2 cows, and 2 horses. He also has small animals like chickens and guinea pigs. Besides buying and selling animals, he also makes an extra income. Regarding problems with his crops, he states that freezing temperatures did much damage during the month of August. "Winning or risking, that's what this job is about," he adds. However, because of the perseverance that he is characterized by, he will continue with his crops, which he loves as if they were a part of him. With the profits that he generates in the future, he will obtain more young bulls, which he will raise then sell. Also, he will expand his crops with the aim of providing his children with an education from the best schools in the city. This is the eighth time that Emilio obtains a loan from MFP. He likes working with his communal bank because its members are very united, and because many of them are his relatives. With this money, he plans to purchase sacks of fertilizer (bird guano), to pay the fee to transport his produce to the city, and to pay his farm workers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and to pay for crop transportation costs.

loans.name: John Wady

texts.es:
A sus 38 años de edad, John es un hombre casado y con un hijo de 12 años, viven en el municipio de Guarne en el departamento de Antioquia y tienen una pequeña fabrica productora de arepas allí mismo. 

Pese a que la competencia en su municipio es muy dura, John sueña con montar toda una industria de la arepa allí, para que todos reconozcan su marca y sus arepas, pero es conciente que para esto necesita fortalecer más muchas áreas como conseguir nuevos mercados. Actualmente en su negocio necesita adquirir nuevos activos como un asador eléctrico que le agilizara su producción al mismo tiempo que cuida su salud y el ambiente, por eso solicito un préstamo para incrementar su activos y aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At his 38 years, John is a married man with one 12 year old son.  He and his family live in the municipality of Guarne in Antioquia Department.  Right there they have a small "arepas" production factory. (Arepas are a corn-based bread commonly eaten for breakfast)

Despite the fact that the competition in his municipality is tough, John hopes to set up a whole arepa industry there, so that everyone will recognize his brand and his arepas.  But, he is aware that for this to happen, he needs to strengthen his business in many areas, like reaching new markets.  Currently, his business needs to acquire new assets, like an electric grill, which will speed up production and at the same time protect his health and environment.  That is why he is requesting the loan- to increase his assets, his sales and his income.

loans.use: to purchase an electric grill and supplies for making "arepas" (a corn-based bread commonly eaten for breakfast)

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has operated his wholesale business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. He is 47 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have two school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his seventh loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more household goods to sell in his shop.

In the future, Wilson hopes to expand his business, get more income, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
SOULEYMANE AGE DE 41 ANS HABITE DANS LA REGION DU SUD AU SENEGAL .MARIE D'UNE FEMME ,IL A 3 ENFANTS,2 SONT DANS LE JARDIN D'ENFANTS LE PLUS PETIT AGE DE 5 MOIS EST A LA MAISON AVEC SA MAMAN.
SOULEYMANE FAISAIT LE COMMERCE DE POISSONS A VELO DEPUIS 6 ANS ,AVEC CE CREDIT ,SOULEYMANE SE DEPLACE VERS KAFFOUNTINE,ZONE POISSONNEUSE OU IL ACHETE EN GROS POUR VENIR VENDRE DANS SON MARCHE LOCAL.IL DEMARE SA JOURNEE A 7H JUSQU'A 11H DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL ET DE 17 H A 19H SUR LA ZONE DE KAFFOUNTINE.3H A 5H ACHAT DE POISSONS,5H30 A 6H30 RETOUR SUR SON MARCHE LOCAL.
SOULEYMANE AVEC SON COMMERCE ,IL SUPPORTE TOUTES LES CHARGES DE SA FAMILLE,DANS L'AVENIR ,IL COMPTE PRENDRE DE GROS CREDIT ET ACHATER UN CAMION FRIGO POUR LE COMMERCE DE POISSONS.
texts.en:
Souleymane is 41 years old and lives in the Southern part of Senegal. He is married with three children, of whom two attend kindergarten. The third is five months old and stays home with its mother.

Souleymane has been trading and delivering fish with his bicycle over the past six years. This loan will allow him to travel to Kaffountine (an area where fish are abundant), buy wholesale and then resell in his local market.

He begins his workday buying fish in Kaffountine from 3:00 until 5:00 am. He then travels to his local market from 5:30 to 6:30 where he sells from 7:00 until 11:00 am. Finally he returns to the Kaffountine area where he sells from 7:00 until 11:00 pm.

Souleymane's activity enables him to manage all of his family's expenses. In the future, he intends to take out a large credit loan to acquire a refrigerated truck for his fish-trading activity.

loans.use: buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 42 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has three children between 5 and 22 years of age. For the past seven years, Sarah has been selling cold water and ice in the market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water (by the sack) and ice for her business. Her plans is to travel and become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more water (by sack) and ice for her business.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 50-year-old widowed mother of six children in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district. Three of her children are dependent, and two of them are still in school. Another works as a construction worker. 

As a widowed mother of a big family, Mao has farmed her rice field for twenty years to feed her children. She supplements her income by raising pigs. She earns five USD per day and saves 2.5 USD per day for her business.

Mao and her group member are applying for their first loan with VisionFund. Mao wants to use this loan to buy feed for her pigs. To raise additional income, she also wants to use some of the loan to run a small grocery store in the front yard of her house. She hopes to increase the income of her family to improve their standard of living. She also hopes to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and run a small grocery store.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, 47 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in Señor, Sinacaban. For the past 5 years, Regina has been farming and growing vegetable crops to earn a living. Regina has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to  purchase fertilizer for planting crops. Regina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for planting crops

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 10 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de dulces en general como galletas, gaseosas, chupetes, etc.; lleva 10 años en este negocio con el cual comenzó a raíz de poder ayudar a sus hijos con la educación necesaria para que puedan triunfar en la vida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abrir un negocio y ha podido dar la educación pertinente a sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y transporte, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono. Su plan para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y terminar de construir su hogar. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Rosa pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe”, con el cual lleva 1 año como presidenta y que esta conformado por 7 personas. Se formo con el objetivo de que cada socio pueda desarrollarse  y triunfe en la vida y en su negocio, motivo por el cual le pusieron dicho nombre al grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50, married, and has two children who still depend on her. 

She has been with Edaprospo for ten years, and sells candy in general, such as cookies, soft drinks, lollipops, etc. She has been in this business for ten years, which she started in order to help her children get the education they need, so that they can succeed in life.

With her hard work and effort she has managed to open a business, and has been able to provide her children with a proper education. 

Currently, she is allocating her income to cover expenses for food and transportation, while her husband covers the cost of water, electricity, and telephone. 

Her plan for the future is to expand her business, and finish building her home.

She used her loan to buy merchandise. 

Rosa belongs to the "Triunfadores Leales de Motupe" (The Loyal Winners of Motupe) communal bank, which is made up of seven people. She has been the president for one year. It was formed with the objective of each member developing themselves, and "winning" in their business and in their life. This is the reason why they gave this name to the group.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Djumakish

texts.ru: Джумакиш 50 лет, замужем, воспитала троих детей.  Джумакиш занимается откормом и перепродажей скота.  Начатое еще в 1996 году с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  и насчитывающее одну дойную корову и пять овец, сегодня приносит около 6,500 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Джумакиш обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Джумакиш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины.
texts.en: Djumakish is 50 years old, married, and has raised three children. She is engaged in livestock fattening and resale. The farm, which started with the sum of 5,000 som (KGS) back in 1996, today counts one dairy cow and five sheep and brings in around 6,500 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. In order to further increase the livestock numbers, Djumakish sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Djumakish is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into further increase of the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a member of the group called Miramar Femenino, located in the city of Samana. This is his seventh loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over four years and he started it from his savings. After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Mario realized the need to build an extra room. 

With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can build the new room and save for more home improvements. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to build this room to expand his house with more spaces. With this loan, he will be able to buy construction materials like concrete blocks, rods, cement, zinc (for the roof), and other items. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. Mario lives together with his wife and their three children. He is also a micro-entrepreneur conducting fish sales. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, and other building materials

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years, married and blessed with 4 children. She sells African print clothes and has been in this business for the last 6 years.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of African print clothes for resale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children. In future she hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: To purchase African print clothes for resale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Esperansa

texts.en: Esperansa is married and have two children. One of his sons is in Secondary school.  Esperansa lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.  She runs a vegetable stall outside her house.  She has been in this business for more than three years now.   Esperansa grows vegetable herself and sell them in her stall. In this  rain season she is worried about insects and other microorganisms attacking vegetable growing. She need a sufficient  stock of  insectisides and a spraying pump.  To facilitate this plan she is in need of USD 400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.en:
San Juana is 34 years old, she is married and has two daughters who are 17 and 15 years old, and a son who is 10. Her husband has a temporary job as a lathe operator, and makes industrial parts. The low-income he earns, and the probability of him losing his job motivated San Juana three years ago to start her business selling gifts and treats. She’s found a way to support her family’s expenses and her children’s education. She’s worked hard to see results, and improve her family’s quality of life.

San Juana needs a loan in the amount of US$250, which she will use to purchase merchandise, to be able to offer her clients a wider variety of products, and improve her service. You can be an essential part of the growth of this business. It’s up to you to help this family, don’t hesitate any longer.

San Juana tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 15 años y un hijo de 10. Su esposo tiene un trabajo temporal de tornero, fabricando piezas industriales, el bajo ingreso que recibe y la posibilidad que tiene de perder su empleo, impulsaron a San Juana a iniciar su negocio de venta de novedades y regalos, desde hace tres años. Ella ha encontrado esta manera de apoyar a su familia en los gastos y en la educación de sus hijos, ha trabajado mucho para que su negocio pueda dar frutos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora San Juana necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad, y mejorar su servicio. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio. Esta en tus manos apoyar a esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Mrs. Clara I. is 40 years old, married with five (5) children. She learned the business from her mother and she started her own business in 1985. The above amount is to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
After many years of working with her mother, Diana R. Correa now works on her own after her mother retired. She has taken over her mother's job and has been working as a butcher for many years now. This business has always been a family business for over 45 years now. Diana is 23-years old and single and has a stand at Mercado Ita, a small market in the city of Ita, where she prepares meat to sell. She is a hard worker and works from Mondays to Saturdays from 6 am until 6 pm.

Everyday she purchases the meat from Itagua, a city nearby, and brings it to her stand where she prepares and separates the different cuts of meat. None of the meat goes to waste and every part can be sold to different clients for various purposes. For example, she sells horns that are used to make cups for terrere, a typical Paraguayan drink. Also, she sells parts that can be further processed to make carbon. On average, she has about 10 customers per day.

Diana is grateful for being able to receive such a stable business from her mother. She is searching for a loan in order to have more capital to use when she purchases meat every morning.

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat B. is a 41-year-old mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling vegetables at an open-air market, while her husband is a farmer growing crops. Together they earn around $6 each day. Mrs. Phat B. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sochea was married in 1997 and has two children, one son and one daughter. In 2004, she started her business of buying and reselling grass to villagers for feeding their cows. Her husband is a construction worker. He goes to work far from home and does not come home very often. Her two children are studying at the primary school in the village.

She is requesting a loan of $100 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to purchase electric wire and lamps for connecting with the public electric provider in Kandal Steung district.

loans.use:
Purchasing electric wire and lamps for connecting with the 
public electric provider

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is a lady of forty five years of age and is married with seven children. She’s been in this business for more than five years now and this is the only source of income that supports her family needs and her kids' school fees. She applied for this loan in order to buy chemicals which helps in the plantation growth, and for tools needed in the working of the business. She sells her plantation goods such as taro, taamu, bananas, yams and vegetables at the market every week and she earns a profit of $180ST ($72USD) per day from selling two days a week.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Badriyah

texts.en: Badriyah, 45, is a mother of 3 children. While her husband, D., works as a teacher and earns USD10.5 a month, she sells waste materials such as plastic bottles, etc., earning USD1 a day. She asks for a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. One of them is going to school. His elderly mother and his two sisters are staying with him in his rented house. He has a small general store in his house. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new goods and home supplies to sell and improve his life by expanding his project. He wants to make new shelves and paint the store to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new goods and home supplies

loans.name: Yawa Kafui

texts.fr:
Yawa Kafui A. was born on September 3, 1970 in Lomé. Married and the mother of two children, she has been selling canned goods, sacks of rice, and drums of vegetable oil since 2005 in her shop that she has named ETS AKS ALBATROS. Her first loan of 350,000 francs CFA enable her to stock up enough inventory to avoid incessant round-trips to the Grand Market in Lomé. And it also enables her to back away from supplier loans, which don't allow her to earn enough. In addition, the volume of customer traffic is now better, and her customer base has grown to an adequate level. With regard to sales growth and to customer needs, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy twelve 25-kg sacks of rice and eight cartons of canned goods in order to grow her revenue, which would allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yawa Kafui est née le 03 Septembre 1970 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est revendeuse des boites de conserve, des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile végétale depuis 2005 dans sa boutique qu'elle a dénommée ETS AKS ALBATROS. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 350.000FCFA lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour éviter de faire d’incessants allers-retours vers le Grand Marché de Lomé et de se soustraire du crédit fournisseur qui ne lui permet pas de gagner suffisamment. De plus, son achalandage a été meilleur et la clientèle est devenue suffisante. Suite à l’accroissement de la vente et aux besoins de la clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 12 sacs de riz de 25Kg et 8 cartons de boîtes de conserve afin d'accroître son revenu qui lui permet de participer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Taga A Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Taga A on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintained a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Elise T. (32, married, 1 child), Loluama F. (22, married, no children), Sina A. (58, married, 7 children) and Lagomau N. (34, married, 5 children) all sell taro, yams, and bananas--staples of the Samoan diet--at the market. With their loans, they wish to purchase a weed killer, knives, shovels, seeds, an axe, and other equipment for farming.

Olepa V. (25, married, 3 children) is also in the farming business, but she has a different product line than the other women. She sells tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, sugar cane, and tauaga (used to squeeze coconuts for the juice). With her loan, she will purchase onions, sugar, carrots, potatoes, salt, and noodles.

Sina L. (33, married, 3 children) is requesting a loan in order to help her husband, a taxi driver for over 5 years, maintain his taxi. She is requesting money to purchase 4 tires and taxi parts.

loans.use: Purchase various farming tools for plantation farming

loans.name: Filiberta

texts.es:
Filiberta is an enthusiastic woman. She is happy and very optimistic. She started her business to receive extra income, since her husband is a worker at a transportation company. Sometimes there isn’t enough work and there are expenses they have to cover, especially now that she has a nine-month girl. She started in February of 2006, when her mom convinced her to study at a preparatory school at night, that way she would have spare time during the day to do something productive. She got invited to a demonstration of cosmetic products, she liked it and she signed up to sell them. She has been selling cosmetics for a while now and she makes good income out of it. She also helps her mom sell food at her house and takes the opportunity to sell products.

She needs a credit of $300, in which she hopes to pay off in 3 months. She needs it to buy merchandise and have better variety of products for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Filiberta es una persona entusiasta, muy alegre y optimista. Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa de carga y a veces el trabajo escasea y tienen gastos que debe cubrir, más ahora que tiene una niña pequeñita de 9 meses. Comenzó en Febrero de 2006, cuando su mamá la convenció que estudiara la preparatoria en las noches en una escuela nocturna para poder terminarla, y además le quedaría el día libre para dedicarse a una actividad, y por esos días la invitaron a una demostración de los productos cosméticos; como le gustó se inscribió como vendedora y hasta el día de hoy le ha ido muy bien, además le ayuda a su mamá a vender comida en su casa y ahí entre sus clientes puedo ofrecer los productos de belleza.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $300 el cual esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses. Lo necesita para comprara mercancía y tener un buen surtido de cosméticos para sus clientes y poder ofrecer a otros clientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sadraddin

texts.en: Sadraddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 3 children. This man has 7 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of  $1000  to buy more home appliances for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the home appliances

loans.name: Bakhan's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Arifwala, Pakistan, Bakhan baji has been married to A. M. for the last 25 years. She has no children. Her husband has been in the livestock business for the last 10 years. Bakhan baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she would like a loan for her husband’s business so that he is able to sell more milk and earn greater profits.

Her loan group includes two more members. Parveen baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, and Sakina baji wants a loan for her spice business.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Thi Tuyet's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Tuyet (ID Number 05030050), born in 1962, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to purchase bamboo to make brooms. She has two children who are already grown up and working, earning stable income. Her husband works as a hired worker. Besides making brooms, Mrs. Tuyet also rears cattle and sells drinks so she has a daily income. Her family's average monthly income is about 4,000,000VND (about 267USD). She is voted to be the group leader as she is responsible and reliable. She promises that she will repay the loan fully and that she will work hard to increase her family's income and improve their standard of living. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Loan (ID Number 05030006), born in 1957, would like to borrow 2,900,000VND to rear pigs.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Van (ID Number 05030051), born in 1966, would like to borrow 1.972,000VND to purchase raw materials to make brooms.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Bich (ID Number 05030008), born in 1974, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in her general store.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Khanh Hong (ID Number 05030052), born in 1952, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in her general store.
  • The total amount requested is 650.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Đinh Thi Tuyết, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 05030050), mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư mua tre làm chổi nan. Vợ chồng chị có hai con đã trưởng thành, đi làm có thu nhập ổn định. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê, bản thân chị ngoài chăn nuôi chị còn có nghề làm chổi, bán nước giải khát nên có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng :4.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Chi là người có uy tín nên những người trong nhóm vay vốn bầu chị làm nhóm trưởng. Được vay vốn gia đình chị hứa hoàn trả đầy đủ và cố gắng làm việc để tăng thu nhập và nâng cao mức sống. Trong nhóm chị còn có; Nguyễn Thị Loan, sinh năm 1957 (Ms 05030006), mức vay: 2.900.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. Chử Thị Vân, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 05030051), mức vay :1.972.000 vnđ để mua nguyên liệu làm chổi. C. Thị Bích, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 05030008), Mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để buôn bán nhỏ. Nguyễn Thị Khánh Hồng, sinh năm 1952 (Ms 05030052), mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để buôn bán nhỏ.

loans.use: Making brooms and retailing

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Mrs. Naret C., 36, and her husband, Mr. Moeun Sok, 39, who live in a small village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in local schools and the youngest one still stays at home.

Mrs. Naret has been a tailor for over two years. She operates her business at home. Her husband has been a driver for a company for four years. Naret is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase another sewing machine and repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and repair some parts of her house

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: La Sra. Luisa Amanda tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, de 17, 23 y 26 años de edad, el negocio de doña Luisa es la venta de productos plásticos, su esposos le ayuda a ofertar el negocio y trabajan juntos para salir adelante, llevan quince años en las ventas e iniciaron con préstamos, y a través del tiempo el negocio lo han hecho más sólido. Con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en material de construcción para reparar el techo de un cuarto de su hija que esta en mal estado. A futuro es comprar productos de mayor variedad, y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de los encargos de sus clientes. Poder dar estudios a su hijo menor para que sea un hombre de buena educación.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda, 50, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She has three childres, ages 17, 23 and 26. Luisa's business is the sale of plastic wares. Her husband and she work together and have seen their business grow since they started with the help of loans 15 years ago. Luisa is requesting a loan to purchase constructions materials to repair the roof in the her daughter's room. In the future, her goal is to purchase a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers' demands. Her dream is to provide a good education for her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing roof in home's room.

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en:
Afqan S. is 22 years old and the young father of one daughter. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was 17 years of age. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

In addition to the animals, he also buys and sells agricultural goods to raise more profit. 

Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He is requesting a loan of $1200 which he's promising to repay within 15 months. From the profit of his business, Afqan wants to improve his family life conditions. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase  four calves

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Mrs. Chai K. is a farmer and lives in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have rice seed to plant on the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed. She expects to use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer for her field to make her crop more productive.

Chai's husband, Mr. Koer Kis, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chai K. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and  fertilizer

loans.name: Hanifan Naseer Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Hanifan Baji is 53 years old and married. She has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. Hanifan Baji is not an educated woman but she knows the manners of speaking with others. She got married when she was just 18 years old. Her husband's name is N. A. and he works in a company named “WASA”. She is the mother of eight children: three sons and five daughters. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), having 3 years experience. The next to him is a mason. Her younger son is a driver and drives a local bus. Her first three daughters work in a cotton factory. Her younger daughter reads in 8th standard and her youngest daughter reads in 5th standard. Hanifan Baji also works in a cotton factory. She fills the cotton in sacks. She and her daughters each earn 1000 rupees per month. Hanifan Baji invests her income in her younger daughter’s education. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son.

She is a group leader of a few more women of her locality. Sobia Parveen wants a loan to buy tents for her tent business. Jannat Firdous Baji and Shahnaz Baji each want a loan to buy furniture (chairs) for their barber salon. Azra Baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Nanu Chori

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanu Chori M., a resident of Thecho, lives in single family with her husband and one son. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband, Mr. Buddi Bhakta M., works in a private office. Her son is ninth months old.

Mrs. M. is engaged in goat farming. She has four goats in her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to improve the living standards of her family. 

She is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy few more goats and foods grains for the goats. She is planning to save her income to provide a good education for her son because, in Nepal, the cost of education is very high.

loans.use: To buy few more goats

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is engaged in a vegetable vending business. She sells crops coming from her backyard. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 that she can use to improve her vending business. Through it, she is able to help her husband generate income for their family. She hopes that someday, she can venture into other kind of business like livestock to further improve their poor living standard. She and her husband are striving to achieve their dreams and to save something for the future education of their daughter.

Janet is 25 years old and her husband Ramon is working in a feed company. They are living in the rural village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela with their one-month-old daughter.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика женщина 39 лет , мать троих детей,работает в поликлинике медсестрой.По бизнесу ей помогает её старшая дочь , которая на снимке.А сама Малика во время мониторинга отсутствовала, была на работе,но после работы она сменяет свою дочь.Малика оптом покупает сахар и продаёт его в розницу.Для увеличения ассортимента товаров Малика решила получить кредит в размере 16оо сомони.
texts.en:
Malika is a 39 year old woman, a mother of three children. She works as a nurse in a hospital. In her business her oldest daughter, who is pictured, is helping her. Malika herself was not available because of work, and after work she take over her daughter. Malika buys sugar wholesale and resells it retail. To increase the assortment of her merchandise Malika decided to take out a loan for 1600 somoni (US$450).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, underwear, ready-made clothes and baby items to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 30 años, es madre de dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo, quien es trabaja en la venta de madera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos en un pequeño galpón construido atrás de su casa, para luego llevarlos a vender al mejor postor en el mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus animales para que sus clientes no tengan queja alguna acerca de su tamaño o su peso. Este negocio es rentable porque en un lapso de 35 días, los pollos ya están listos para la venta. Lo difícil es no contar con un lugar adecuado, ya que lo viene haciendo en su propio domicilio en un pequeño galpón, el que no es del todo adecuado para una buena crianza de este tipo de animales. Con MFP tiene 2 préstamos y le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son responsables y solidarios. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Elvira is 30, has two children, lives with her husband who works selling wood. Four years ago she started raising chickens in a small area built behind her house, she then takes them to the market and sells them for the best offer. What she likes about her job is raising good chickens so that her clients have no complaints about size or weight. This is a profitable business because in approximately 35 days the chickens are ready for sale. The difficult part of her job is not having an appropriate location, because the small area in her house is not suitable to properly raise the chickens. With MFP she has two loans, she likes to work with the community bank because everyone is responsible and helpful. The money now requested is to be invested in buying baby chickens as well as feed to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 45 años de edad y está casada con el señor Mariano Fernandez. La pareja tiene siete hijos y de los cuales cinco son mayores de edad. Dos trabajan en el centro de ciudad como asalariados mientras los otros tres están residiendo y trabajando en España. Los dos  menores de edad que están en la primaría, el varón de quince  años es quién trabaja en la venta de bebidas que tienen en su casa, lo realiza después del horario escolar.
 
La  familia además tienen ventas de mandioca y bebidas de todas las marcas.  Justina se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de diez años. Ella comenta que por la tarde sale a levantar los pedidos por toda la zona en despensas, supermercados, kioskos, etc.  Mientras que su marido sale a entregar los pedidos.
Justina, con sus ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, junto con su marido y  también con la ayuda sus hijos hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Justina comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad  de mercaderías tanto como la mandioca y las bebidas ya que ambos productos tiene bastante salida en la zona donde venden.
texts.en:
Justina is 45 years old and married to Mariano Fernandez. The couple has seven children, five of whom are adults. Two of their adult children work in the city center as wage earners, while the other three live and work in Spain. Their two younger children are still in school; their fifteen-year-old son works after school selling beverages from their home. The family sells mandioca (a Paraguayan root vegetable) and all sorts of beverages. Justina has made a living in this business for more than ten years. She says that in the afternoon she goes to take orders from all the local stores, supermarkets, kiosks, etc., while her husband goes to deliver orders. The profits that Justina and her husband earn from their sales contribute to the household’s income, and with help from their children they are able to meet the family’s expenses. Justina says that their sales are doing very well. It’s for this reason that she wants to purchase a larger amount of both mandioca and beverages, since both products are selling very well in the area where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mandioca and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has four children. She has received an education through junior high school. Mary works as a trader selling fish at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. She has been doing this work since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of the household.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more fish for smoking and, with the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more fish for smoking

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria R. is from the village of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old, married, and has four adult children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and for family needs. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is the proprietress of a day care school. She has employees that help her to take care of the children. Georgina wants to develop the school. She is requesting a loan to buy logistics such as desks, etc. to build the school. She has been in business for three years.

Georgina is 44 years old, married and has four children: three sons and one daughter. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Georgina wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy school desks

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
R. Valentina is 58 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business seven years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Valentina sells confectionery items like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The generated income allows Valentina to support her family. Valentina dreams all of her children will complete higher education.

Today she requests 3000 Somoni for purchasing confectionery items to enlarge her range of goods to sell. Valentina plans to spend her income on the well-being of her family as well as educating her children.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery items for enlarging her range of goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and to provide a well for the irrigation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma G. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 23 years old. Emma is single and has an infant child. Emma owns and operates a fish-selling business, selling ocean-caught fish in the local community through peddling (going door-to-door). She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Patilisi

texts.en:
"Patilisi S. (0) is a 40 years-year-old woman living in the town of Lotofaga Aleipata A.  She is married and has 6 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Patilisi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Patilisi has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 620 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Patilisi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Patilisi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Patilisi is now requesting a new loan of 2200 tala WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Patilisi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: Juan Pedro es soltero, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, labora como conductor de taxi desde hace 9 años, pero ahora conduce su propio taxi, pues con el apoyo de su compañera de vida han logrado obtener su propio vehiculo y consesion del taxi, adicionalmente se dedica junto a su compañera de vida a la venta de electrodomesticos de contado y al credito con clientes seleccionados, por lo que esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er credito para comprar mercaderia y abastecer del producto a varios clientes que les hicieron pedido de los artefactos, ya que en este momento no cuentan con el suficiente capital para comparlo todo, expresa que las politicas de credito de AFODENIC son muy buenas y por eso le gusta trabajar con esta financiera.
texts.en:
Juan Pedro is single, and he has two children who go to school. He has worked as a taxi drive for nine years. Now he drives his own taxi. With support from his life partner he has been able to get his own vehicle and taxi concession. Also, he and his life partner sell domestic appliances for cash and for credit to their regular customers. He is asking for his third loan to buy merchandise and stock the various devices that their customers have ordered. They do not have sufficient money to buy everything. He says that the AFODENIC’s loan policies are very good, and that is why he likes to work with this financing institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Mr. Pann Nut Group

texts.en:
Mr. Pann N. is a Group leader of six members who all live in Ta V. village in Takeo province. He is a piglet middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for his business. His wife, Mrs. Ou Norm, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a Khmer noodle seller. This couple has three children who are enrolled in the local school. 
Three members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his business.

loans.name: La Mojarra Group

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR CARLOS T. M. NACIO Y VIVIO EN PALMA CUATA DURANTE 43 AÑOS. POSTERIORMENTE SE CASO Y SE FUE A VIVIR A POTRERO NUEVO, LA CUAL ES UNA COMUNIDAD DEL MUNICIPIO DE IGNACIO DE LA LLAVE.

DON CARLOS SIEMPRE SE HA DEDICADO A LA PESCA, LA CUAL ES UNA ACTIVIDAD MUY COMUN EN LA REGION YA QUE  EXISTEN VARIAS LAGUNAS Y UN RIO  ALREDEDOR DE SU COMUNIDAD. EN SUS INICIOS COMENZO COMO CHOFER PERO DEBIDO A UN ACCIDENTE CAMBIO DE TRABAJO Y OPTO POR CRIAR VACAS. ALTERNA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD COMENZO CON LA PESCA LA CUAL LE HA DADO MUY BUENO RESULTADOS YA QUE LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD. EL COMPRA TODO TIPO DE MARISCOS COMO LO SON MOJARRA, TILAPIA, CHUCUMITE, CAMARON, PULPO, JAIBA, CARACOL, OSTION, ETC.


LA META DE DON CARLOS ES PODER HACER UN LOCAL EN SU PATIO PARA SU VENTA.
