POR LO CUAL EL SOLICITA UN CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MARISCOS Y POSTERIORMENTE HACER UN TECHO Y PISO PARA TENER SU MERCANCIA MAS PRESENTABLE YA QUE ACTUALMENTE LO HACE  SOBRE UNA TABLA EN EL PATIO DE SU CASA AL AIRE LIBRE.


ES EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO LLAMADO  LA MOJARRA   FORMADO POR 4 SEÑORAS Y EL, SUS COMPAÑERAS SE DEDICAN ENTRE OTRAS ACTIVIDADES A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y   PERFUME POR CATALOGO Y   BOLSAS DE MANO.
texts.en:
Carlos was born and lived in Palma Cuata for 43 years. Later, he got married and moved to live in Potrero Nuevo which is a community in the municipality of Ignacio de la Llave. He has always been a fisherman, which is a very common occupation in the region since there are several lakes and a river in his community. At the beginning he started working as a driver but, due to an accident, he had to change jobs and started raising cows. Alternating with this activity he fished which has yielded very good results since he sells his fish among his community. He buys all kinds of seafood such as mojarra (a small, broad fish), tilapia, chucumite (fat snook), shrimp, octopus, crab, snail, oyster, etc. Carlos's goal it to build a stand in his yard from which to sell his wares and he is requesting a loan to buy the seafood and then to build a floor and roof so that his merchandise will be more presentable than currently possible with a board in the open air in his yard. He is the group representative of the group called LA MOJARRA which is made up of 4 ladies and himself. The ladies are involved in other activvities such as the sale of shoes, purses, and catalogue perfume sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stall from which to sell fish.

loans.name: Nereah Adhiambo

texts.en: Nereah owns Nereah's Beauty Salon Point where she sells beauty products and chemicals to all types of people and also offers salon services. She has two employees and her main business challenge is power rationing. Demand for her salon services has increased and she needs a loan of 15,000 KES to buy more driers. Nereah is married with two children and describes herself as a stable businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more driers for her salon

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab T., 33, and her husband, Mr. Seng Ket, 33, have been married since 1999 and have three sons. Two of them are in school, and other one is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road 20, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Leab has been growing rice for nine years. She has also started another business to supplement the family’s income by using her motorbike to transport vegetables and fish to sell at market in Phnom Penh.

Leab’s motorbike is old and does not work well, so she is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase a replacement for the old one.

loans.use: To buy a replacement motorbike to take her fish and vegetables to market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: S. Jeanne est née le 30 Décembre 1974 à Dogbo au Bénin. Mariée à EHOUN Théodore, un mécanicien auto, Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Hêvié à Abomey Calavi (non loin de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin) depuis près de neuf ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne mène comme activité, la vente de maïs, de haricot et de farine de manioc à son domicile. C’est à Adja au Mono et à Parakou, dans le Nord du Bénin, que Jeanne s’approvisionne. Jeanne mène cette activité depuis 10 ans. Jeanne a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Jeanne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Jeanne S. was born on 30 December 1974 in Dogbo in Benin. Married to Théodore EHOUN, an auto mechanic, Jeanne is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. The family has been living in Hêvié at Abomey Calavi (not very far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin) for the last nine years. The couple both contribute to financially support the family. Jeanne never attended school. In order to meet the needs of her children, she sells corn, beens and manioc flour from her home. She stocks up in Adja at Mono et a Parakou, in the north of Benin. She has been doing this for ten years. She obtained a previous loan from Alidé which was reimbursed. She is asking for a second loan in order to increase the stocks of products and better satisfy her clients.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase six bags of corn and four bags of beans

loans.name: Sixta Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Sixta es casada, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Sixta se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, actividad que realiza en un horno de leña y en los últimos meses elabora en menor cantidad y solo pedidos por que el humo esta dañando su salud, actualmente prepara gelatinas, flanes, sándwich, Sixta tiene proyectado comprar un horno a gas.
Sixta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos para preparar sus productos.
Los sueños de Sixta son construir su casa, comprar un horno y que su hija tenga una empresa.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Amor Divino ("Divine Love") Community Bank. She is a married 55-year-old mother of three children. Sixta makes a living baking pastries, an activity she carries out with a firewood oven. In the past few months she has made a smaller quantity and only on orders because the smoke is harming her health. Currently she also prepares jellies, flans and sandwiches and is planning to purchase a gas oven. Sixta is requesting a loan of 3000 soles (approximately $1,050), which she plans to use to purchase ingredients to make her products. Sixta's dreams are to build a home, buy an oven and for her daughter to have a business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her products

loans.name: Wilson Cosme

texts.es:
Wilson T. de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposa trabaja en una fundación para ancianos con ella tiene 6 niños, 4 están estudiando en escuelas particulares y 2 en la universidad.

Wilson comenzó hace 3 años con un compresor pequeño y una gata para carros en la esquina de su casa a trabajar, poco a poco reunió dinero para poner su propio negocio.  

Ahora el y su hijo mayor trabajan todos los días reparando vehículos desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 haciendo cambio de llantas, reparaciones de motores, arreglando bicicletas etc. Uno de los beneficios que tiene ahora son las lluvias ya que por eso tiene más clientela.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar otro compresor y implementos de vehículos para poner otro negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una línea de vulcanizadotas para que sus hijos trabajen en eso.
texts.en:
Wilson T., 42, lives on the outskirts of Paraíso de Guayaquil, in a cement house with only light as a basic service. His wife works in a foundation for old people and, with her, he has six children. Four are studying in private schools and two in the university.

Wilson started to work from the corner of his house three years ago with a small compressor and a car jack. Bit by bit, he has collected money to set up his own business.

Now he and his eldest son work every day repairing vehicles from 6am until 9pm, changing tyres, repairing motors, fixing bicycles etc. At the moment, he's benefiting from the rains which are causing him to have more customers.

With the loan, he would like to buy another compressor and vehicle implements to set up another business. In the future, he would like to have a line of tyre patch repairmen for his sons to work on.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compressor

loans.name: Fermin De Jesus

texts.es:
Fermín de Jesús Hernández, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

 El tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y tres de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es ajuntado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido quince crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piso para la casa ya que anteriormente solo tenía concreto.
Fermín dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fermín works as a custodian in the Mercado Mayoreo in Managua. He has four children, three of which are school-aged. He has been working with and getting loans through CEPRODEL for the past ten years. Up to now he been able to invest the money from 15 loans to improve his home, thanks to CEPRODEL. He is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials, such as cement, sand and flooring for his home, as he only has a concrete floor. Fermín said that thanks to the loans he has been able to get through CEPRODEL, his children have a more secure place to live and a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Belki Vanessa

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en León, la dama Belki E. es propietaria de su negocio de venta de pollo el cual lo vende a la población de su localidad y lo almacena en una mantenedora para que este permanezca bien frio y así pueda ser vendido satisfactoriamente a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra del pollo con el objetivo de continuar comercializándolo ya que le es de mucha necesidad obtenerlo a lo inmediato para así satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Belki E. sells chicken to residents in her area in El Sauce, León. She also stores it in a refrigerated keeper so that it will stay nice and cold in order to be sold satisfactorily to her customers. She is asking for funds to buy chicken so that she can continue selling it. It is important that she get it immediately to continue to satisfy the needs of the customers in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “FE EN DIOS”, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo, las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa, el banco comunal esta conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades eco nómicas de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, producción de joyas de oro y plata, administrador de un súper mercado, venta de joyas al por mayor y menor, confección de chompas, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de productos esotéricos, venta de artesanía y otros ofrecen servicios de seguridad. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Yomira forma parte del banco comunal “Fe en Dios”, ella tiene 32 años de edad, ella nació en la ciudad de Puno, ella tiene dos hijos y se llaman Luís Marcelo y Bryham de la cuales los dos dependen todavía de ella, ella nos cuenta que es madre y padre para sus hijos pues no recibe apoyo de su pareja. Yomira alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus actividades comerciales como por ejemplo venta de casacas, venta de ropa y venta de zapatos. Ella nos cuenta que las casacas que venden son exportadas de país de Argentina y los ofrece a las instituciones publicas y los zapatos los trae de la ciudad de Puno y los ofrece a las vendedoras de los mercados de la ciudad. Yomira también nos cuenta que hace poco termino de estudiar cosmetología y el préstamo que requiere es para abrir una tienda spa y boutique. Ya son 12 años que trabaja con los bancos solidarios y con la Asociación  Arariwa 2 años y le ha ido muy bien gracias a la responsabilidad que le caracteriza.    

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FE EN DIOS" (Faith in God) is in its third cycle. The member meetings are every 30 days in the main office of the Asociación Araiwa. The communal bank is made up of 10 hard working and entrepreneurial people who are always looking for ways to get ahead, and with their daily efforts proviD. a better future to their children. It is a communal bank made up of members who live in the city of Cuzco. Cuzco is a city characterized by its archeological centers, its historic center, its landscapes, and history. It is an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. The economic activities of the members are, for example: production of gold and silver jewelry, manager of a supermarket, wholesale and retail jewelry sales, production of sweaters, cosmetics sales, food sales, sales of esoteric products, sales of handicrafts, and others offer security services. The communal bank has been together for a number of cycles. The members are happy and satisfied with the loans, savings and training provided. Due to the amount of time they have been with the communal bank, they are able to earn valuable compound interest on their savings. Yomira is part of the communal bank "Fe en Dios". She is 32 years old. She was born in the city of Puno. She has two sons named Luís Marcelo and Bryham, both of whom she supports. She is both mother and father to her children as she does not receive support from her partner. Yomria alternates between her domestic work and commercial activities such as selling jackets, clothes, and shoes. The jackets she sells are exported from Argentina and she sells them to the public. She brings shoes form Puno and sells them to vendors in the city markets. Yomira recently finished studying cosmetology and the loan she is requesting is to open a boutique and spa. She has been working with banks for 12 years and with the Asociación Arariwa for 2 years, and things have gone very well thanks to her responsible nature. The members are thankful for this opportunity and promise to make their respective payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yomira  is requesting the loan to open a boutique and spa.

loans.name: Johanah

texts.en: Johanah is 38 years old and married with four children. Two of the children are in school. He has been running a laundry shop together with his wife for eight years to earn a living. He also practices farming to increase his income to support his family and pay school fees for his children. He had previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business. He has requested for another loan to buy laundry materials.

loans.use: To buy laundry materials

loans.name: Médinatou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2007 le commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisine, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, elle fait face en ce  moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises d’où la nécessité de se réapprovisionner, elle demande  un prêt à WAGES pour l’achat de divers ustensiles de cuisine, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, avec son revenu elle contribue financièrement aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady has been selling kitchenware retail since 2007. She does this on a door-to-door basis. At present she is experiencing a fall in her stock and thus needs to get fresh supplies. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various kitchen utensils. She is married and mother to one child. With her income she contributes financially to the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchenware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the village of Dullan. She is 49 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders,

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely C. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Fely is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Fely is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Fely from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa, se conformó en agosto del 2008, en la zona de Trinidad, comunidad desfavorecida económicamente,  donde no hay un sector comercial importante, por lo que sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría al sector informal de la economía.
 Las señoras comentan que están muy conformes con el crédito recibido y tiene muchas ganas de seguir participando. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Francisca quien tiene una cantina con venta de bebidas y comestibles en general. 
Ella comenta que todas las señoras del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con el grupo.
En una casilla que posee frente a su domicilio ella coloca todos los productos que ofrece para sus clientes.
En la atención del negocio la ayudan sus hijos. Ella  esta desea seguir trabajando ya que los ingresos de su actividad ayudan con los gastos para la alimentación de la familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, cervezas, vinos y otros, además para la compra de productos de usos domesticos.
texts.en:
The "Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa" was started in August, 2008 in the zone of Trinidad, a community economically unfavored with no important commercial sector, and therefore the majority of the inhabitants is involved in the informal sector of the economy. The ladies comment on being satisfied with the loan and want to continue participating. One of the members is Mrs. Francisca who has a bar where she sells beverages and food in general. She comments that all the ladies of the group are very happy working with the group. In facilities she owns in front of her house she places the products for her customers. Her children help with the business. She wishes to continue to work as the income helps with the expenses to feed the family. She requests the loan to buy beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wine and others as well as to buy products for domestic use.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pops, candy, cold meat, dairy products, cooking oil, vegetables, eggs, condiments, etc. for food preparation

loans.name: Dina Rebeca

texts.es: Dina Rebeca tiene 29 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general por lo que cada día, busca como proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues para su negocio son muy importantes. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar y poder mejorar su condición. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar perfumes, cremas, sabanas, lápiz labial y tratamientos. Sueña con aumentar su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos
texts.en:
Dina Rebeca is 29 years old. As a business activity, she sells general merchandise and every day she works to provide her family with the bare necessities. This is not the first time she has obtained a loan, as they are very important for her activity. She is always looking for ways to earn money for her family and to improve their conditions. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and to buy perfumes, creams, bed sheets, lipsticks and cosmetics. She dreams of augmenting her stock to be able to offer her clients a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo G. is from the village of Estefania, Anulung, Cagayan. He is 52 years old. Romeo is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Romeo owns and operates a business growing crops, specifically planting and harvesting corn for sale. Romeo has been in business for more than five years and earns approximately 37,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2006, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Romeo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: Madame Maréme C. est une commerçante âgée de plus de 50 ans et mére de famille qui vit dans la communauté rurale de Sandiara à une vingtaine de kilomètres de Mbour .Son activité commerciale réside dans la vente de prêt à porter au niveau de Sandiara .Ainsi, pour accroitre son fonds de commerce et agmenter sa rentabilité elle sollicite un crédit au niveau de la caisse. Elle gére seule le fonctionnement de la famille et s'occupe de la ration alimentaire
texts.en:
Mrs. Maréme C., over 50 years old, is a mother and entrepreneur living in the rural community of Sandiara, about 20 km from Mbour. Her line of business is selling ready-to-wear clothing in Sandiara. In order to bolster her business capital and increase profitability, she is seeking a loan. She manages the family budget on her own, and it is she who takes care of providing food for the family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business use

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 60 years old and is the widowed mother of four children aged between 30 and 20, two of whom attend school. She has a mixed farm that produces maize, beans, bananas, cassava and groundnuts (peanuts) which she sells locally. She also buys and sells cows at the local market.

Monica has requested this Kshs 35,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the milk proceeds she will manage to pay school fees for her children and the family will have enough milk for consumption.

In five years time, Monica plans to increase the acreage of her shamba (a field used for growing crops) thus increasing her product output and her income and also buy other dairy cows.

The major challenges Monica faces in business are drought that affects her farming by reduction of the harvest, diseases that affects the crops, and lack of enough finances to capitalize and expand her business. She is, however, grateful to Juhudi for the loan and would like to get another loan after repaying this current one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sandra Felisa

texts.es:
La  señora Sandra Felisa Q. A. tiene 33 años y vive en casa de su tia en el barrio IV Centenario de esta ciudad de Tarija. Sandra no es casada pero tiene un hijo. Sandra se dedica a trabajar como costurera desde hace más de 10 años.                                                                                                             

Sandra quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero ella nos cuenta que tiene un trabajo grande por hacer y tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicho material para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                         

Sandra  nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hijo toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sandra Felisa Q. A. is thirty-three and lives in her aunt's house in the Centenario Neighborhood IV in Tarija. She is not married but she has one son. She has been working as a seamstress for more than ten years. Sandra would like to have more income to provide her family with a better life, but she tells us that she needs to buy supplies for a big job she has to do. That's why she plans to use her loan buy the supplies, so she can increase her earnings. Sandra tells us that she would like to give her son every possible comfort, so she plans to use her next loan to improve the condition of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies, including thread and fabric, and for operating expenses.

loans.name: Laurd

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 47 ans ; marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 15 et 25 ans. N’ayant pas pu faire des longues études , par manque de soutien ; il s’inscrit dans un atelier de formation a la menuiserie.
A la fin de sa formation, il ouvre un atelier de menuiserie en 1982, tres entreprenant ; il a une grande clientèle et fait sont travail avec rapidité et beaucoup de sérieux. Il a des ventes par semaine de 50000frs a 450000frs. 

Avec le prêt qu’il compte recevoir il va acheter des planches comme  contres plaques, des bastings, des lattes, des pointes, de la colle et tous ce dont on a besoin pour fabriquer des meubles.

Très ambitieux, il a des grands projets pour son avenir, ouvrir un grand atelier et un magasin d’exposition de ses meubles  et en plus soutenir ses enfants pour faire des études universitaires et penser à construire une grand maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Laurd T. is 47 years old, married and the father of 2 children, 15 and 25 years old. Not being able to stay in school for very long because of lack of means, he enrolled in a woodworking training workshop. In 1982, at the end of his training, he opened a woodworking workshop. Very enterprising, he has a large clientele and does his work quickly and very responsibly. His weekly sales range from 50,000 to 450,000 francs. With the loan that he expects to receive, he is going to buy boards, such as plywood, beams, lathes, nails, glue and everything needed to build furniture. Very ambitious, he has big plans for the future: to open a large workshop and a furniture display shop. He also plans to support his children while they obtain a university education and to think about building a large house for his family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards, beams, plywood, lathes, glue and nails

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia R. M. desde hace 8 años de dedica a la venta de ropa usada y perfumes de buena calidad que se encuentra ubicado en su misma vivienda. Este ingreso que ella percibe es para apoyar a su esposo económicamente y así cubrir sus gastos. La ropa que tiene a la venta es traída desde la ciudad donde su esposo trabaja actualmente, con las ganancias que traerá su negocio desean seguir construyendo en la parte de arriba de su vivienda.
texts.en:
For the last eight years, Mrs. Lidia R. M. has operated a business selling used clothing and quality perfumes from her home. She uses her income to supplement her husband’s earnings and cover the family expenses. 

The clothing Lidia sells is brought in from the city where her husband works. With future earnings from her business, she would like to continue the construction work on the upper floor of her house.

loans.use: Invest in used clothing and perfume business

loans.name: Moak

texts.en: Moak O., 62, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia — an area known for palm products. O. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1 each per day. The three children are employed at the factories, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. O. has to spend USD 80 on food, USD 9 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses each month. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a calf to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: buy a calf to raise for sale

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres en Progreso está formado por 12 mujeres que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente que conservan su cultura y tradiciones. Nuestras socias son mujeres que siempre tienen una sonrisa en sus labios a pesar de sus adversidades, con su trabajo diario luchan cada día para entregarles un mejor bienestar a sus familias.

La Señorita. María Méndez vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su prima y en este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Nuestra socia está estudiando en la universidad, en los actuales momentos está realizando el internado para obtener su titulo. También en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon,  vende a sus compañeras en la universidad y realiza esta actividad hace dos años y medio. 
La Señorita. María tiene 24 años,  es soltera pero tiene una hija de un año y medio, vive con sus padres. Su mamá es comerciante y su padre se encuentra fuera del país, ha migrando en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios. Su meta es especializarse en cirugías.

La Señora. Carmen Álvarez vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, tiene 49 años,  es casada y tiene 4 hijo de 29, 25, 22 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes, su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y su último hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo labora como guardia privado, con el trabajo conyugal y esfuerzo mutuo han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Carmen es conserje hace nueve años en una escuela, lugar en el cual le dan una casa para que viva aparte de su casa propia, trabaja todo el día allí y se da  tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de chanchos. Es socia de la banca comunal hace dos años y los créditos le han servido para el alimento de sus animales, este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento y también para comprar materiales para realizar los acabados de su casa. Su meta es  tener un vehiculo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Progreso communal bank consists of 12 women who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  The city is known for its architectural beauty, its four rivers that run through the city, and its people, who preserve its culture and traditions.  Our members are women who are always smiling in spite of their hardships, and with their work they fight each day to bring a better life to their families.

Miss María Méndez lives in the Totoracocha section of Cuenca.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She was invited to join by her cousin, and since then she has become very good friends with all the members.  She is studying at the university, and right now she is doing an internship in order to obtain her degree.  Also, in her free time, for the past two and a half years she has sold Avon cosmetics to her university classmates.  María is 24 years old and is single, but she has a one-and-a-half-year old daughter.  She lives with her parents.  Her mother is a merchant and her father is outside the country, having migrated in search of better work opportunities.  The money from her new loan will go toward the cost of her studies.  Her goal is to specialize in surgery.

Mrs. Carmen Álvarez lives in the parish of Santa Ana.  She is 49 years old and married with 4 children, who are 29, 25, 22, and 9 years old.  Her two oldest children are married and live independently.  Her third child, a daughter, is a student at the university, and her youngest, a son, is at school.  Her husband works as a private guard.  With their shared work and mutual effort they have been able to build their own house.

For nine years, Carmen has been a custodian at a school, where they give her a house to live in away from her own home.  She works all day there and has time to raise pigs.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and the loans have helped her to buy feed for the animals.  This new loan will go toward the purchase of feed and also to buy materials to finish her house.  Her goal is to have a car.

loans.use: To pay for schooling / To buy animal feed and to finish construction work

loans.name: Rosa Medalit

texts.en:
Rosa lives in the village of Trance Fanupe in the district of Morrope.  It is a rural region in northern Peru near the city of Chiclayo.  She is twenty-one years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter.  She shares her home with her parents and child.

In the rear part of her family’s home, Rosa raises animals.  She has a small herd of pigs, ducks, and turkeys which she raises for meat.  She sells the animals once the reach the appropriate size in the major market of Moshoqueque which is in the city of Chiclayo.  In addition, Rosa will at times works as a farm hard, assisting it the planting, maintenance and harvest of crops on local farms.

This will be Rosa’s second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She has good credit history and good references from the community.  She plans to use the loan in order to purchase additional feed for her animals and expand her herd.  She hopes to be able to increase the household income and provide for the education of her daughter.  She is a dedicated mother and proud entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and expand her herd.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Angela es socia del banco comunal  Las Almendras, del Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores D. edad.
Lleva 9 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida (desayunos y almuerzos), esta actividad la realiza en su propia casa.  
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 soles comprará 4 mesas y 16 sillas, 4 manteles y algunos enseres más porque las que tiene ya están deterioradas y necesitan ser reemplazadas.
La señora Angela  agradece a Dios por su salud y a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder seguir trabajando.  Está feliz  porque no depenD. D. nadie y porque lo que gana le alcanza para vivir con su esposo y sus hijos tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Angela is a member of the communal bank "Las Almendras" in the Ucayali department.  She is 65 years old, married and has 5 grown children.

She has been taking loans from the Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years.  She has a business selling food (breakfasts and lunches) from her house.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 4 tables and 16 chairs, 4 tablecloths and some other items, because the furniture she has is worn out and needs to be replaced.

Angela thanks God for her health and Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue working.  She is happy, because she does not depend on anyone, and because she earns enough so that she can live in peace with her husband and their children.

loans.use: she will buy 4 tables and 16 chairs, 4 tablecloths and some other equipment for her business

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Ma. Marilyn V., 45.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto V..  Together they have three children, two of whom are already working, while one is still studying and staying at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Marilyn has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store where she also sells cooked viands and rice. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan in purchasing raw ingredients for her viands like meat, vegetables, seasonings, and other similar items. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for store

loans.name: Mrs. Maen Mach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Maen M. is a village bank president who has been selected by fifteen people who make up a village bank located in Chumrov village, Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Maen M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice on to sell to support her family and she also weaves silk while her husband, Mr. Hi Kan, is a soldier who earns a low salary to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So for this purpose, Mrs. Maen M. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is helping her to weave while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional grocery stock.

Rosita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will again be used to purchase additional grocery stock. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchased grocery stocks

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Fernando es el diseño grafico, creación de páginas web y también brinda servicios de mantenimiento de computadoras. El es profesional independiente que tiene una oficina en su domicilio y depende de las oportunidades de negocio que existan en el momento. Fernando nos cuenta que también se dedica a alquilar locales que sirven para oficinas y tiendas. Fernando requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer mantenimiento de los locales que alquila. El sueño de Fernando es abrir una imprenta.   

Fernando pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the city of Cusco, located in the Department of Cusco, Peru. His main business involves graphic design, the creation of web pages, as well as providing computer maintenance services. He works as an independent professional in an office in his home and depends on the business opportunities that exist at the moment. Fernando says that he also rents out locations used for offices and shops. He needs a loan to buy materials for maintaining these rental properties. His dream is to open a print shop.

Fernando belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase materials to maintain his rental properties

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children; all her children go to school. Jalia has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for twenty years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jalia sells her product from home. Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

The main business challenge for Jalia is seasonality.  Her goal is to eventually buy more land.   Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Lidia Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia Martha; la socia tiene 59 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, aceite, gaseosas entre otros más la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lidia Martha is a member of the "MOSOQ ALLPA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lidia Martha is 59 years old, married and has 4 children.  She has a grocery store business where she sells essentials such as rice, sugar and milk.  She also sells other products such as candy, oil, soda, etc.  She is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life.

Lidia Martha is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store, so that she can have a greater variety of products available to offer her customers.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store, so that she can have a greater variety of products to offer her customers

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is located in Punjab province, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry.  Her husband’s name is N. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. He gets milk from his dairy cow and sells it to the community. Raiza also supports her husband in getting milk from the cow. 
They both get up early in the morning and start their work. 

After finishing helping her husband, Razia cleans the whole house and prepares breakfast for her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another dairy cow which will not only increase the milk productivity but also his monthly income as well.  Razia is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carrots and peppers to sell

loans.name: Gloria Aida

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por el sector del Parque de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. 

La Señora. Gloria tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un negocio propio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Gloria trabaja como secretaria del negocio de su esposo el cual es fabricante de lápidas y mesones de cosina de marmol, labora de lunes a sábados de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermano, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mármol para continuar con el negocio familiar.

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Las Flores communal bank.  She lives in the Parque de Miraflores section of the city of Cuenca.  People visit this city for its natural and architectural beauty, and it has a varied gastronomy that captivates locals and foreigners alike.  

Gloria is 25 years old.  She is married and has two children, 4 and 7 years old.  Her oldest child is a student at a small school in the city.  Her husband has his own business.  They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Gloria works as a secretary in her husband's business, which is the manufacture of marble tombstones and kitchen counters.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

This is her first loan with the communal bank.  She was invited to join by her brother.  She will use the money from the loan to purchase marble to continue the family business.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase marble

loans.name: Karla Janett

texts.es:
La señora Karla Janett B. F. es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años la cual inicio su negocio hace dos años cuando adquirió una refrigeradora y empezó a realizar frescos, helados, chocobananos con las ganancias fue surtiendo su negocio y los prestamos le ayudaron mucho para tener una venta sólida.
Ella con el prestamos invertirá en productos en especial los granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles), carne, queso…etc.
texts.en:
Karla Janette B. F. is a hardworking and enterprising 37-year old woman who started her business two years ago. When she acquired a refrigerator she started to make juice drinks, icecreams, and frozen chocolate bananas. With her profits she gradually supplied her business. The loans helped her to achieve solid sales.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of products, especially basic grains (rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans), means, and cheese, etc.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meats, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr.Bayarsaikhan is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children (aged one and two) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Bayarsaikhan’s wife Dolzodmaa works as a human resource manager in private company. Bayarsaikhan’s mother is helping his family to look after the kids during when they are at work. Bayarsaikhan is a taxi driver with 9 years experience. He works around 12 hours a day and has managed to buy a family car which he uses as a taxi and a plot of land with his savings. Next year he is planning to build a family house on his plot. He has paid two million tugruks as advance payment for the land, but he still needs to pay one million tugruks more to close the deal. Bayarsaikhan is asking for a loan to pay for the remaining payment and the right to register it in his name.

loans.use: To pay the remaining payment for the plot of land he bought, and to get the right to register it in his name.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 36, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a college graduate and a mother of one child in school. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for their everyday expenses and be able to send her child all the way through college.  This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Maricel, as she herself has finished college and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Maricel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Maricel earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maricel hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Nor Forget Group

texts.en:
Alie, the leader of this group of entrepreneurs, was born in Magburaka town about 40 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. For eight years now, Alie has been selling palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), groundnuts, etc.

With the help of this loan, Alie and members of his group will add more goods to their respective businesses. In this way, they will make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. Alie is going to use his share of the loan to buy palm-oil, gari, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock. (Also included in the left of the photo is a group member who has left the group).

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, gari, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 42 years old and involved in an animal sales business. She does this work at her home. Presently, she has two cows. She takes care of them by providing timely food & water. Her business gives her good profit which helps her husband financially. Her husband also does the same business. He has a good number of business contacts who prefer buying animals  from him because of his good knowledge about animal breeds. 

They are parents of five children: two daughters and three sons. Her eldest son is a mason and the next to him is a salesman while her youngest son is studying in 9th standard. Her elder daughter is in 12th standard and also doing a diploma in nursing. Her younger daughter is also studying in 9th standard. 

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food & some goats to be able to earn a good income. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Farhat is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better profits to her husband’s business and improve the financial condition of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy animal food & some goats.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 40 year-old lady married to Mathew.  They have seven children, aged twenty two, eighteen, sixteen, fourteen, twelve, eight and five years respectively. They live in Tuiyo, an area near Eldoret town. She sells milk and has been in this business for the past ten years.  Her income is  KES.20,500 per month.

She was introduced to KADET, LTD. by a friend and is applying for her second loan of KES.50,000 with KADET LTD.  With this loan, she plans to buy more liters of milk for sale.

She hopes to operate a large dairy where she will be able to supply hotels and to sell the best quality of milk to her customers.  In the future, she would like to extend the same services to the city center.

loans.use: to buy more liters of milk for sale

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien hace 8 años inicio con la venta de chiverías, helados, gaseosas…etc. con las ganancias lo fue surtiendo y aumentando. En la actualidad ella vende semanal aproximadamente 14, 000 córdobas.
Ella con el crédito compra arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, queso, pan, gaseosa…etc. entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who, eight years ago, started selling snacks, iced treats, soda, etc.  She used her profits to stock and increase her business.  She currently sells approximately 14,000 cordobas worth of stock a week.  

Ana María will use her loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, bread, soda and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, bread, soda, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 29 years old and single. He has been operating his quarrying business for three years. He has been loaned KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, and he will use the loan amount to purchase mining equipment for his business.

He will put the anticipated profit back into the business. He hopes to own his own quarry in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase mining equipment for his business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel, es rentista jubilado y su esposa es ama de casa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción (arena, estuco, cemento, pintura) ya que realizara la refacción de su vivienda. Vive en la casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres  hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is retired and lives off of his assets.  His wife is a homemaker.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials (sand, stucco, cement, and paint) so that he can finish the repairs to his house.  Miguel lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.  

Miguel is very pleased with the loans that have been provided so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.  This is the second time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Munkhtuya is 30 years old, married to Erdene-Ochir. Their marriage has been blessed with two children.  One of their daughters, Anujin, is 10 years old and attends secondary school, the other 3-year-old Tanan is attending kindergarten. 
She obtained her Bachelors degree in Bank Accounting in 2006. Today, she works as an accountant at a local company while her spouse is employed by a local drilling company.  
Her family lives in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar and she has decided to renovate its interior structure.  She is requesting a 3.500.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to buy all the necessary renovation materials for the apartment.   
Munkhtuya is a hard working woman who believes that the renovation of her apartment will improve her children’s living condition significantly.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials for renovation work

loans.name: Euridice Conforte's Group

texts.fr: Chef de fil d'un groupe de 5 personnes, Conforte est mariée et a à charge 4 enfants. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés et évoluent très bien à l'école. Cette cliente a pour activité principale la vente des sacs de charbon qui lui sont livrés à domicile par les grossistes ayant reçu l'agrément de commercialiser les produits forestiers. Sa clientèle est  constituée des ménages résidant dans la même localité que lui ainsi que les zones environnantes. Conforte est à son 1er crédit à FINADEV et sollicite le renouvellement afin  de renforcer son stock de provision et de diversifier ses produits pour une meilleure satisfaction des attentes de sa clientèle. Le bénéfice qu'engendrera le prêt lui permettra d'améliorer la qualité des conditions de vie de sa famille en participant d'avantage aux  charges de sa famille. Ces coéquipières exercent elles aussi leurs activités, soit à domicile, soit dans des boutiques installées dans les localités proches de leurs domiciles.
texts.en: The leader of a group of 5 women, Conforte is married and responsible for four children, all of whom are currently being educated in school. She sells bags of charcoal that are delivered to her home in bulk quantities by wholesalers who have approval to sell forest products. Her client base is composed of a multitude of neighboring residents and those living in the surrounding areas. Conforte is currently repaying her first loan from FINADEV and is asking for a loan renewal in order to purchase greater quantities and diversify the types of products she has in order to satisfy her clients. Profits she receives will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family. Her colleagues are also small business owners that work from their homes or small boutiques located near their homes.

loans.use: purchase five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 56 years of age and married with three children. 

Ludivina runs her store within the village of San Manuel San Mateo. She has had this business for one year, because her first business is a transport motorcycle. Aside from her store and transportation business she is also engaged in agriculture, particularly a fishpond business. Ludivina is grateful for all the blessings she has at this time. 

She is aiming to increase her profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bills. So, for these reason, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000 to be used in buying additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles and biscuits for her grocery store. She believes that she can improve her store and other businesses through the loan amount she requested. 

Ludivina expects that she could be a successful businesswoman someday. In addition, she believes that her patience and hard work will provide a better result in achieving her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, instant noodles and biscuits for her grocery store

loans.name: Gbonbotor Rawfish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Gbonbotor Raw Fish Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000.00 SLL each to invest in their businesses. 

Isata is the leader of this group. Isata is 32 years old, married and has three children. Isata sells fresh fish and has been doing this for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cottons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cottons of fresh fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción, de 33 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 08 años. Juntos habitam en el terreno de su madre, ahí construyó una casa para su él y su familia. Ella junto a su pareja trabajan mucho, ya que quieren progresar y dar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos. El trabajo de Asunción consiste en la venta de ropa, negocio que ofrece a amigos, familia y vecinos, además de nuevos clientes que siempre llegan a su casa cada vez que viene la mercadería traída de la ciudad de Lima. Por lo general vende prendas que están a la moda y de la mejor calidad, lleva ya trabajando con esto por dos años y seis meses, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer muchas cosas diferentes, además tiene independencia. Por otro lados sus fieles clientes le traen nueva clientela y eso le da ventaja a su negocio. Este será el préstamo número tres con MFP, esta muy contenta de trabajar con el grupo con el que esta y espera poder seguir trabajando por más tiempo. Además esta muy agradecida por la confianza brindada en su persona y espera poder seguir siendo puntual y no fallar con ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa al por mayor, ya que así le sale a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Asunción, 33, is a happy and very dynamic woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, ages 16 and 8.  Together they live on his mother's property, where they built a house for him and his family.  She and her partner work a lot, since they want to get ahead and give their children a good education and nourishment.

Asunción's work consists of selling clothing, a business she offers to friends, family, and neighbors, in addition to new customers who always come to her house every time the merchandise arrives from the city of Lima.  In general she sells articles that are in style and of the best quality.

She has been working with this for two years and six months now, and up to now she has done it alone.  What she likes about her job is that she has time to do many different things.  Besides, she has independence.  On the other hand, her loyal customers bring her new customers and this gives an advantage to her business.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to work with the group she's with and she hopes to be able to continue working longer.  In addition, she is very grateful for the confidence offered her personally and she hopes to be able to continue being punctual and not let you down.

With the requested total, she will buy more clothing wholesale, since that way she gets it at a better price.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Wilson de 31 años, esta casado con Norma de 25 años, fruto de esa relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Wilson, es una persona que se caracteriza por tener buenos principios. Él se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cultivando cacao y frutas cítricas, actividad que lo viene ejerciendo durante más de 14 años. En un incio no le fue fácil, ya que los productos que cultivaba tenía un costo alto, pero paulatinamente mejoraron las cosas. Generalmente trabaja con su querida esposa, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre contrata a los peones, quienes son los encargados de recolectar los frutos para luego secarlo y venderlo en su propia localidad. Él está feliz por la buena producción que tiene gracias a la dedicación constante en sus plantaciones. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles comprará un motor para su maquina, que se encarga de sacar la maleza de su campo agrícola.
texts.en: Wilson is 31 years old, is married to Norma who is 25 years old.  They have 3 children.  Together they live in the city center of Puerto Amargura, Llochegua.  Wilson is a person known for his good principles.  He is a farmer, growing cocoa and citrus fruit.  He has been doing this for 14 years.  In the beginning it was not easy since the crops that he grows were expensive, gradually, however,  things improved.  He normally works with his loving wife, but during harvest he employs workers who are the ones that pick the fruit, which is later dried and sold at his own outlet.  He is happy with the production that he has achieved through the constant care that he gives to his crops.  This is his second loan with MFP which he promises to repay on time.  With the 2,000 soles he will buy a motor for his machine that takes the weeds out of his fields.

loans.use: to buy a motor for the machine that removes the weeds from his fields.

loans.name: Lisbon Group

texts.en:
Masudi, who is in his late 20s, is married.  He has been running a charcoal business for one and a half years now. He works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the charcoal business and for household expenses and has repaid all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and to take care of his wife. His dream is to one day be able to buy clothes and take them to Kenya.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Lisbon", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and to take care of his wife

loans.name: Dora Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Dora tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañada con tres hijos.

Ella tiene 10 años de haber instalado un molino, para moler maíz. Fue su esposo quien le enseño como usarlo. Ella viaja a una ciudad de la zona oriental del país, para adquirir los materiales que necesita para darle mantenimiento al molino.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar el molino, ya que necesita nuevos discos, reparar el motor y para comprar maíz para vender. Con esto ella tendrá en buen estado el molino y no dejar de trabajar por que se la ha dañado. Así no dejara de haber ingresos económicos y con la venta del grano de maíz ella lo comprara en mayor cantidad y a mejor precio.

Dora espera ahorrar ya que le gustaría comprar un molino más, y de las ganancias ahorrar para construir una casa propia, por que actualmente ella alquila una casa.
texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old and has three children.  She has been offering a corn milling service for 10 years.  It was her husband who taught her how to use the mill.  Dora travels to a city in the eastern part of the country to acquire the materials she needs to service her mill.

Dora will use the loan that she is requesting to repair her mill as she needs to buy new disks and fix the engine.  She will also buy corn to sell.  This will enable her to have her mill in a good state of repair and she will not have to stop working, which means that she won't stop making income.  She will also sell corn which she will buy in larger quantities and at a better price.

Dora hopes to save up as she would like to buy a further mill and, with the profits she makes, she would like to save up and build a house of her own as she currently rents a house.

loans.use: to repair her mill as she needs to buy new disks and fix the engine.  She will also buy corn to sell

loans.name: Sape

texts.en:
Sape is 48 years old, married, and has eight adult children.  She lives in the town of Samauga.  To make a living, Sape raises crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell.  Sape has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2011, Sape joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Sape plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 40-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Leah, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 10 years. Jeremiah has been rearing pigs for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Jeremiah will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. He will invest the anticipated profit from the business in the education of his children. 

He hopes to own a big pig farm in the future and become a major supplier of pig products.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Amelia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables

loans.name: Siulia

texts.en:
Siulia is 55 years of age and is married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Siulia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Siulia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Siulia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 59 years old, married, and has three children.  He runs a shop to earn a living.  Besides that, he has a tailoring business which his wife helps in running.  He also does farming for more income generation.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  This has helped him to invest in his businesses.

Patrick hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Gs La Aguja I Group

texts.es:
El joven Melvin, es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio,  vive   con su madre. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 3 años de  tener este tipo de negocio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites, y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Con el préstamo Melvin espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender  mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su  negocio  sea   más  sólido  y  rentable.
Los sueños de Melvin son casarse  y darles  a su madre  y  sus  hijos  lo mejor.
Ana, se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace mas  de  6 años  en  sus  casa de habitación.
María, se dedica a la compra y venta de de  calzado, carteras  y ropa americana, Desde hace  mas de 9 años.
Choluteca  Honduras - Mayo del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites para su negocio

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and lives in Kisauni, Mombasa. David and his wife, together, have been able to raise four children. David has a well-stocked store, selling household consumables. He is a hardworking and responsible person, who is getting ahead with his hard work. Thanks to his work, he has given his children what they needed to have a dignified life, without deprivation.

He is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more. He says that his goal is to be able to keep growing with his business and keep gaining customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 33 years, dairy farmer at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of five who has been in this business for the last three years doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, She will use the loan to purchase dairy feeds and medication, the anticipated profit to complete her residential house. She hopes to be financially stable in future.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds and medication

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has been working as a dentist for over 19 years. After receiving and repaying her first loan with Kiva and Mifex, she is requesting a second loan in order to invest in a new dentist chair and other equipment. The capital has helped her business because she has better quality materials and tools. She is slowly seeing that her client base has become larger and more satisfied. Her offices are located in the city although she lives in Duran, a poor community on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Carmen also works for a foundation several days a week, offering her dental services at much more affordable prices to the local community. She has 4 children who her and her husband must support.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase a dentist chair and other equipment

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo has one year of experience in this business. He is a recent school graduate. He came up with the idea to create a computer center, and told his parents about it. There is no such thing in the are where they live. His parents helped him out with a loan, which he used to make a good place in the home and to buy a computer. Today, he has three computers. He works every day of the week from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM. He also works in a place where they sell food; when he goes out, his brother is in charge of the business.

Ricardo wants this loan in order to invest in office supplies for his business, and also to paint a sign on the outside of the building so that more people will know it is there.

Ricardo is single. He is 21 years old. Currently he lives with his parents. He hopes will this loan that he will be able to increase his income, so that in the future his can improve the floor of his location, which is very low.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in office supplies.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort E., a 40-year-old woman, sells foodstuff to people. She is married with two (2) children. She is proud of her business and promise to effectively use the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel C. has hawked groceries door to door in her neighborhood for many years. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years. She used her first loan to expand her product line and boost sales.
