At this time she has made the contacts necessary to set herself up making and selling macrame crafts, and important trade in her city. She needs start-up capital to buy materials. Making and selling handicrafts will help her round out the income from her other business and support her large family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Isabel C. se dedica a la venta de víveres en el mercado de su zona, comenzó hace muchos años, vendiendo de puerta en puerta y de puesto en puesto según los pedidos que le hacían. Es socia de Pro Mujer hace 7 años, con su primer desembolso logro capitalizarse y variar su mercadería, incrementando la cantidad de pedidos y mejorando sus ingresos. En la actualidad, Isabel tiene la firme intención de capacitarse en la elaboración de artesanías con macramé, rubro que tiene gran acogida en algunos sectores de la ciudad, y que prácticamente ya ha iniciado los contactos necesarios para la introducción en ese mercado. Isabel necesita de capital para emprender este negocio, tanto para su capacitación, como para la compra de materiales necesarios para el inicio de estas artesanías. De esta forma y con ayuda de su otro negocio, sustentar a toda su familia que es muy numerosa.

loans.use: To buy materials for macrame.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: A. Gulsara has been engaged in business for over 10 years. She is divorced and has one child. Her business is located in Chkalovsk, Khujand. She sells men’s clothes such as sportswear, jackets, T-shirts and so on. She brought her goods herself from Bishkek and Istaravshan. She goes to purchase goods two times per month. The turnover of her goods is high, and she regularly repays her loans on time. She has shown herself to be a responsible person during her partnership with MicroInvest. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase warm clothes for the coming winter season.

loans.use: To purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is 36 years old, married with 4 children. She hails from the rural area in Ajangbadi, Lagos State Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and yam flour to her nearby communities. She has been in business for  the past 7 years and she is trustworthy because she has 100% repayment with LAPO loans during this time. She needs the loan of US$ 800 to expand her business and buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan Gabriel works as a sorter in a soft drink factory. What he earns there, however, is not enough to support his two daughters, both of whom are studying so that they can have a better future. Even though his daughters are only 10 and 13 right now, he is already saving money for their education at a university. In January of 2006, Juan Gabriel opened a small stand outside of his home and began selling new and used clothes. Once he saw that the business was becoming known he began to also sell soft drinks, cookies and plants. He commented, "The idea is to make the business grow bit by bit."

With this goal in mind, he is asking for a loan of $650. He is ready to repay this loan over a period of 5 months. With the money, he will be able to buy more merchandise so that he can have something new to offer his customers. With your help Juan will be able to succeed and thus give his daughters a better future.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Gabriel, trabaja como repartidor en una empresa de venta de refrescos, sin embargo, con lo que gana no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus 2 hijas, a quienes tiene estudiando para que éstas puedan tener un mejor futuro. Actualmente sus hijas tienen 13 y 10 años, sin embargo Juan Gabriel desea ahorrar dinero para sus estudios universitarios. En Enero del 2006, gracias a su visión, Juan Gabriel, abrió un pequeño localito fuera de su casa, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y nueva, y después de que vio que el negocio se iba haciendo conocido fue como ingresó en el local venta de refrescos, y después galletas y botanas. “La idea es ir agrandando el negocio poco a poco” comentó.

Y con esta meta, es con la que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Juan podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Juan podrá sacar su negocio adelante. Además de poder ofrecerle a sus hijas un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
N. Munira is 36 years old. She is alone raising two children.

Munira sells clothing for men. She rents her trading place in one of the stores of the city. Being in this business already for 8 years, Munira obtained rich experience in choosing the goods of a good quality and at acceptable prices for her clientele. She tries to have a wide range of goods. Considering that the current business is the main source of income for the family Munira is doing her best to make it stable and successful.

Munira has been provided with several loans by IMON. All the previous loans were managed accurately and in a timely manner. Now Munira requests 600.00 US dollars for the term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase new clothing for men for selling in order to increase the range of goods. Munira thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for men for selling.

loans.name: Aurea's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Aurea and Enedina have belonged to the "Faith" community bank for 2, 2, and 1 year respectively.

Maria is married, 50 years old and has 2 children. She sells anticuchos (grilled marinated meat served on a skewer) at night from the front door of her house, something which she has done for 2 years. In addition, she and her husband sell used batteries at the San Juan Bautista Sunday market.

Aurea is a widow, 43 years old and has 2 children. Aurea sells cheese in the Magdalena market as an ambulatory vendor.

Enedina is married, 30 years old and has 4 children. Enedina sells candy at the entrance to the Miraflores school from Abril to December and during the other months travels to local markets. Enedina, with her loan, is planning to start selling school uniforms and supplies.

The dreams of Maria, Aurea and Enedina are that their children become professionals, and to invest in other businesses and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria, Aurea y Enedina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Fe hace 2, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

Maria es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende anticuchos por las noches en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Además junto a su esposo venden baterías usadas en la feria dominical de San Juan Bautista.

Por otro lado Aurea es viuda, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Aurea vende quesos en el mercado Magdalena de manera ambulatoria.

Mientras que Enedina es casada, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Enedina vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio de Miraflores los meses de abril a Diciembre y los demás meses viaja a las ferias. Enedina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de uniformes y útiles.

Maria, Aurea y Enedina necesitan préstamos de 200 soles, 200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, queso, uniformes y útiles.

Los sueños de Maria, Aurea y Enedina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, invertir en otro negocio y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase meat, cheese, school uniforms and supplies.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sri Wiriani

texts.id:
It is hard to find ready-to-eat entrees and snacks sellers in the Brawantangi village. Therefore, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani became a a travelling food seller, selling ready-to-eat entrees, snacks and various vegetables. Every morning, Sri buys her inventory from the individuals, who cook the food, and from her local market. Her customers mostly live in her neighborhood. They appreciate Sri’s service because they do not have to go to the market themselves to buy and prepare their meals. Sri earns around $2.50 - $5 profits daily. From this income and her husband’s as a farmer, they can support their daily needs, including their child’s first grade tuition. With the loan through DINARI, Sri is hopeful that she can expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Di dusun Brawantangi sangat jarang ditemui penjual lauk pauk dan kue serta makanan lainnya yang sudah siap disantap. Oleh karena itu Ni Putu Sri Wiriani berinisiatif untuk menjadi pedagang keliling yang menjual lauk pauk, kue dan berbagai macam sayuran yang sudah jadi. Setiap pagi Sri membeli bahan dagangannya dari orang yang sudah membuatkan dan ada pula yang dibeli di pasar. Langganan Sri umumnya berada di sekitar dusun tempat tinggalnya. Kebanyakan dari para pelanggannya merasa tertolong dengan dagang keliling yang ditekuni Sri karena tidak perlu harus ke pasar untuk membeli bahan makanan. Keuntungan perhari yang di dapat oleh Sri sekitar Rp. 25.000,- sampai Rp. 50.000,-. Dari keuntungan dagang keliling ini bersama suaminya yang bekerja sebagi petani, Sri mampu membiayai kebutuhan sehari-hari keluarganya, serta mampu memenuhi keperluan anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku SD kelas 1. Dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI maka besar harapan Sri akan mampu meningkatkan jumlah dagangannnya.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto worked for many years in a water-bottling company; his salary was very low and insufficient. Tired of the situation and with the help of his wife, he started selling fruit cocktails, for which he acquired a tricycle cart. They traveled through the streets where there were many passers-by, and little by little formed their customer base. When his sales started improving, he decided to set up a little store in his home so that his wife could tend to it while he continued selling in the streets. With much effort, they have managed to prosper, and he now needs support to purchase more stock and increase his sales.

He needs a loan for US $450, which he will repay in 4 months, to purchase merchandise and offer a wider variety of fruits and vegetables in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto trabajo muchos años en una embotelladora de agua el sueldo era poco y no alcanzaba , cansado de la situación y con ayuda de su esposa empezó a vender ensaladas de frutas, para lo cual adecuo un triciclo y recorrían las calles y lugares donde habían muchos trausentes, poco a poco hizo su clientela, al mejorar sus ventas decidió adecuar un lugar en su casa para que su esposa lo atendiera y el continuara con la venta en la calle, con muchos esfuerzos han logrado prosperar, ahora requiere apoyo para adquirir mas inventario y mejorar sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas variedad de futas y verduras en su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables to stock his store.

loans.name: Ablavi Cécile

texts.fr:
From a modest family, Madame Ablavi Cécile A. is a native of Datcha, a village in the prefecture of Ogou, 147 km from Lomé (the capital of Togo). She is married to Monsieur Adolphe Etse who is a teacher. At a very young age, Madame A. became involved in selling cereals in her village. Later, she moved to Agoè, a working-class neighborhood in Lomé. Although she is in Lomé, she still buys her corn, millet and beans in her native village.

This is her first loan and she is requesting it in order to buy eight sacks of corn to sell in the new market in which she has acquired a place.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Issue d’une modeste famille, madame A. Ablavi Cécile est originaire de Datcha, un village situé dans la préfecture de l’Ogou à 147 KM de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur ETSE Adolphe qui est un enseignant. Très tôt elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales dans son village. Ensuite, elle s’est installée à Agoè une des quartiers populaires de Lomé. Bien qu’elle soit à Lomé, elle achète toujours le maïs, le mil, le haricot dans son village natal.

Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de maïs pour pouvoir vendre dans le nouveau marché dans lequel elle a trouvé un emplacement.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of corn

loans.name: Van

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Van is 56 years old. She has 2 children who are grown and already employed. She and her husband are both retired military personnel with retirement pension of 120USD/month. After retiring, in order to supplement their income, she sells fertilizer for a private company in Nam Dan. With the business being stable, her income is 60 USD/month. At the beginning of 2008 when TYM fund started business in her town, she discussed with her family to join the fund to borrow money to improve their economic condition. She hopes to be able to borrow 300USD, combined with her family's savings, to open a shop selling fertilizer. They would bring in average income of 180.00 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese bu Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị Vân 56 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đều đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm. Hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Sau khi về hưu, để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chị đã xin bán lân đạm cho công ty cổ phần vật tư huyện Nam Đàn. Công việc ổn định cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Đầu năm 2008 khi Quỹ tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn huyện Nam đàn tỉnh Nghệ An chị đã bàn với gia đình tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn đầu tư phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ kết hợp với nguồn vốn của gia đình để mở cửa hàng kinh doanh phân đạm Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chhorn C., 55 years old, sells pieces of wood chopped from the forest, earning approximately $5.00 per day, while his wife, Mrs. Rek Mala, 53 years old, grows produce such as tomatoes and beans to sell. They live with two children, both of whom are married, in Contraing Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Now Mr. Chun is seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase two oxen to transport the chopped wood, with the remainder being used to buy additional fertilizer for his wife’s produce business. The loan will increase their businesses’ sustainability and profits, and also help to improve their family's standard of living.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to transport the chopped wood as well as fertilizer for his wife's produce business

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Shara is 37 years old and married with five children between the ages of 20 years and 7 months old. She has sold firewood since 2007. Everyday, she works from 8 am to 8 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Shara is requesting a loan to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es: La señora Eladia está solicitando refinanciamiento de su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (cambiarle el zinc a la casa), trabaja como docente del Nerpe El Triunfo,  desde hace 8 años, tiene dos hijas, la mayor de 17 años  estudia su quinto año de Educación secundaria y la niña menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en la quesera el Triunfo, y ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, la profesora Eladia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honesta, vive en comarca el Triunfo,   actualmente  esta estudiando quinto año  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, sueña con que a sus hijas no les falte nada para que en el futuro sean mujeres de bien y contar con estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia pues son familias pobres pero muy trabajadoras y muy queridas por la comunidad.La Sra. S.  se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los creditos brindados por  la institución ha logrado comprar electrodomésticos y ha mejorado la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eladia seeks refinancing to invest in home improvements (replacing the zinc in the house). She works as a teacher at the Nerpe El Tirunfo, where she has taught for 8 years. She has two children: the oldest daughter is 17-years old and is studying in the 5th year of secondary school and the younger daughter is 12-years old and is studying in the 6th grade. Her husband works at the Cheese Factory of Triunfo and they both share in the household expenses. Mrs. Eladia is a hard working woman, who is responsible and honest. She lives in Comarca el Tirunfo, and is currently in her fifth year at the University of URACCAN in New Guinea. She dreams for her children to not miss out on anything and that they have the best future. She also wants for them to have stable jobs and in turn for them to help families who are needy, but hardworking and mindful of the community. Mrs. S. is grateful to AFODENIC, because with the loan offered by the institution she has been able to purchase appliances and has improved the infrastructure of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change/replace the zinc in her house

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela C. de 25 años, esta acompañada por el señor Victor Villalba de 26 años. n   Ellos trabajaban como empleados de una casa de empeños, teniendo un objetivo que es de trabajar por cuenta propia y para ello necesitaban  capital, ahorraron parte de su salario por un buen tiempo, y aproximadamente en el año 2.006 empezaron con la compra y venta de mercaderias; gracias a ese emprendimiento en la actualidad ya tienen su clientela bien formada.n   La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas mercaderias como: ropas, championes, etc, teniendo en cuenta que la mayor parte de su venta es a crédito.n   Ellos creen que la educación es la base fundamental para el fortalecimiento, crecimientony progreso del pais.   nn
texts.en:
Ms. Graciela C. is 25 years old and is accompanied by Mr. Victor Villalba, who is 26. They used to work in a pawn shop, but they had the goal of working for themselves, so they needed the capital to do so. They saved up a part of their salary for a long time, and around 2006, they began buying and selling merchandise. Thanks to this enterprise, they have a strong client-base. They are requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as clothing, athletic footwear, etc., keeping in mind that they sell most of their products for credit. They believe that education is the fundamental base for the strengthening, the growth, and the progress of their country.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing and athletic footwear)

loans.name: Mrs. Noeur Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of 13 people is located in Tong Rong Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Noeur K. is the village bank president who has beE. selected by the members. She has 0.5-hectares to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Try Pov, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar or wine. He cannot do his work because he cannot climb up to gather palm juice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Noeur K. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie into a ladder so her husband can re-start the business. She is 38 years old and the mother of two childrE., one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

One member of this village bank has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The end-of-term member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to make a ladder for her husband's business

loans.name: Yakhshiboy

texts.ru: Хамроев Яхшибой мужчина в возросте 42 лет , женат имеет 4 детей,проживает в поселке Хамровод Б.Гафуровского  района.сам Яхшибой всё своё время проводит дома , ухаживает за скотом.Откормив скот перепродаёт его на Чайрухском рынке.Он  считает что пока скот дешёвый , то необходимо увеличить колличество скота.Поэтому он решил обратится в Микроинвест. Сейчас у него 30 голов баранов.По бизнесу ему помогают его сыновья.
texts.en:
Yakhshiboy H. is a man of 42 years, married, with four children, lives in the small town of Hamrovod of the Gafurskii region. Yakhshiboy spends all of his time at home, tending to his livestock. He feeds and raises it, then sells it at the Chairuhsk market. He thinks that now, while the livestock is cheap, it is absolutely necessary to increase the amount of livestock he has. This is why he's turned to Microinvest. Currently he has 30 rams. His sons help him out with his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle purchase

loans.name: Ameena Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Ameena baji is a 50 year old married lady and has resided in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan, for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is A. G.. He runs a toy shop and has 6 years experience in the business. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son has a sweetmeat selling business. The next son is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her youngest son reads in kindergarten. Ameena baji works hard to pay for the school fees of her youngest son. She sells milk, which she gets from her buffalo. Presently she has one buffalo but she wants to buy another with the profit of her milk selling business. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son. 

She is a group leader with some other women in her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to change the body of an auto-rickshaw. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair vehicles. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Begum baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motoro vehicle)

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is already 33 years old and a mother of three named: Jamaica, 12, a grade 6 student; Glorylyn, 7, a grade one student; and Janelymae, 4 years old. Julieta is married to Lino, a furniture worker. Julieta manages to serve as beautician in their village at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela.

Despite the difficulties experienced by her family, Julieta and her husband are able to support all the needs of their family and they are able to live happily and harmoniously with the other members of their community.

Julieta wanted to have a better life someday by improving her skills in providing beauty services such as hair fixing, face make-up, pedicure and manicure in their village. She wants to buy new sets of beauty kits for her business. The loan will also enable her to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her eggplants which are planted in their backyard. For the realization of her plans, Julieta wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP4,000.

Julieta promised that she will never try to be a burden with her co-members in the program and promised to work hard to attain her goal in life. She also added that God is always guiding her and her family till the end.

loans.use: Purchase new sets of beauty kits and fertilizers for her eggplants

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group from Las Reinas Bank of Hope are receiving their first loan through Kiva's partner, Esperanza International. These enthusiastic entrepreneurs expect to improve their income and quality of life with their business activities.

Mari B., 25, and Robinson R., 30, are two of the group members. They are both single. Mari has three children and Robinson has one child. Mari sells personal-care products and Robinson sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Since neither of them completed high school (Mari only reached middle school), both of them are very committed to providing a better education for their children so they can have a better life and hopefully, break the poverty cycle they've been born in.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these new entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia A., es casada, actualmente vive su pareja  tambien le ayuda en el negocio, tiene una sola hija, quien ya es mayor de edad,  se encuentra en el exterior trabajando quien de esta manera tambien le ayuda para la economía familiar. El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio pues se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, y tambien a la compra y venta de bebidas y helados  
La señora Sonia retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería  como remeras, short, blusas, zapatos,  y otros. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 06:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.
El proyecto a largo plazo es la de llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida de ropas en general para niños y adultos.-
texts.en:
Sonia A. is married and lives with her partner who helps her in her business. She has one adult daughter who works outside the country and in this way helps her with the family finances. Her business is in her home: she buys and sells clothing as well as refreshments and ice cream. Sonia will use the loan to buy a variety of clothing articles such as shirts, shorts, blouses, shoes, and so on. She starts her work very early in the day, at about 6:00 A.M. in order to buy everything she needs for her business. Her long-term goal is to have a well-stocked clothing store with clothes for children as well as for adults.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing items such as shirts, shorts, blouses, shoes and so on

loans.name: Maria Inocencia Remedios

texts.es:
Maria Inocencia es una señora que mantuvo a sus hijos  ahora ya están grandes y tienen su propia familia por lo que ella vive sola, con lo poco que ganaba pues no le alcanzaba para darle mantenimiento  a su casa. Su deseo de Maria es ampliar su casa construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente. Anteriormente se le otorgo un préstamo el cual pagó muy bien donde puso un portón. 
Ella es una señora emprendedora que le gusta el trabajo se dedica a vender tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maria Inocencia is an older woman who used to support her children, but now that they are older and have their own families, she lives alone. Her small income is not sufficient to allow her to do maintenance work on her house. Maria’s wish is to expand her house by building a room on the front of the house. She previously obtained a loan to build a gate and successfully paid it back. She is a take-charge woman who likes her work. She works in sales and has her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Rosa C. desde hace 15 años se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de bebidas como lo son gaseosas, erfrescos, agua, jugos, entre otros. De igual manera vende reposterías todo siendo comercializado en su propia casa de habitación.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de las bebidas ya que le urge actualmente. Cabe señalar que Ceprodel le ha sido de mucho beneficio anteriormente por lo que ha logrado comprar su mantenedora para guardar sus bebidas. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado.
texts.en:
For over 15 years, Mrs. Rosa C. has managed her own business in the Mayoreo market located in the city of Managua. She sells various beverages including but not limited to pop soda, water and juices along with home-made desserts. The reason she has approached Ceprodel for help is that she urgently needs funds for the purchase of beverages. It's important to note that Ceprodel has benefitted her greatly in the past, as she was able to purchase a refrigerator through them to store her beverages. She trustingly hopes that her requested funds will be awarded.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 03 hijos, ella vive en el Sector Wincachani Comunidad de Punta Sahuacasi.  Tiene estudios de 3er grado de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ganado menor (alpacas, llamas).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, este dinero le servirá para comprar mas cabezas de ganado.

Le gustaría  tener un emporio para obtener más ganancias, así con el dinero que obtenga darles educación a sus hijos.

Maria dice que lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas, además del ahorro.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” Communal Bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 44 years old, a single mother with three children. She lives in the Wincachani community of Punta Sahuacasi. She completed 3rd grade of elementary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She sells livestock (alpacas and llamas). Her first loan was for S/ 300.00 nuevos soles. Today she would like a loan for S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy more heads of livestock. She would like to have a general store to increase her earnings and with the money she earns provide an education to her children. Maria says that what she enjoys the most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and talks, in addition to the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpacas and llamas

loans.name: Jeryn

texts.en:
Jeryn S. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 32 years old. Jeryn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeryn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Jeryn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jeryn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeryn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jeryn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jeryn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Owusu

texts.en:
Owusu started selling fish 15 years ago at the Sefwi Dwinase community market. Owusu prepares and serves very tasty, good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. At the community market where she sells, she is the queen mother of all the smoked fish sellers. She has a cunning spirit and is able to convince her suppliers to provide more fish to her when there is a high demand for fish and supply is low. She buys stocks of fish from fishmongers. She has a large customer base that travels from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish. 

Owusu is 57 years old, married and the mother of seven children. Currently, four are in senior high school, one is in the university and the rest are working. She requests a loan to upgrade her stock of fish. Owusu belongs to a village bank called Aver Maria.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working as a beautician since 2000 to provide, in collaboration with her husband, better life conditions for her children. Today, Safaa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand her business in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou is twenty-nine years old and sells supplies from her home to the farmers in the village. She sells items like fertilizer, animal feed, and medicines for animals. She also raises pigs for slaughtering in a pen behind her house.  Another source of family income comes from her husband who distills white wine.  He also provides a service for a fee of hulling his neighbors' rice on his milling machine. Chou says that she manages her investment more successfully as the number of her regular customers increases. Recently, some of her supplies have been exhausted, so she wants to restock and is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, to purchase twenty-five sacks of fertilizer and a variety of other farm supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 38-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He has owned and operated a metal shop since 1990 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family.

After this long experience in the field, Nader is requesting $500 to buy a new welding machine to develop his work.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Bi

texts.en: Bi S., 51, is a domestic farmer. She owns a large piece of farmland that she bought from her neighbor. To earn a living, she plants different kinds of fruits and vegetables with the help of her husband. Bi S. has four daughters, one of whom is married. Three of her daughters are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh City and contribute their incomes to meeting the family’s living expenses. This coming season, Bi S. hopes to grow crops of potatoes and green beans, but she lacks the money to do so. That is why she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva partner, HKL.

loans.use: To grow potato and green bean crops

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: La señora Maria José T., ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Maria tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la compra-venta de zapatos, uniformes, cosméticos y artículos variados. Cabe señalarse, ella dio inicio a este negocio debido a la necesidad de auto mantenerse económicamente, debido a la situación actual del país. Ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy independiente ya que es una joven capaz de lograr sus metas además a ella le gustaría seguir estudiando y con sus propios esfuerzos piensa que podrá hacerlo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de zapatos y uniformes escolares para aprovechar las ventas de este mes de septiembre, ya que ahorita tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella tiene un sueño de llegar a tener una tienda, en la cual pueda ser un negocio bien establecido en el que pueda vender todo lo relacionado con vestuario y cosméticos
texts.en:
Señora Maria José T. is 23 years old, single, and does not have children. For 7 years she has sold shoes, uniforms, cosmetics and other items. It should be noted that she started this business due to the necessity of maintaining herself economically, given the current situation in the country. She has always enjoyed being an independent person, since she is a young person who is capable of achieving her goals. In addition, she would like to continue her studies, and through her own efforts she thinks that she will be able to do this. This loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes and school uniforms to take advantage of the sales in this month of September given that now she has enough orders to fill. She has a dream of eventually having a store, which could become a well-established business in which she could sell everything related to clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mrs. Sy Y. lives in Prey Meas Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land that she farms for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Doeurn, sells groceries door-to-door. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy a new motorbike. His motorbike is very old and it uses a lot of petroleum, which is expensive. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Sy Y., has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband. Mrs. Sy Y. has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es: Francisca Elena tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo.  Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que ha salido adelante por medio de un gran esfuerzo. Su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno, sus inicios se dan por su Mama que le enseño a elaborar estos productos, al principio le fue muy difícil porque no tenía el  capital suficiente para establecer su negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que la mayoría de sus vecinos disfrutan de sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, dulce, azúcar y leche. El sueño de Francisca es tener un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca Elena is 39 years old and has 3 dependent children. She is a fighter who has managed to succeed through tremendous effort. Francisca has been in business for more than 18 years. She makes and sells baked goods, skills that she learned from her mother. At first, she encountered difficulties because she did not have sufficient capital to set up her business. She works out of her home and most of her neighbors enjoy her products.

Francisca is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to purchase corn, firewood, lime, preserves, sugar, and milk. She dreams of acquiring a plot of land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, preserves, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 75-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ahmad has been selling bags and other luggage since 2000. Ahmad is special in his work because he offers good quality products. His customers are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. Ahmad has been a micro-credit client for nine years now and has always repaid on time.

When Ahmad first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties especially since there is not a lot of competition and he has fair prices. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent business. In the future, he plans on enlarging his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Mr. Musa K., 41 and his wife, Mrs. Maismes Sos, 39, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. One of their sons is a construction worker; the other children are still young and attend school. 

Musa and his wife are fish sellers. They fish in the Mekong River and the lake near their village and sell the fish in the local market. Musa wants a boat motor; it will make it easier for him to move his boat from one place to another. Hence he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy M. is from the city of Caritan Norte Tuguegarao, City. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precy owns and operates a motor transport business. Precy has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $70 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Precy joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Precy is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus 3 hijos; Jorge D. 18, Leonardo D. 15 y María D. 14 años.
Ella está acostumbrada a atrabajar para el bienestar D. su familia, es así que desD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa, actividad que le permite tener libertad para realizar las labores en su hogar y dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales son su fuente D. inspiración. 
A María le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por ello que da todo D. sí para mejorar sus ingresos. Un día normal en su rutina comienza temprano en la mañana dedicándose netamente en las labores del hogar, posteriormente ofrece sus productos D. casas en casa D. sus clientas y también hace entrega D. los pedidos que le hicieron.
En un futuro, le gustaría tener un bazar donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre le ha ido muy bien con todos los pagos, pues es una persona bastante responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para vender en estas fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three children; Jorge, 18; Leonardo, 15; and Maria, 14. She is used to working for her family’s well-being, so she has been selling clothing for the past three years. This allows her to have the freedom to also take care of her home and dedicate time to her children, who are the fountain of her inspiration. Maria likes her work very much and she gives it all she can so that she can improve her income. On a typical day, she starts her routine early in the morning beginning with her household chores. She then shows her household products to customers in their homes and delivers any previous orders. In the future she would like to have a small shop where she can sell her products in larger amounts. This will be her third loan through MFP and she has always done well with her payments, as she is a very responsible person. She will use the money from this loan to buy larger quantities of products that she will sell over the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juan Tomás

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León, el señor Juan C. con mucho esfuerzo se desempeña en la actividad de venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, sorgo los cuales son comercializados al por mayor en diferentes pulperías del municipio.
La situación que actualmente atraviesa es que no posee los granos básicos para realizar las ventas y por este motivo es que solicita un crédito para la compra de dichos granos básicos para dar lugar a la respectiva venta y así obtener sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan C. lives in the town of El Sauce in the department of León. He works very hard at selling dry goods such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, and sorghum. Juan sells these products in bulk to different grocery stores in town.

The situation he is facing is that he does not have enough merchandise to sell. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy basic grains in order to continue making sales and earning income to maintain his household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 45 años, vive feliz en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Salvador (51), y sus dos hijos Juan (18) y Frank (14).

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de diversos postres, prepara tortas, kekes, bocaditos, cremoladas, yogures y helados; los cuales ofrece a sus vecinos. A María le gusta mezclar ingredientes y probar sabores nuevos, aunque acepta que al principio dudó en aprender repostería, pero con el tiempo le ha ido gustando hasta convertirse en su pasión, pues sus dulces son deliciosos y muy solicitados.
Por otro lado, el negocio le genera buenas ganancias, con las que puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar; lo que le incomoda es no tener un local para vender sus postres, pues por el momento los reparte según los pedidos, y esta no es una labor muy fácil.
Como es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene pensado para el futuro tener una tienda donde venda diversas cosas y también pueda ofrecer sus postres con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura será muy responsable en cada una de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para sus postres, además de unos moldes para empezar a innovar en sus tortas y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives happily in her own home with her husband Salvador (age 51) and their two children, Juan (age 18) and Frank (age 14).

For the past year, María has been selling a variety of desserts such as pastries, “kekes” (traditional Peruvian cakes), petits fours, milkshakes, yogurts, and ice cream. She offers these treats to her neighbors. Maria enjoys combining different ingredients to come up with new flavors. At first she was unsure whether she could learn how to bake, but over time she has come to enjoy this passion and now produces delicious sweets that are in great demand. Her business generates good profits, which allows her to help with the household expenses. What bothers María is not having a place to sell her desserts. For the moment, she produces sweets based on orders and the work is not easy. Since she is a hardworking and enterprising woman, María plans in the future to have a store where she can sell different items and also be able to offer her desserts with greater peace of mind.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. María is careful to be responsible with each of her payments. With the money being requested, she plans to buy ingredients in bulk for making desserts as well as molds for designing new cakes so that she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & dessert molds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motor-pump

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Este cliente es ganadero de la zona de Cosiguina es casado y padre de 03 hijos los cuales a mantenido siempre con la crianza de ganado 
 El crédito lo solicita para ampliar su hato ganadero y por ende aumentar sus ingresos. En la foto se observa con uno de los novillos de desarrollo los cuales se encuentran en su finca de 5 manzanas donde efectúa la inversión
texts.en:
This client is a farmer in the Cosiguina zone. He is married and a father of 3 children, who he supports with what he grows on the farm. The credit he is soliciting is to grow his herd of livestock and in that way increase his earnings. In the photo he is shown with one of his steers that is developing on his farm, 5 blocks away from where he plans to implement his investment.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of livestock to produce milk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a single parent living with six dependants. Comfort makes and sells palm kernel oil at Elmina. She has a junior high education. Comfort has been producing palm kernel oil for sale for some time now. She uses her income to feed, clothe and provide shelter for the family. Comfort will add the loan to her money to acquire a palm nut plantation where every fruit harvested on the plantation will belong to her, though she might not be necessarily be the owner of the plot of land. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to use it to pay school fees for her dependants.
 
To prepare her palm kernel oil, she shells off the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut and separating the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation has been largely superseded by the use of nut-cracking machines.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is periodically skimmed from the top as the heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.

loans.use: To acquire a palm nuts plantation.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en: N. A. is an active citizen of a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her husband, M. Altaf, has been an animal seller for the past 15 years, having acquired his knowledge from his father, who was in the same profession. He receives orders mainly from the butcher shops whose owners realize that to compromise on quality would mean a loss of customers. The shop owners deal with M. because they have full confidence in him. Therefore, N. is applying for a loan to expand her husband's animal-selling business.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia M. C., es soltera tiene cinco hijos dos menores de edad viven con ella, habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín chamorro, su negocio opera en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. 
La señora María Antonia M. C. tiene un  años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
La señora María Antonia M. C., es soltera tiene cinco hijos dos menores de edad viven con ella, habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín chamorro, su negocio opera en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. La señora María Antonia M. C. tiene un años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de  productos para la venta

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en:
Umjima M. sells beer from home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Umjima is 21 years-old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and buy fridges.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase beer to sell.

loans.name: Nakinyuguzi 2 Kakembo Hellen Group

texts.en: Hellen K.  is a hardworking businesswoman of fifty years, married with five children who are in school. She has four other dependents, two of whom are in  school. Hellen has a poultry business which she has been running for over ten years. She will use her loan to purchase poultry feed for her business.  Hellen is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 32 years old, is married and has two infant children. Vivian owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been involved in farming for more than a few years already. In 2009, Vivian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Jessica de 23 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Las Cumbres en el puerto de Manta, está casada por ahora no tiene hijos por un problema de salud, pero no descarta la posibilidad de ser madre en algún momento.

El esposo de nuestra socia Jessica es de la ciudad de Esmeraldas se radicó en la provincia de Manabí cuando se caso, el tiene como negocio una ebanistería cuenta con su propio taller, realiza trabajo como mesas, puertas en fino acabado, también tiene un camión de mudanza y lo contratan  fuera de la ciudad.  La señora Jessica es una profesional se graduó de físico matemática pero nunca ejerció su carreara, ella no se quedo con los brazos cruzados porque tomó la iniciativa de vender productos de Avon y tener una tienda en su propia casa, el negocio de Avon lo tiene desde hace 2 años, la manera de vender es recorriendo la cuidad y vendiendo a sus amigas y conocidos del sector, dejando a crédito.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Jessica podrá invertir en sus negocios, una parte en los productos de Avon como perfumes, shampoo y maquillaje y surtir su tienda como en arroz, aceites, azúcar y demás productos necesarios, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder incrementar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica is 23 years old and is a member of the Las Cumbres (The Summits) Communal Bank, located in the port city of Manta. She is married and does not yet have any children due to a health problem, but she thinks she might like to be a mother in the future. Jessica's husband is originally from the city of Esmeraldas, but moved to Manabi province when they married. He has his own cabinet-making workshop, where he makes finely finished doors, tables and other items. He also has a moving truck, so he is often hired to work outside the city. Jessica has a professional degree in mathematical physics, but she has never worked in this field. However, she has never sat still, and took the initiative to start selling Avon products and open a store in her home. She has been selling Avon products for the past 2 years, and travels throughout the city to sell items on credit to her friends and acquaintances. With this loan, Jessica will invest in her businesses. She will use part of the money to buy Avon products like perfume, shampoo and makeup, and the other part to buy more merchandise for her store (like rice, sugar, oil, and other necessary products). Her dreams is to expand her business so that she can earn more in profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy makeup, shampoo, perfume, rice and sugar

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María C. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive por el sector del mercado 12 de Abril en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus iglesias, su gastronomía y muchos encantos más que hacen de esta una ciudad especial.

Nuestra socia tiene de 53 años de edad es madre soltera y con su trabajo ha logrado criar a sus 5 hijos quienes  ya son todos mayores de edad, 2 casados y 3 solteros todos trabajan y viven de manera independiente,  sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, no tiene  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y confitería en las escuelas de lunes a viernes, entrega su producto en los bares de las escuelas y también vende en las entradas y salidas de los mismos, los fines de semana vende su producto en distintas parroquias, esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años, una amiga que es socia del bankito le ha invitado a la misma y agradece mucho ya que los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando mas frutas y confitería.

Su meta es tener su casa propia y también llegar a tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Señora María C. is a member of the Buscando el Éxito (Seeking Success) Community Bank. She lives in the 12 de Abril Market area of Cuenca, a city famous for its beautiful architecture, churches, excellent food, and other attractions. María is 53 years old and a single mother. Through hard work, she has managed to raise five children, all of whom are now adults. Two are married, and three are single. They all have jobs and live away from home but help their mother financially. María does not own a home so she rents accommodation. María earns her living by selling fruit and candy in schools during the week. She delivers her products to the school shops and also sells the goods at the gates of the schools. At weekends she travels to different parishes to make her sales. She’s been doing this work for thirty years. Three years ago a friend, who is a member of the Bank, invited her to join. She is very grateful as the loans have helped her with the business. This new loan will be used to buy more fruit and candy. María’s goal is to own a house and to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and candy

loans.name: Saray

texts.en: Mrs. Saray A., 29, married woman and she is a villager who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Sytha Bo, is a construction worker. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support her husband work place, Mrs. Saray A. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorbike for husband transportation. This couple has four children; three are students and also support their mother with the farm while another one, age 4, is not yet in school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for husband transportation

loans.name: Kani

texts.en:
Kani S. is currently in the business of selling beans, pulses (e.g. groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) and dried fish and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes to sell.

Kani is 39 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional cassettes for sale
